description:
Come enjoy this 2BR/2BA apartment in a new building in downtown Chicago, professionally managed by Kasa. 
Amenities include: 
*Lounge on rooftop deck*
*Relax in the comfortable king-sized bed* 
*Cook and enjoy wonderful cuisine with the modern high-end kitchen* 
*Browse the web and stream HD video with ultra high-speed internet*

House Rules: 
We created Kasa to be your home on the road.  We’re committed to being great neighbors and strictly enforce these House Rules to ensure the comfort and safety of our community. NO Smoking - Smoking of any kind (including tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes, vape pens, and hookahs) is never allowed at this property. This applies to the entire apartment (including the balcony or patio), as well as all common and outdoor areas of the building. Kasa apartments may be monitored with marijuana and tobacco sensors. Noise - At all times, Kasa guests may not disturb their neighbors’ quiet enjoyment. In addition, guests must observe quiet hours from 9:00 p.m. to 8:00 a.m.  Parties and large gatherings are prohibited.  Kasa apartments are proactively monitored with decibel sensors for compliance with this noise policy.   Occupancy – Each Kasa has a maximum occupancy limit. There can be no more than the specified number of guests on the premises at any given time. Large gatherings are not permitted.  Lost and Found - Kasa assumes no liability for lost, misplaced, stolen, or damaged belongings, including any belongings which are left in the unit after your departure time has passed.  Pets –With the exception of service animals, breed and pet restrictions are imposed by the building management. Requests to bring a pet must be approved by Kasa prior to booking. $15 Daily pet fee per day will apply. Pet fees are not included in the total reservation price. If you are authorized to bring a pet, an additional pet fee will be applied after the booking is complete. Kasa has a 1 pet per apartment limit.  Return of Fobs & Keys – All designated fobs, keys, and parking passes must be left in the apartment upon check out.  Failure to do so will result in an immediate replacement fee of up to $250.00 per item. Please alert Kasa staff immediately if any items are missing at the beginning of your stay.   Infestation - If Kasa determines that you have brought any infestation into the unit or onto the premises, Kasa reserves the right to charge you for any and all costs and expenses that Kasa deems necessary to address the infestation.  Parking at Own Risk - All vehicles parked on the premises must be registered with Kasa prior to arrival. Vehicles are parked at the risk of the owner. Kasa shall not assume liability or responsibility for any vehicle, occupants, or contents while operated or parked on the property.  Damaged or Missing Property - Guests are liable for any damage and/or theft at the unit, premises, or property caused by the guest, their visitors, or other persons present in the unit during the guest’s stay. This includes damage to rooms, fixtures, furnishings and equipment (such as towels, artwork, electronics, and kitchen equipment). Kasa reserves the right to charge guests for 120% of such amounts as it shall in its sole discretion deem necessary to compensate or make good the costs or expenses incurred or suffered by Kasa as a result of the damage and/or theft. Charges may include but are not limited to: all property damage; missing or damaged items; smoking fee; cleaning fee; and guest compensation.  Identity Verification - To protect against identity theft and fraud, and for the safety of other guests and neighbors in the community, you will be required to provide a scanned or photographed copy of your valid, government-issued photo ID during the virtual check-in process for the purpose of performing a background check or screening.  Use - The unit and amenity areas shall not be used for any unlawful or illegal purpose. No nails, screws, or other items may be driven into any portion of the unit. Guests shall use the unit for residential purposes only. Guests shall not conduct any commercial, industrial, or retail activity in the unit.  Client Accommodation Agreement - Prior to arrival, all guests must agree to abide by the Kasa Stay Rules, which will be provided to the guest for review and signature during the virtual check-in process. Security Deposit – Non-compliance with the House Rules and Kasa Stay Rules could result in a penalty and/or forfeiture of the Security Deposit and/or eviction without a refund.

additional_house_rules:
My rules are simple, we want visitors to relax, make themselves at home and respect this space that we love so much! Oh and....
***$500 fee for LOST KEYS.
***Absolutely NO ANIMALS
***Absolutely NO SMOKING in apartment or building. 
***Please don't hang out in the hallways.
***No PARTIES and NO LOUD MUSIC. Neighbors will complain.
***Please turn off all ELECTRICITY and AIR or HEAT when leaving
***Leave the KEYS on counter, the door will lock behind you.
Most of all have a SAFE TRIP HOME, thank you for staying and leaving the condo is amazing shape.
PLEASE when asked to review your stay, DO NOT ANSWER ANY PUBLIC VIEWS FOR OTHERS TO SEE!!!.  We have plenty, just answer the PERSONAL and AIRBNB so we know how much you loved your stay and hospitality.  We will give you a great review and hope to see you again soon.

description:
One bedroom,1 bathroom..

McCormick Place.

The Lake Shore path for biking, running, or walking is accessible just two blocks south or four blocks north.  The trail runs from Hyde Park to Sheridan - over twenty miles of playground right outside your door.

This penthouse has 14 foot ceilings.  The bedroom has a queen bed  with a walk-in closet.  You are also able to sleep 2 more on a queen double high air mattress in the den/office.  Washer and dryer in condo.  1 parking spot in the garage is included.

Easy access to public transportation —

Lots of great restaurants are within walking distance — Italian, sushi, Mexican, Pizza, Hungarian, deli — it's all right here in the burgeoning South Loop.

Within walking distance of McCormick Convention Center, Museums, CTA Trains and Busses, Major Grocery Chain and many excellent restaurants.

Major CTA Train station 5 blocks away and major bus route 1/2 block away.

There are the City Bike rentals two blocks away for easy access to most of the city, Navy Pier and Magnificent Mile Shopping as well as the Rush Street restaurants just a bit farther north.
house_rules:
My rules are simple, we want visitors to relax, make themselves at home and respect this space that we love so much! Oh and....
***$500 fee for LOST KEYS.
***Absolutely NO ANIMALS
***Absolutely NO SMOKING in apartment or building. 
***Please don't hang out in the hallways.
***No PARTIES and NO LOUD MUSIC. Neighbors will complain.
***Please turn off all ELECTRICITY and AIR or HEAT when leaving
***Leave the KEYS on counter, the door will lock behind you.
Most of all have a SAFE TRIP HOME, thank you for staying and leaving the condo is amazing shape.
PLEASE when asked to review your stay, DO NOT ANSWER ANY PUBLIC VIEWS FOR OTHERS TO SEE!!!.  We have plenty, just answer the PERSONAL and AIRBNB so we know how much you loved your stay and hospitality.  We will give you a great review and hope to see you again soon.

description:
BRAND-NEW MATTRESS!

Large, comfortable 1 bedroom/1 bathroom walk-up in Chicago's East Lakeview neighborhood, walkable to Wrigley Field and Lake Michigan.

Steps away from Chicago's lakefront and public transportation.

Vintage unit with unique architecture and a balcony overlooking a well-kept landscape. Comfortable towels, sheets, and pillowcases are included. 

High-Definition antenna for the television, including DVR and Netflix.

Use of kitchen allowed. Please note: Kitchen and bathroom are not modernized, keeping with vintage feel of unit.

You will have uninterrupted use of my space; however, please do not move ANY furniture or furnishings.

I will not be present during your stay; however I am available if any needs arise.

East Lakeview, bordering Lincoln Park - Home of Wrigley Field and our LGBTQ+ neighborhood, Boystown.

Steps away from Chicago's Lakefront, with plenty of options to bike, walk or run. 

Several diverse restaurants and bars, as well as other retail shops and parks. 

Free, no-zoned parking on residential streets; metered parking on commercial streets.

Bus Routes: (phone number hidden)

Train Lines: Brown and Purple Line Station (Diversey) with access to Red, Blue, Orange, Green and Pink from there.

I want you to feel at home, so if there is anything you need at all, please don't hesitate to ask. I will do my best to provide you with the most comfortable accommodations. 

Accommodating guest requests is one of my favorite parts about hosting! 

Prices are often negotiable.

access: You will receive check-in instructions a few days before your trip with information on how to access the home, WiFi info and parking info!
description:
Welcome to our artsy 1 BDR loft in Wicker Park! Enjoy a cozy room to yourself or with a small group on a quiet tree lined street as you explore Chicago or get some work done on a business trip! You are near the blue line train for easy access to O'Hare airport and downtown if needed.  A brand new walking trail is nearby if you're looking for a scenic walk in our beautiful city and you're near plenty of nightlife and restaurants!

Our space has all that's needed for your trip! As you walk-in to the unit, you'll notice the high ceilings and spacious atmosphere of the apartment. The living room is equipped with a couch that can sleep 1 and also a smart TV giving you access to Netflix, Hulu and more for all your streaming needs. We thoughtfully designed the space with pieces of decor to give an artsy vibe. 

To the left of the living room is our fully-stocked, simple kitchen for you to cook a meal if needed. Adjacent is a full bathroom for your use.

Your massive king sized bed is upstairs in the lofted part of the apartment. There is a desk as well in case you would like to get some work done!

You will receive check-in instructions a few days before your trip with information on how to access the home, WiFi info and parking info!

We are offsite but available if needed.

One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just outside downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.

The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate-pleasing nightcaps like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour.

Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up shop to satisfy the on-trend crowds.

The Western blue line train stop is about a 10-15 min walk and will give you easy access to the airport and downtown. If you have your own car,  highway 90/94 is 10 mins away. 

There are also plenty of Ubers/Lyfts around if needed!

There is free street parking alongside our street. Because this is a loft, the ceiling height is a little low upstairs where the bedroom is. If you are 6' and over, you will have to crouch upstairs. Sorry about this inconvenience, we hope you still find the place adequate!

description:
Please note that pictures are of a similar Domio unit in Chicago.

Complete your Chicago experience by staying in this elegant home! Centrally located in the heart of Chicago, this stunning space was thoughtfully designed to capture local flair and make you feel at home. Whether traveling solo, with friends, or with family, see the best of art, architecture, and cuisine that Chicago has to offer and have an unforgettable experience staying at this Domio.

All Domios are designed with style and comfort in mind and this space is no different. This 2 bedroom and 2 bath home boasts a brand new living room, luxury furniture, and customized finishes. In addition to a fully-stocked kitchen with state-of-the-art appliances, guests will be pleased to find hand-picked decor and artwork throughout the home. 

Bedroom 1:
Queen bed

Bedroom 2:
Queen bed

Common Area:
Sofa bed
Air mattress

Guests also have access to the building's fitness center.

We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

Please note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago.

access: Our studio apartment has a separate entrance and the whole apartment is private.
description:
This large studio apartment features two queen beds, full kitchen, en suite bathroom and private entrance. Centrally located on our quiet, tree-line street just a block from restaurants, bars, shops and cafes. A true city gem!

This large studio apartment is located on the lower level of a historic home.  It includes 2 queen-sized beds, full eat-in kitchen, and private bath.  Enjoy staying in a premier neighborhood just blocks away from all the action!  We're also just minutes away from downtown, United Center and Wrigley Field.

Our studio apartment has a separate entrance and the whole apartment is private.

We are a fully staffed Bed & Breakfast. Our office is open 7am - 9pm, Mon - Fri and 8am - 8pm, Sat & Sun.

Wicker Park is a thriving community full of restaurants, bars, shops, and cafes along with beautiful historic and newly-remodeled homes on quiet tree-lined streets.  Just minutes away from downtown, guests can easily experience Chicago attractions or catch a game at Wrigley Field or a show at the United Center.  The apartment is centrally located and close to many popular spots in Chicago.  Come stay and live like a local!

We are blocks away from the nearest train station and a block from the Milwaukee Ave bus.  Both take you directly into downtown.  You can also rent a Divvy bike or electric scooter or request an Uber, Lyft or hail a cab.  A car is not needed to get around town.

We offer secure parking and a full breakfast each morning at the B&B. Ask about adding these amenities to your reservation for an additional fee.

access: Guests can access the entire apartment, in addition to the garden. Guests can use the washer and dryer in the basement of the building.
description:
Our apartment is a nice place to relax and a great launching pad for exploring Chicago. Located in between Logan Square and Avonadale, the neighborhood offers easy access to some of the best restaurants, bars and attractions in the city. 

The apartment is recently renovated and offers everything you need to feel at home while on vacation. Common spaces have great light and bedrooms have large, comfy beds.

We look forward to having you and excited to share our space.

All spaces in the apartment are shared with our guests. Guests are invited to use fridge, closets and dressers for storage.

Guests can access the entire apartment, in addition to the garden. Guests can use the washer and dryer in the basement of the building.

We live in the apartment above the guest apartment and will be regularly available to assist should it be needed.

Many great spots are in easy walking distance. Cermak grocery and 7-11 (24hrs) for basics. Sleeping Village is one of the best bars in the city. Brew Brew for great coffee. Some of the best Mexican restaurants in the city as well.

Parking is easily available on our street. About a 12 minute walk to the Blue line to downtown and O'hare. Buses to anywhere around the corner.

A note to potential guests: While I strive to provide a clean environment for our guests I must emphasize that 1) a dog lives in the apartment and there will undoubtedly be stray hairs missed in cleaning and 2) The above unit is under construction and there is some noise during the daytime. There also may be some dust in the common areas of the building. We've priced the apartment at such a low rate to account for these factors. If you think that either of these facts may effect the overall value of your experience I encourage you check out other listings in the area. Thanks for understanding and happy to answer any questions related to the above.

additional_house_rules:
Our goal is to make sure everyone is treated fairly and in consideration of others, so there are just a few things to be aware of so everyone has a great stay.

While you have a private bedroom, please keep in mind that others will want to use the common areas after you, so please don't leave them your mess. Also, if you happen to break something or something isn't working right, please let me know so I can fix it right away. Also, it's a shared kitchen, so please don't eat/drink food that isn't yours, if you need advice on where to buy food in the neighborhood, just ask.

Overall, the best way to think about how you should treat a home on airBNB is just like the camping rule: "Leave no trace".

Quiet times for the lower, 2nd/3rd floors is after 10pm on weeknights, midnight on weekends. It's a big space however (~7000 sq ft) and you are welcome to use the common areas late as needed as long as you are respectful of other guests. We simply ask that you to leave things how you found them.

Also, NO PARTIES, NO EVENTS, NO PHOTOSHOOTS. Do not book if you are planning on one. Both myself and staff live at the house full time, so please don't create a difficult situation for us. Having some drinks, playing pool, and casual gatherings for dinner, etc. is of course welcomed and encouraged (and in many cases others in the house may join you if welcomed!). But if you are inviting more then a friend or two that aren't staying with you at the house as part of your reservation, or create a disruption for other guests, your reservation will be cancelled without refund and you will be forced to vacate the premises immediately.

Please be sure to declare the correct number of guests for your stay. If you have anyone doing anything more then meeting you exclusively in the common areas, they need to be a registered guest. If you are found to have others with you that are not part of your guest count on airbnb, your reservation will be cancelled immediately, and without refund due to fee circumvention which is in direct violation of airBNB's terms of service.

For the safety of everyone, the home security system includes cameras that are installed in/around the home. This helps to protect your personal belongings while you are out, and increases your personal safety during your stay. They record everyone coming to/from the home, and monitor all of the common/public areas around the home. Please note that cameras are NOT installed in any private areas of the home, including bedrooms/bathrooms. The security setup is identical to those used at any boutique hotel or similar property where there are multiple guests occupying a single shared space.

Also, keep in mind that East Garfield Park is a neighborhood undergoing urban renewal. It's still a majority minority area with pockets of poverty which can be unsettling for some, but after living here for five years and hosting over 1000 guests on Airbnb, there have been no incidents of crime that have impacted me or any guests staying here. Many guests have actually commented on the fact that they were very glad for the opportunity to live in a real neighborhood of Chicago that was less then 20 minutes from downtown, giving them an opportunity away from the touristy areas when they wanted.

Like any area, with the exception of a few people everyone is generally friendly and helpful, please be respectful and treat everyone with respect, and they will gladly do so in return.

access: The entire home except remaining private rooms are available. This includes the kitchen, dining room, billiards room, parlor, laundry room, and of course common bathrooms.
description:
This room is in the lower level of Fort Washington, a Richardsonian Romanesque mansion. Brick/Limestone walls create a cozy room a perfect retreat after a long day in Chicago. Sleeps up to 4 people on the king bed with sleeper sofa.

Easy unmetered street parking is readily available for those coming by car.

Full size kitchen, multiple living/outdoor areas, and laundry machines are available for use as well.

My other rooms are listed here: https://www.airbnb.com/users/22608682/listings

The space is in an old victorian era (c.1895) limestone/brick mansion located on Chicago's west side in the East Garfield Park neighborhood. It overlooks Washington Blvd. and is about a block from the Kedzie Green Line Train.

Please note if you book, this is an old house, with over 125 years of living. This means lumps, bumps, scratches, and things in general that are less then perfect. Most people enjoy this character of a house, and it's why they book.

I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. Public transit options (train, bus, bike share) available about a block away.

The entire home except remaining private rooms are available. This includes the kitchen, dining room, billiards room, parlor, laundry room, and of course common bathrooms.

While I live at the house, there is a chance we may never cross paths during your stay due to the size of the home. 

I'm always available via messages/phone, so if anything comes up, let me know! I assume everything is going well unless it's brought to my attention.

I'm happy to provide advice on where to eat, how to get around, and where to shop, just ask!

The area itself is undergoing redevelopment. This doesn't mean boutique coffee instead of national chain coffee, it means Chicago and it’s outlying neighborhoods are mixed bags, on my block you’ll have $500,000 homes next to a boarded up one. 

If you are looking for a great place close to everything but with tons of room typically unknown for a city house, this is it. 

The house is very close to the Garfield Park Conservatory for reference.  You'll need to order delivery or take a train for restaurants, but it's all less then 20 minutes away.

The house is about 1 block from the Kedzie green line station. It’s 20 minutes from downtown and about 45 from either airport. There is ample street parking in front of the home for those arriving by car.

I mention this in the neighborhood section of my listing as well, but it's worth repeating here. 

Please do your research and know where you are booking. I've lived here for over 7 years and never had a concern for my own safety or that of the thousands of my guests.

Also, please note that I don't have keyed locks on interior doors of the home. If this is a problem for you, please don't book. I trust you, the guest, with my single most valuable asset and all of my personal belongings. I have never been given a reason to doubt that trust in this community, but if you plan on breaking that trust, please don't book.
house_rules:
Our goal is to make sure everyone is treated fairly and in consideration of others, so there are just a few things to be aware of so everyone has a great stay.

While you have a private bedroom, please keep in mind that others will want to use the common areas after you, so please don't leave them your mess. Also, if you happen to break something or something isn't working right, please let me know so I can fix it right away. Also, it's a shared kitchen, so please don't eat/drink food that isn't yours, if you need advice on where to buy food in the neighborhood, just ask.

Overall, the best way to think about how you should treat a home on airBNB is just like the camping rule: "Leave no trace".

Quiet times for the lower, 2nd/3rd floors is after 10pm on weeknights, midnight on weekends. It's a big space however (~7000 sq ft) and you are welcome to use the common areas late as needed as long as you are respectful of other guests. We simply ask that you to leave things how you found them.

Also, NO PARTIES, NO EVENTS, NO PHOTOSHOOTS. Do not book if you are planning on one. Both myself and staff live at the house full time, so please don't create a difficult situation for us. Having some drinks, playing pool, and casual gatherings for dinner, etc. is of course welcomed and encouraged (and in many cases others in the house may join you if welcomed!). But if you are inviting more then a friend or two that aren't staying with you at the house as part of your reservation, or create a disruption for other guests, your reservation will be cancelled without refund and you will be forced to vacate the premises immediately.

Please be sure to declare the correct number of guests for your stay. If you have anyone doing anything more then meeting you exclusively in the common areas, they need to be a registered guest. If you are found to have others with you that are not part of your guest count on airbnb, your reservation will be cancelled immediately, and without refund due to fee circumvention which is in direct violation of airBNB's terms of service.

For the safety of everyone, the home security system includes cameras that are installed in/around the home. This helps to protect your personal belongings while you are out, and increases your personal safety during your stay. They record everyone coming to/from the home, and monitor all of the common/public areas around the home. Please note that cameras are NOT installed in any private areas of the home, including bedrooms/bathrooms. The security setup is identical to those used at any boutique hotel or similar property where there are multiple guests occupying a single shared space.

Also, keep in mind that East Garfield Park is a neighborhood undergoing urban renewal. It's still a majority minority area with pockets of poverty which can be unsettling for some, but after living here for five years and hosting over 1000 guests on Airbnb, there have been no incidents of crime that have impacted me or any guests staying here. Many guests have actually commented on the fact that they were very glad for the opportunity to live in a real neighborhood of Chicago that was less then 20 minutes from downtown, giving them an opportunity away from the touristy areas when they wanted.

Like any area, with the exception of a few people everyone is generally friendly and helpful, please be respectful and treat everyone with respect, and they will gladly do so in return.

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- Private balcony
- In-suite laundry
- Sleeper sofa
- Fully equipped kitchen 

Building amenities
- Fitness room

South Loop highlights
- Walkability score: 92
- 7 minute walk to Eleven City Diner (our favorite brunch spot)
- 3 minute walk to The Scout Waterhouse + Kitchen (catch a game and enjoy some American pub grub)

Getting around
- 7 minute walk to Roosevelt 'L' Station 
- 13 minute drive to Navy Pier
- 28 minute drive to MDW Airport
- 77 minute drive to ORD Airport

The South Loop is a vibrant blend of notable attractions, beautiful parks, and stunning Lake Michigan views. Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.

The patio is currently closed for renovations.

Exact views from the apartment are not guaranteed, the views could vary from the pictures listed.

There’s no cable. We’ve provided a Chromecast for streaming.
house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.

Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive

description:
1 Level Private Front Door Entry Unit. Newer Furnishings throughout. 
1 Bed/1 Bath in Lincoln Park’s Terra Cotta Village townhome community. Open floorplan in living/dining & kitchen. Breakfast Counter, stainless steel appls. King Size bed & lots of closets, beautiful bathroom. In-unit washer/dryer. Attached private garage right into unit.  Price includes TV Cable & Internet.   Gas & Electric are additional. Copies of these bills will be given to guest/tenant for their time for reimbursement.

Guest parking available in private parking area.  Easy additional parking on quiet neighborhood tree lined street.

Available June 15, 2019.  30 day minimum stays.  Month to month leases ok.

Beautiful and quiet Lincoln Park area.

additional_house_rules:
1. Prohibited: Video Shooting, bring people that is not in the reservation to visit you or to stay over, Small gatherings, family reunions, birthdays parties or any kind of celebrations. 
2. No smoke inside the house or building (any kind) 
3. Respect other Airbnb guests, belongings, food and other rooms.
4. Be quiet in the house and in the building anytime specially after 9pm. You can listen music / movies with earphones, don’t cook / talk / yell / scream / cry /laugh laud. Don’t make any sounds that could be uncomfortable to other guests.
5. Checkout from your room is by 10am and our checkout is firm because our team schedule. Checkout from your room after this time will end in extra 30$. Checkout after 11am will end in extra 60$. Checkout after 12pm will end in an open  file in airbnb plus 60$ fee (2 hours paid for management team) and your belongings would have to be removed since another guest will be checking in.
6. If you use the kitchen, microwave, oven, plates, pans, pots, glasses, cups, kitchen table, living room table, coffee maker, fridge, etc.. you have to leave it clean. Don’t use curry or strong spices, turn on the kitchen the ventilation every time you cook. Don’t use OVEN. Don’t cook after 9pm or before 7am. 
7. After use the shower / bathtub clean the hairs you left. Take your own amenities with you. Don’t leave it in the bathroom.
8. Booking for somebody else is not allowed unless agreed before booking.
9. Is not aloud sleep in common areas. 
10. Please don’t leave personal items in the bathroom(s). 
11. If you damage or lost any key the fee is 45$. 
12. We will send you missing items if you want but it will be 40$ plus shipping.

Ps: keys and missing items fees are: 20$ hourly rate of our manager plus 20$ Uber (go and return) plus the key or the shipping)

access: You can use everything in the kitchen except the oven.. We have, plates, coffee maker, silverware, etc but every time you use it you need to leave everything clean ! You can use living room but you can’t close it and nobody can sleep there as it’s a common area ! We provide 1 hair dryer per room, iron. You will have WiFi, clean towels  (1 per person in the whole stay) , pillows (1 per person ) sheets and comforter (1 per mattress)  , Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.
description:
Unbeatable location in right in front of United Center and next to Downtown 

This is the perfect spot if you want to go to an event at United Center because in less than 2 min walking you will be there! Also it’s pretty close to Downtown and to Rush and The Illinois Medical District! 

Please make sure you read the WHOLE listing advertisement , houses rules and cancelation policy before you book this place so you can know what to expect ! We manage private rooms and entire places in Chicago!

You will have a comfortable Full over Full Size bunked Bed in a private room! We want you feel very safe so your room is going to have its own lock and key and there are cameras in common areas. 

This is a private room in a shared place with other Airbnb guests and because of that we expect to keep the house  very quiet, specially after 9pm.

There are 3 rooms in the house and 1 bathrooms! 

If you are driving the private spot is 20$ per night (up to 2 cars )  or the permit 10$ per night per car (ask if your preference is available) 

*I only accept payments through Airbnb platform*

You can use everything in the kitchen except the oven.. We have, plates, coffee maker, silverware, etc but every time you use it you need to leave everything clean ! You can use living room but you can’t close it and nobody can sleep there as it’s a common area ! We provide 1 hair dryer per room, iron. You will have WiFi, clean towels  (1 per person in the whole stay) , pillows (1 per person ) sheets and comforter (1 per mattress)  , Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.

My team and I will be for you trough airbnb app , so if you book with us make sure you download the app and always text us here and we will try to answer as fast as we can.

This place is very close to Downtown Chicago, and west loop where you can find  amazing restaurants and good bars, public transportation (buses ) are pretty close too!

The style of everything inside the house is modern, cozy and minimalist! It’s a great place if you wan to be close of the Chicago’s most common attractions but our rooms are small and also common areas.. We selected a kind of frame where you can put your luggage under it if you want to have more space . Also our rooms has a small portable organizer or a closet, a tiny table and stool and a table lamp.

Parking is such a tough situation in Chicago. In this spot you will need either to rent our private spot or to have the stickers for parking on the street ! Just make sure 1) you read all signs posted in the street/ trees or fences that says information about street cleaning , reparation, disabilities parking, school days, permit parking, etc 2) you are not over the crosswalk, near a hydrant, or wrong way.

Illinois Medical District Blue Line stop  is just 8 min walking (this train works 24 hours and go from and to O’hare Airport and Downtown Chicago) and also buses 20 and 50 (2 min walking ) , 126 bus (6 min away walking) . United Center is 2min walking, Illinois Medical District - Rush and Cook County are 15-20 min walking. McCormick Place is 17min far by car/Uber. Grant Park is 13 by car/35mi  by public transportation. The Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and the Planetarium is 20 min far by car/47 min by public transportation.Navy Pier is 21 min far by car/42min by public transportation. Greyhound Bus Station is 11min far by car/17min by public transportation. O’hare is 48 min far by car/1h02 min by public transportation. Midway Airport is 35 min by car/54min by public transportation. Uber are very cheap 5-12$ to those places (not the airport) specially if you choose the pool option!

The room is private but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, and the bathroom/s) with other Airbnb guests. Bathroom could get crowds as we have 1 bathrooms and three bedrooms.. A private studio in the area usually cost over 150$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being right in front United Center and close to downtown, surrounding great public transportation this could be a great option for you!  


As most houses in United States this is not made with concrete so you will hear people walking or outside sounds. It doesn’t bother most of the guest but if you are a very light sleeper maybe you should choose an entire place. or have an earphone or something to block the sound.

We have cameras ON in common areas. We don’t have any camera / devices in private spaces as bedrooms or bathrooms. 

Is forbidden in this place: parties, small gatherings, to bring people who are not in the reservation neither as a visitor nor to stay over, family reunions, birthdays celebration, video shooting,  being noisy anytime but specially after 9pm, smoke and bring pets. 

We work based in all airbnb policies, terms and conditions including cancelation policy, so makes sure before you book to read carefully houses rules, cancelation policy and what is offered and what is not offered for us!

BREAKING ANY RULE OR DOING ANY ILLEGAL ACTIVITY WILL END UP IN A IMMEDIATE CANCELLATION OF YOUR RESERVATION AND YOU WILL HAVE TO LEAVE THE PLACE IMMEDIATELY. Our top one priority is our guests’ security and provide a quiet stay!
interaction: My team and I will be for you trough airbnb app , so if you book with us make sure you download the app and always text us here and we will try to answer as fast as we can.
neighborhood_overview:
This place is very close to Downtown Chicago, and west loop where you can find  amazing restaurants and good bars, public transportation (buses ) are pretty close too!

The style of everything inside the house is modern, cozy and minimalist! It’s a great place if you wan to be close of the Chicago’s most common attractions but our rooms are small and also common areas.. We selected a kind of frame where you can put your luggage under it if you want to have more space . Also our rooms has a small portable organizer or a closet, a tiny table and stool and a table lamp.
notes:
The room is private but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, and the bathroom/s) with other Airbnb guests. Bathroom could get crowds as we have 1 bathrooms and three bedrooms.. A private studio in the area usually cost over 150$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being right in front United Center and close to downtown, surrounding great public transportation this could be a great option for you!  


As most houses in United States this is not made with concrete so you will hear people walking or outside sounds. It doesn’t bother most of the guest but if you are a very light sleeper maybe you should choose an entire place. or have an earphone or something to block the sound.

We have cameras ON in common areas. We don’t have any camera / devices in private spaces as bedrooms or bathrooms. 

Is forbidden in this place: parties, small gatherings, to bring people who are not in the reservation neither as a visitor nor to stay over, family reunions, birthdays celebration, video shooting,  being noisy anytime but specially after 9pm, smoke and bring pets. 

We work based in all airbnb policies, terms and conditions including cancelation policy, so makes sure before you book to read carefully houses rules, cancelation policy and what is offered and what is not offered for us!
space:
You will have a comfortable Full over Full Size bunked Bed in a private room! We want you feel very safe so your room is going to have its own lock and key and there are cameras in common areas. 

This is a private room in a shared place with other Airbnb guests and because of that we expect to keep the house  very quiet, specially after 9pm.

There are 3 rooms in the house and 1 bathrooms! 

If you are driving the private spot is 20$ per night (up to 2 cars )  or the permit 10$ per night per car (ask if your preference is available) 

*I only accept payments through Airbnb platform*
summary:
Unbeatable location in right in front of United Center and next to Downtown 

This is the perfect spot if you want to go to an event at United Center because in less than 2 min walking you will be there! Also it’s pretty close to Downtown and to Rush and The Illinois Medical District! 

Please make sure you read the WHOLE listing advertisement , houses rules and cancelation policy before you book this place so you can know what to expect ! We manage private rooms and entire places in Chicago!
transit:
Parking is such a tough situation in Chicago. In this spot you will need either to rent our private spot or to have the stickers for parking on the street ! Just make sure 1) you read all signs posted in the street/ trees or fences that says information about street cleaning , reparation, disabilities parking, school days, permit parking, etc 2) you are not over the crosswalk, near a hydrant, or wrong way.

Illinois Medical District Blue Line stop  is just 8 min walking (this train works 24 hours and go from and to O’hare Airport and Downtown Chicago) and also buses 20 and 50 (2 min walking ) , 126 bus (6 min away walking) . United Center is 2min walking, Illinois Medical District - Rush and Cook County are 15-20 min walking. McCormick Place is 17min far by car/Uber. Grant Park is 13 by car/35mi  by public transportation. The Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and the Planetarium is 20 min far by car/47 min by public transportation.Navy Pier is 21 min far by car/42min by public transportation. Greyhound Bus Station is 11min far by car/17min by public transportation. O’hare is 48 min far by car/1h02 min by public transportation. Midway Airport is 35 min by car/54min by public transportation. Uber are very cheap 5-12$ to those places (not the airport) specially if you choose the pool option!

access: There are two bedrooms available.  The spacious master bedroom has a queen size and plenty of natural light if you want it, and blackout curtains if you don't.  The second bedroom has a twin sized trundle daybed for one or two guests.  The living room has over a century of entertainment ranging from a fully functional 1908 Victrola, to a big tv, PS4, and streaming options.  You can get local stations if you futz with the antenna.  The kitchen has everything you would need to self-cater.
description:
Cozy vintage two bedroom apartment located on a safe and quiet street, just steps from trendy Andersonville and the Bryn Mawr Historic District. It has everything you need to feel at home, including a well-equipped kitchen, large screen TV with Netflix etc., wifi, and large back deck and yard with grill. One parking spot is available for a small car and the CTA Red Line train is a few blocks away.

There are two bedrooms available.  The spacious master bedroom has a queen size and plenty of natural light if you want it, and blackout curtains if you don't.  The second bedroom has a twin sized trundle daybed for one or two guests.  The living room has over a century of entertainment ranging from a fully functional 1908 Victrola, to a big tv, PS4, and streaming options.  You can get local stations if you futz with the antenna.  The kitchen has everything you would need to self-cater.

Get a taste of classic Chicago neighborhood living.  The street is lined with enormous trees planted in the late 1800s which is when my place was built.  Our block of Wayne is quiet and friendly with a mix of families, couples, and older singles. Walk a few blocks south and west and you will be in the middle of Chicago's much-beloved Andersonville shopping and dining district.  Locals take great pride in supporting each other's local businesses which gives this neighborhood an unparalleled variety of unique offerings.  Or, walk east a couple of blocks and you will be in another charming historic district (Bryn Mawr Historic District) replete with more great dining choices. From there you can hop on the "L" and be downtown in about 25 minutes by train, or keep walking east to the shores of Lake Michigan.

access: There is a coin operated washer and dryer on site. $1 for a wash, $1 for a dry cycle.
description:
Less than 5 minutes from University of Chicago's campus and hospital, 1 mile from recent President's home, ten minutes from McCormick Place, short easy drive to center city downtown. Minutes from Chicago White Sox baseball. Located in gentrifying, historic Bronzeville (equivalent to NY's Harlem). Childhood home of Nat King Cole, Quincy Jones, Lou Rawls, Minnie Ripperton and hundreds of other world famous Chicagoans. 3 min. from the interstate, 1 block from Chicago''s "El" train.

Hardwood floors throughout, large bedrooms, Amazon TV, new appliances, fantastic apartment.

There is a coin operated washer and dryer on site. $1 for a wash, $1 for a dry cycle.

Host will be available as needed.

Neighborhood is gentrifying and experiencing a Renaissance. There is lots home rehabbing and new construction in the area.

Host drives for Uber Black and provides SUV livery service for charters and individual rides for up to 7-9 riders. Inquire about rates.  About 30% discount on Uber Black SUV rates. Property is 1/2 block away from Chicago''s famous "L" train for public transportation anywhere in the city.

Unit has been remodeled and just about everything in it is new.

access: Front & rear lockable independent entries allow full & private access to the apartment with shared laundry facilities at rear of the apartment. Large back and side lawns for your pleasure.
description:
Large fully furnished 2 bedroom apartment,  private Fr. & R. entries;; full Kitchen/Bath, WiFi TV, laundry available.  Families welcome. Central location, easy access to expressway, public transportation & shopping. Ideal for extended stays.

Large luxurious living room and complete kitchen: full sized refrigerator, gas range, microwave, etc.; ceramic tile counter tops and a Bar separating it from front room. Main bedroom has a walk in closet, second bedroom could serve as an office with considerable shelving. all utilities included. Use of TV would require, Roku, NetFlix, Amazon, You Tube, HBO or other similar memberships.

Front & rear lockable independent entries allow full & private access to the apartment with shared laundry facilities at rear of the apartment. Large back and side lawns for your pleasure.

I work at home in the unit above and am available if problems arise either with the facility or for general information about surrounding facilities for example (Loyola, Mac Neal and Oak Park hospitals within in mile of the property; CTA rapid transit with UIC and O'Hare connections only a 10 to 15 minute walk).  I am gregarious and welcome conversations but also considerate and careful to honor your privacy.

Forest Park is a quiet community with a diverse population. In fourteen years here, I have not experienced any security problems. People around me are friendly.

Access to public transportation is easy and dependable. The CTA's Blue Line connects directly to O'hare from Forest Park.  However, it first makes a loop through Chicago's primary commercial center (9 miles due East) and it is thus convenient to State Street and N. Michigan Ave. Shopping as well as a number of Museums, Grant Park activities. and River tourist attractions.  By car, you have quick access to the the 290 expressway (Chicgo's belt line) and within a fifteen mile radius you can travel to Oak Brook in the west, O'Hare (NW), with other good roads to MidWay (SE), Skokie to the North of Chicago and Oak Lawn to the South.  Locally their is one grocery store less than half a block south and and another two blocks north.  The shopping center to the south also includes   a WalMart , a fitness center and numerous fast food restaurants along Roosevelt Rd.. In the Summer, the Forest Park Swimming Pool, water park and Tennis courts are five blocks due north. The Forest Park Library is also close by-just north of the expressway and the Forest Park CTA station.

Parking will have to be arranged with the village but shouldn't be a problem and I will aid in arrangements if necessary.

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the house or on the premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.
6.) Please do not use the fireplace.
7.) No food or shoes upstairs, please.

This house is best suited to a visiting family, or group of friends or colleagues.  Not a party pad!  

Lots of kids toys & games you are welcome to use.
Enjoy any of our board games or books (though don't take them with you!) 
DVD selection available for your use.  You can also stream from Netflix or Amazon on the TV.  
Kitchen pantry & fridge contain many basics and are available for your use.

access: You'll have the whole house, as well as the pleasant back patio. We have a large table & chairs to bring out if you'd like to dine al fresco!
description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

This beautiful 3BR/3BA home is full of huge windows, sky-high ceilings and wood trim, on a tree lined street. Very spacious & open. Nicely furnished with everything you'd need.
Minutes walk from all sorts of entertainment, and buses & train lines.

Spacious house can accommodate a large family while you live in and explore Lakeview and Chicago.

Experience a grand Chicago vacation at this spacious 3 bedroom, 3 bath single family home in PRIME Chicago! What you can anticipate for your stay:
• Large Private Patio. 
• Dramatic 12-14FT Ceilings
• Fully Equipped Chefs Kitchen with Cookware and Cooking Essentials
• Formal Dining Table
• All Beds Freshly Made with Clean and Crisp Linens.
• Master Bedroom - King Bed (Upstairs)
• Second Bedroom - 2 Twin Beds (Upstairs)
• Third Bedroom - Queen Bed (Downstairs)
• Air Mattress and Pack-n-Play Available Upon Request
• Three Bathrooms Stocked with Fresh Towels, Shampoo, Conditioner, and Body Wash
• Individually Controlled Heat and Air
• In-Unit Washer & Dryer
• High-speed internet
• And Much More!

You'll have the whole house, as well as the pleasant back patio. We have a large table & chairs to bring out if you'd like to dine al fresco!

Anchored by a beautiful stretch of shoreline to the east and dotted with train stops from two ‘L' lines, Lakeview is one of Chicago's liveliest and most accessible neighborhoods. Several distinct areas — East Lakeview, Central Lakeview, Boystown and Wrigleyville — meld together to form a lakefront community that celebrates diversity and boasts something for every type of visitor.

Hit the bustling commercial districts along Belmont Avenue, Lincoln Avenue, Southport Avenue, Clark Street, Halsted Street and Broadway Street to shop — be it for vintage frocks, designer jeans or leather biker gear — or live it up with the locals at the seemingly endless options for bars and pubs, and the dozens of celebrated restaurants in between.

Arts and culture come in the form of live music venues, several summer street festivals and a thriving scene for theater, dance and comedy (Belmont Theater District is a stellar collection of nearly 20 independent companies).

Not to be outdone by its extraordinary entertainment landscape, Lakeview makes full use of its slice of Lincoln Park, a 1,200-acre oasis dedicated to the outdoors. Here you will find the scenic Lakefront Trail, a golf course and driving range, a boat harbor, a bird sanctuary, tennis courts and grassy playing fields that are also perfect for picnics or just soaking in the views.

Easy access (7 minute walk!) to the Red/Brown/Purple line trains with transit all over the city, as well as many bus lines.
15 minute walk to Wrigley Field.

additional_house_rules:
1. Prohibited: Video Shooting, bring people that is not in the reservation, Small gatherings, family reunions, birthdays parties or any kind of celebrations. 
2. No smoke inside the house or building (any kind) 
3. Respect other Airbnb guests, belongings, food and other rooms.
4. Be quiet in the house and in the building specially after 9pm. 
5. Checkout from your room is by 10am and our checkout is firm becase our team schedule. Checkout from your room after this time will end in extra 30$. Checkout after 11am will end in extra 60$. Checkout after 12pm will end in an open  file in airbnb plus 60$ fee (2 hours paid for management team) and your belongings would have to be removed since another guest will be checking in.
6. If you use the kitchen, microwave, oven, plates, pans, pots, glasses, cups, kitchen table, living room table, coffee maker, fridge, etc.. you have to leave it clean
7. After use the shower / bathtub clean the hairs you left. Take your own amenities with you. Don’t leave it in the bathroom.
8. Booking for somebody else is not allowed unless agreed before booking.
9. If you damage or lost any key the fee is 45$. 
10. We will send you missing items if you want but it will be 40$ plus shipping.

Ps: keys and missing items fees are: 20$ hourly rate management plus 20$ Uber (go and return) plus the key or the shipping)

access: You can use the kitchen, oven, pan, pots, plates, coffee maker, etc! Also three bathrooms, living room, hair dryer, iron, and the pool table! You will have WiFi, clean towels, sheets, comforter, Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.
description:
This place is Located on west loop, which is actually considered Part of Downtown (has a Train station very close(7min walking/0.3miles). This train works 24/7. It goes to the heart of Downtown and also direct to the airportO’hare. My place is only 16 minutes(public transportation) to the heart of Downtown. 8-12min driving( 2.5miles). If you want to go to United Center this place is  10 min far by walk but we have one place even closer that is right in front! Please read the whole advertisement!

You will have a comfortable Queen Size Bed in a private room! You don’t need to worried about keys becase to get in the house you use a keypad and to get in your room you’ll have a small combination lock! 


There is free parking on the street but if you want to have a private spot in a private indoor garage you you could ask me if it is available for 12$ per night. 

*I only accept payments through Airbnb platform*

You can use the kitchen, oven, pan, pots, plates, coffee maker, etc! Also three bathrooms, living room, hair dryer, iron, and the pool table! You will have WiFi, clean towels, sheets, comforter, Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.

If you text me I will be there for you most of the time I’ll try to give you quick responses! If you are a tourist I will love to tell you about some places you can’t miss!

The best point about this place is how close It’s to Downtown (15 min-public transportation, 10 min-car) If you going to a Event at United Center it’s so close as well( 10 min walking). The location it’s perfect to those who goes to an interview/ research/ work at Rush Medical Center, Cook County Hospital, John H Stroger, Jr.

The room is private but you will share common areas (pool table, kitchen , living room, and the 3 bathrooms ) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd becase most of Airbnb people are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don’t spend much time in the house. A private apartment in the area usually cost over 120$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being close to downtown, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you! 

The room has a good size for the Queen size bed it has. If you want to add 3 or 4 people in the reservation I could add and extra air mattress for you with no extra charge, but then the room will become smaller for luggage becase you will have two beds on it. This is a good option if you want to save even more money otherwise you can book two rooms! 

As most of United States Houses this is not made with concrete so you will hear people walking. It doesn’t bother most of the people but if you are a very light sleeper you should choose a modern apartment (three floor apartments or traditional houses all has the same problem) or have an earphone or something for block the sound.

access: You'll have full and private access to the entire loft, and several shared bathrooms - cleaned daily - just down the hall, plus the building's laundry room.
description:
Professionally decorated loft in a building dating to the 1880s in Old Town - Exactly where you want to stay during your trip to Chicago - Ideal location for seeing everything on your list: across the street from Second City, Steppenwolf, and Lincoln Park, and 20 minutes' train ride from the Loop or Wrigley Field. There are countless restaurants nearby, plus a seasonal Farmer's Market. Pretty perfect, right? Book today!

This unit doesn't have its own bathroom, and instead shares access to several bathrooms - cleaned daily - conveniently located near the unit. One of the beds in my place is up a narrow set of stairs / step ladder.

You'll have full and private access to the entire loft, and several shared bathrooms - cleaned daily - just down the hall, plus the building's laundry room.

An incredibly popular neighborhood destination, largely because of its proximity to the lake and downtown, Old Town keeps up a lively pace day and night. Victorian-era buildings, brick alleyways and narrow, tree-lined streets are charming backdrops to a busy main strip that runs along Wells Street between North Avenue and Division Street.

My place is a few minutes' walk away from the Sedgwick Brown/Purple line train station, and equally convenient to the North Ave and LaSalle buses - it's almost more convenient to not have a car here! If you do bring your car, however, there are several garages nearby with overnight parking.

The large windows in this unit face a busy street, so you're likely to hear city noise.
house_rules:
- House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.

Victorian-era buildings, brick alleyways and narrow, tree-lined streets are charming backdrops to a busy main strip that runs along Wells Street between North Avenue and Division Street.

access: You'll have access to our backyard and patio furniture, as well as, laundry facilities.
description:
Modern studio apartment located just minutes away from Division and Damen 's hot bars and restaurants. Full bed, fully functional kitchen, dining table and a great bathroom.  Minutes from trains, interstate and downtown.  Approx $10 Uber/Lyft ride to downtown

Privacy is key - My family lives in the same building but you'll have your own studio! Please keep in mind that this is a studio garden apartment in a 19th century Chicago-style greystone building. Because of that the walls are thin and not soundproof. 

We offer self check-in and check-out, but are available for questions if needed.  Your privacy and comfort is our #1 priority.

You'll have access to our backyard and patio furniture, as well as, laundry facilities.

East Humboldt park was voted by Chicago magazine one of the hottest neighborhoods in Chicago. Lots of charming buildings, parks and restaurants.

2 minutes to Division #80 bus, 10 minutes to Blue line and a short and affordable Lyft/Uber ride to downtown. Convenient Street parking.

description:
In the heart of Palmer Square, open the door to a quiet space bathed in sunlight. A 10 minute walk to the California Blue Line stop, all of the greatest restaurants in Logan Square, and a quick 20-25 minute commute to downtown. 

I'm a theater and circus artist and enjoy creating a relaxing and invigorating space where folks can kick away their cares. Come stay a while and feel at home.

If you're looking for things to do, I can offer 2 tickets to the Art Institute for $25 as well!

One bedroom is available with a Queen sized bed and all your basic needs to set you up for the day. An economic kitchen, with all of the basics, plus an air fryer, popcorn maker, and some curated spices. High-speed Wifi and an Apple TV with Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, and HBO Go.

I will be staying in the apartment during your stay. Sometimes I'll need to use common space for work, but other than that keep to myself. I'd love to talk about what's happening in Chicago right now and can give you tons of references for things to do and see. 

I'll be in contact by phone when I'm not at the apartment.

Palmer Square is the chill little sister to the hip Logan Square. It's a quiet slice of Chicago, but only a 10 minute walk to three of the finest coffee shops on the west side with Gaslight Coffee, Colectivo Coffee, and Cafe Mustache.

On the same street is Revolution Brewery, one of Chicago's most popular local craft brewers. 

Taqueria Moran is the steadfast best taqueria in Logan Square.  You can sit on the porch at the delicious Masada (Middle Eastern), or grab a slice of pizza  and watch your favorite cult classic movie at The Boiler Room. 

For a beautiful tour of Chicago,  rent a nearby Divvy bike and take the stunning 606 trail to Lincoln Park, or head south to the  lagoon in Humboldt Park- recently made alligator free!

A ten minute walk to the California Blue Line Stop, which is only a few stops to the Loop. There's easy parking on the street and on occasion I can arrange for you to rent my car.

additional_house_rules:
1. Prohibited: Video Shooting, bring people that is not in the reservation, Small gatherings, family reunions, birthdays parties or any kind of celebrations. 
2. No smoke inside the house or building (any kind) 
3. Respect other Airbnb guests, belongings, food and other rooms.
4. Be quiet in the house and in the building specially after 9pm. 
5. Checkout from your room is by 10am and our checkout is firm becase our team schedule. Checkout from your room after this time will end in extra 30$. Checkout after 11am will end in extra 60$. Checkout after 12pm will end in an open  file in airbnb plus 60$ fee (2 hours paid for management team) and your belongings would have to be removed since another guest will be checking in.
6. If you use the kitchen, microwave, oven, plates, pans, pots, glasses, cups, kitchen table, living room table, coffee maker, fridge, etc.. you have to leave it clean. Nobody should cook after 10pm or before 7am in order to avoid disturbing the resting time of other guests.
7. After use the shower / bathtub clean the hairs you left. Take your own amenities with you. Don’t leave it in the bathroom.
8. Booking for somebody else is not allowed unless agreed before booking.
9. If you damage or lost any key the fee is 45$. 
10. We will send you missing items if you want but it will be 40$ plus shipping.

Ps: keys and missing items fees are: 20$ hourly rate management property plus 20$ Uber (go and return) plus the key or the shipping) 

BREAKING ANY RULE OR DOING ANY ILLEGAL ACTIVITY WILL END UP IN A IMMEDIATE CANCELLATION OF YOUR RESERVATION AND YOU WILL HAVE TO LEAVE THE PLACE IMMEDIATELY. Our top one priority is our guests’ security and provide a quiet stay!

access: You can use the kitchen (please turn on the kitchen fan once you use it), oven, pan, pots, plates, coffee maker, etc! You can use living room, hair dryer, iron. You will have WiFi, clean towels (1 p/p) , sheets, comforter, Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.
description:
Welcome to 1 of “The 12 Coolest Neighborhood Around the World”(Forbs) This hipster,artistic,and multicultural neighborhood with a great night life is just 10-12min driving to Downtown Chicago (2.9mi), 8min driving to Chinatown(1.6mi), 29min driving to O’hare (18mi)and 18min driving to Midway Airport (8,9mi).Buses works fine and Uber to Downtown is around 5-10$.Wifi,coffee maker,microwave,iron, hair dryer,pretty much everything you might need. We have cameras ON in common areas and locks in rooms

You will have a comfortable Full Size Bed in a private room! We want you feel very safe so your room is going to have its own lock and key and there are cameras in common areas. 

This is a private room in a shared place with other Airbnb guests and because of that we expect to keep the house  very quiet, specially after 9pm.

There is few free parking on the street, plenty paid parking around the house. 

*I only accept payments through Airbnb platform*

You can use the kitchen (please turn on the kitchen fan once you use it), oven, pan, pots, plates, coffee maker, etc! You can use living room, hair dryer, iron. You will have WiFi, clean towels (1 p/p) , sheets, comforter, Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.

Please always text us though airbnb app

This place is very close to Downtown Chicago, and it’s a great picturesque neighborhood with a lot of murals (for what is known), great restaurants, good night life. We have one block away my favorite Margarita’s place in Chicago! 

There are few free street parking around the neighborhood. 18 bus is just 1/2 block away. 18th Pink line is 15min walk. 60 bus is 8min walk. McCormick Place is 9min far by car/25min by public transportation. United Center is 10min far by car/30min by public transportation. Rush is 9min by car/21min by public transportation. Grant Park is 9min by car/28min by public transportation. The Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and the Planetarium is 11 min far by car/27 min by public transportation. Uber are very cheap 5-10$ to those places specially if you choose the pool option!

This is a safe and night life neighborhood so you can walk around it but without forget it that you are in Chicago so don’t leave belongings at sight in your car. Parking is such a tough situation in Chicago although there are few streets where you can Free park around the house (Racine street, May street  but one street behind the airbnb building not in front of airbnb building, Cullerton street, 19th street, Carpenter Street, 18th south side ). Parking is usually easy before 5pm, after 5pm is hard to find a free spot but not imposible. Just make sure 1) you read all signs posted in the street/ trees or fences that says information about street cleaning , reparation, disabilities parking, permit parking, school days, etc 2) you are not over the crosswalk, near a hydrant, or wrong way.

The room is private but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, and the bathroom/s) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd because most of Airbnb guests are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don’t spend much time in the house. A private apartment in the area usually cost over 120$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being close to downtown, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you! 

The room has one full size bed. If you want to add 3rd or 4th guest in the reservation I could add 1 extra air mattress with no extra fee if the reservation is set for 3 or 4. If the reservation is for 2 and you’d like to have an extra air mattress we charge $15p/night and we provide air mattress and linens for it. the room will become smaller for luggage becase you will have two beds on it. This is a good option if you want to save even more money otherwise you can book two rooms! 
As most houses in United States this is not made with concrete so you will hear people walking or outside sounds. It doesn’t bother most of the guest but if you are a very light sleeper maybe you should choose an entire place. or have an earphone or something to block the sound.

We have cameras ON in common areas, one is located outside the apartment in the entrance the other one is in the living room.

Is forbidden in this place: parties, small gatherings, to bring people who are not in the reservation, family reunions, birthdays celebration, video shooting,  being noisy, smoke and bring pets. 

We work based in all airbnb policies, terms and conditions including cancelation policy, so makes sure before you book to read carefully houses rules or cancelation policy.
house_rules:
1. Prohibited: Video Shooting, bring people that is not in the reservation, Small gatherings, family reunions, birthdays parties or any kind of celebrations. 
2. No smoke inside the house or building (any kind) 
3. Respect other Airbnb guests, belongings, food and other rooms.
4. Be quiet in the house and in the building specially after 9pm. 
5. Checkout from your room is by 10am and our checkout is firm becase our team schedule. Checkout from your room after this time will end in extra 30$. Checkout after 11am will end in extra 60$. Checkout after 12pm will end in an open  file in airbnb plus 60$ fee (2 hours paid for management team) and your belongings would have to be removed since another guest will be checking in.
6. If you use the kitchen, microwave, oven, plates, pans, pots, glasses, cups, kitchen table, living room table, coffee maker, fridge, etc.. you have to leave it clean. Nobody should cook after 10pm or before 7am in order to avoid disturbing the resting time of other guests.
7. After use the shower / bathtub clean the hairs you left. Take your own amenities with you. Don’t leave it in the bathroom.
8. Booking for somebody else is not allowed unless agreed before booking.
9. If you damage or lost any key the fee is 45$. 
10. We will send you missing items if you want but it will be 40$ plus shipping.

Ps: keys and missing items fees are: 20$ hourly rate management property plus 20$ Uber (go and return) plus the key or the shipping) 

BREAKING ANY RULE OR DOING ANY ILLEGAL ACTIVITY WILL END UP IN A IMMEDIATE CANCELLATION OF YOUR RESERVATION AND YOU WILL HAVE TO LEAVE THE PLACE IMMEDIATELY. Our top one priority is our guests’ security and provide a quiet stay!

access: Guest will also have access to a fully equipped kitchen. May use as long as you clean after yourself.
description:
The Millennium Park Experience by DivvyTrek is a large, private guest room with a bathroom, jacuzzi tub and patio in a modern condo unit one-half block to the Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) Green Line stop at Indiana that’s a 15 minute ride to major downtown attractions such as The Cloud Gate at Millennium Park. 

The McCormick Place Convention Center is just 20 minutes by train.

Close to lakefront, beaches, stadiums and Hyde Park. University of Chicago, IIT, UIC and Loop campuses are nearby.

We offer a one bedroom in a large, luxurious condo located in a hip, up-and-coming neighborhood with culture and soul near the Chicago Loop. Includes free parking, WiFi and washer/dryer access.

You'll enjoy the privacy and comfort of your own bedroom, a fully-equipped modern kitchen and full access to the dining and living rooms. Long-term stays are available as well. 

There may be additional guests staying in the other bedrooms during your stay which is great for meeting new people and networking. Essentially, we offer guests the convenience of a boutique hotel while providing the comfort of home. 

We're just a mile away from Chicago's lakefront, providing great bike trails, running paths, beaches and gardens, not to mention views of one of the world's most scenic waterfront skylines. Of course, we're conveniently situated for business travelers attending conventions at McCormick Place or meetings with major corporations downtown, as well as institutions of higher learning, such as IIT, UIC, Northwestern and the University of Chicago, both the downtown and Hyde Park campuses.

Getting around is easy as we're only a block away from the public transit stop. There, you can catch the train that'll take you directly downtown in minutes or you can transfer to other trains for connecting to all parts of the city, including both airports. 

If you have a car there is ample, free street parking and the Loop is only a 10 minute drive. In addition to the train, we highly recommend rideshare services from either Uber or Lyft, which are very economically priced from our place for getting around the city.

This is a great place for you if you'd like to be close to the energy of Chicago's vibrant Loop but want to experience a unique, local neighborhood.

Guest will also have access to a fully equipped kitchen. May use as long as you clean after yourself.

We'll provide city guides and public transit info via Acehopper, "Airbnb's front desk concierge", available for iPhone, iPad and Android devices, for tickets, guides and tips on local places to visit. 

If we're around, we also like to entertain. We'll definitely make your stay a comfortable and memorable visit to the area.  Sometimes we're busy, but we'll do our best to accommodate your needs.

Experience the city like a true, native Chicagoan. Close to several parks and restaurants. Only a mile away from the beautiful Chicago Lakefront and Beaches! Plenty of trails for biking, walking and jogging. Enjoy water sports at the nearby harbor: 
* Jet skis
* Kayaks
* Flyboards
* Paddleboards 

Plus spectacular views of Chicago's magnificent skyline.

Nearest public transit is less than one block away, arriving every 5-10 minutes. Bike shares are available at the station. Just download Acehopper for iPhone and Android for public transit times, bike sharing availability and info for local events and attractions, including maps and tickets for purchase direct from your phone or tablet. Of course, we also recommend rideshare services such as Uber and Lyft to navigate around the city.
