access:
- You will have access to the entire unit, and to the laundry machines in the basement. 
- No access to the closet in the kitchen (by the fridge)
description:
Cheerful 2-bedroom* condo designed to be your home base in Chicago! Makeover just completed with new furniture, décor, linens, RokuTV and colorful design. You will be surrounded by some of the trendier restaurants, bars and shops in Chicago but be only 20min from the loop via train. 

+ Walk Score 89 ("Very Walkable")
+ Bike Score 82 ("Very Bikeable")
+ Transit Score 71 ("Excellent Transit")

+ Great for couples, families, a group of friends, solo or business
+ Friendly and responsive Superhosts

* 3 beds with room for a total of 6 people
* Spacious master with Queen bed, desk and bright seating area
* 2nd bedroom w/ Queen bed & seating area (NOTE: semi-private- no lock/door)
* Flat screen HDTV with Roku (access Netflix, Amazon with your account)
* Living room with comfy couch and chairs to enjoy during the day. 
* By night the sofa converts into a pull out bed
* Access to washer/dryer in the basement 
* Complimentary high-speed wireless internet
* Bathroom stocked with hair dryer, toiletries, and plenty of fresh towels
* Private secure entrance with keyless entry
* Kitchen with coffee maker, serveware, new appliances and bright seating area
* Iron & Board
* FREE street parking

★ Ready to book and new to Airbnb? Use www.airbnb.com/c/kproano1 to join and recieve a $40 travel credit towards your first booking ★

- You will have access to the entire unit, and to the laundry machines in the basement. 
- No access to the closet in the kitchen (by the fridge)

We will not be on site during your stay, but consider us your concierge that's just a message away! We will be happy to provide restaurant and activity recommendations and answer any questions that come up during your stay.

Logan Square is HOT! Cutting edge restaurants, cafes, and breweries could keep you from ever wandering away. We're a 5 min walk from the new 606 Elevated Trail (think New York HighLine) which offers exhilarating walking, jogging or biking opportunities as you coast above the city. The Western stop of the "L" Blue Line is a short 8 minute walk and bus transportation in or out of the city is ample.

Walk to everything! 5 minutes to Divvy Bike Station, 606 trail, "restaurant row" on Armitage including Mexican, Italian & Indian. Several more highly regarded restaurants, cafes and bars nearby. 8 minutes to the Western stop of the blue line which can get you downtown in 15 minutes and to O'Hare airport in 30 minutes. Wide Lyft/Uber coverage gets you anywhere fast. 

The Armitage bus runs East/West and stops 1 block north of the building.

Chicago has Uber, Lyft, and car-sharing services like GetAround, ZipCar, and Enterprise Car Share. Street parking is free and relatively easy to find.

- Please note second bedroom is semi-private. It separates off from the rest of the apartment but does not have a locking door
-Free Street Parking (always check for temporary posted restrictions)
-The two front units (your unit is in back) are occupied full time. Please be respectful of the neighbors!
house_rules:
- No pets
- No parties
- No photoshoots
- No smoking
- No access to the closet in the kitchen (by the fridge)
-No shoes on the carpet

description:
Clean, newly refurbished studio apartment in the DePaul area of Lincoln Park. Private entrance, queen bed, hardwood floors, private bath and small kitchenette. Plenty of free street parking. Easy walk to public transportation, incredible restaurants, music venues and shopping. Lake Michigan beaches, Lincoln Park Zoo, Wrigley Field and many other attractions are a short bike or train ride away. The rapid transit train system provides a quick trip to downtown Chicago.

This cozy, charming apartment is located in the front of a classic vintage 3-flat building on a tree-lined street. The space is approximately 350 square feet and sits three steps down from the ground floor facing the front garden. Although it’s a studio apartment the layout has a multi-room feel. We have a lovely garden and patio in the backyard that’s available and accessible to guests. The kitchenette is equipped with a refrigerator, toaster, coffeemaker, electric kettle and a microwave for your convenience. There’s always a fresh supply of coffee and tea along with some snacks. The building is owner-occupied. We live on a quiet residential street but our neighborhood is loaded with things to do. It’s a walker’s paradise! Enjoy all that our city has to offer!

I live in the building and work nearby so I'm available in-person or via phone at any time. I'm a lifelong Chicagoan and have been in this building for over 30 years.

Our location is an 8 minute walk from the CTA train line where you can catch the Red Line or the Brown Line trains. Those will get you downtown, to Wrigley Field or numerous other locations that travelers would be drawn to. Less than a block away is a Divvy bicycle station where you can rent a bike for a half hour or the entire day. The Fullerton Bus can be accessed right around the corner from our street. For those with a car we'll provide zoned parking passes and there are always spots open on our street.
house_rules:
No cooking on the premises
Quiet hours after 10:30pm

additional_house_rules:
House Rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.
7.) Do not exit through the apartment front door except in cases of emergencies; the exit is alarmed.

access: Guests have access to the entire first floor of the building, back yard and patio.  Entry and exit is through the back door only.
description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

Welcome to our beautiful 3 bedroom apartment just blocks from Loyola University.  Fully furnished apartment with one queen bed, two full beds, and one pull-out futon.  Amenities include full kitchen, dining room, and 2 bathrooms.  WiFi, cable, 3 televisions throughout the apartment and sunroom and back yard too! Close to public transportation, the lake, and dozens of dining options within walking distance.

You'll walk into the apartment's kitchen, where you'll find (among everything else you'd expect in a kitchen!) plenty of welcome materials. Just beyond is the dining room, with seating for 6, and French doors to the sun room. Along the hallway are 3 bedrooms: 1 with a Full-sized bed, and 2 with Queen-sized beds, and 2 full baths. At the end of the hallway is our living room, with decorative fireplace, large TV, and plenty of seating (including an overstuffed chair in a large, sunny bay window.)

Guests have access to the entire first floor of the building, back yard and patio.  Entry and exit is through the back door only.

We are on a beautiful, quiet residential street, with tons of amenities within walking distance.  Guest can be comfortable relaxing in the home, walking around the neighborhood, or using it as a home base to jump on public transportation downtown.

We are within walking distance to the Loyola Red Line station, which will take you to Wrigley Field in 15 minutes or downtown in around 20 minutes.  Ideal for anyone with a car or traveling using public transportation.
house_rules:
House Rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.
7.) Do not exit through the apartment front door except in cases of emergencies; the exit is alarmed.
neighborhood_overview: We are on a beautiful, quiet residential street, with tons of amenities within walking distance.  Guest can be comfortable relaxing in the home, walking around the neighborhood, or using it as a home base to jump on public transportation downtown.

additional_house_rules:
Most important rule - enjoy ! 

Culture - my ideal traveler(s) : 


I would like clean and quiet guests who want to fully enjoy the home and neighborhood (and city) as if it were their own. I am an easy-going owner, who wants my guests to feel right at home. 

No smoking inside ( outside only ) no pets without prior acceptance, nothing too loud / too late.

I have put a lot of love into the design and comforts of this property, and I'm so excited for travelers to come and enjoy. 


 - make this your home away from home during your stay . 

Help yourself to all the basics in the kitchen and hopefully you will use the full kitchen and the breakfast nook area to enjoy meals , conversation and reading your morning paper .

access:
Suite -Master bedroom & connected luxury full walk- in glass shower and attached dressing area separate from bedroom .
Suite .

In addition to your private master bedroom and attached private bathroom , you have a full back 14 foot deck and built in breakfast nook.  There is also a relaxing dining room and luxurious sofa in the front of the home for common use.

One garage spot for you to use - no additional charge . 




This is a unique place , it's always private no matter how you book .
description:
My place is close to Lake Michigan, Whole Foods, Red Line, Andersonville. 

The rental -Master Bed & Bath for sleeping and all common areas such as , kitchen , living room , adjoining dining room , kitchen , breakfast room and 14 foot deck. 

The suit / sleeping has an Upscale King mattress and linens. Very unique and cozy suite, with designer full Carrera bathroom. Free wifi throughout, and a tv in-room.

This flat was completely rehabbed.


The entire flat is only for your use.

Quiet tree-lined street, with close proximity to two of Chicago's hottest neighborhoods: Andersonville and Edgewater. Three blocks to Lake Michigan (Ardmore Beach) or the train to everywhere else. Or...stay "home" and enjoy the huge private deck and backyard. Hit the many great restaurants within walking distance, or walk to the neighborhood Whole Foods and make dinner in the homes gourmet kitchen.

If booking as one or two adults you are reserving the suite only and have full use of all common areas . There is an additional room with a queen bed and an extra full bath that may be reserved for you if you have more than 2 persons in your party . See additional pricing for more than two persons . 

I have marketed this Flat without the additional bedroom and bathroom in order to be able to offer you this amazing space at a discounted price . 


Unique privacy always with your own suite and private use and access to all common areas . 

There will be coffee / essentials and lite breakfast items .

Suite -Master bedroom & connected luxury full walk- in glass shower and attached dressing area separate from bedroom .
Suite .

In addition to your private master bedroom and attached private bathroom , you have a full back 14 foot deck and built in breakfast nook.  There is also a relaxing dining room and luxurious sofa in the front of the home for common use.

One garage spot for you to use - no additional charge . 




This is a unique place , it's always private no matter how you book .

I am happy to suggest all the best hidden surprises of this incredible city .

Close to the lake , close / literally one block to the redline and around the corner from whole foods . 
Edgewater is one of the nicest neighborhoods with many ethnic restaurants , antique shops and 2nd hand shopping . 

Andersonville is within walking distance and is a wonderful addition to your proximity of your stay .

Lake - beach is literally three blocks away .

Red line (el train) is just 3 blocks away. 
Public transportation is easy . Car services arrive quickly . If you have a rental , a garage spot is available - no charge .

Maximum persons that the entire flat can accommodate would be up to5 persons.

additional_house_rules:
***Surveillance cameras are present at each entrance to the home, in the kitchen, living room, and stairwell. All cameras are on at all times.*** 

Check-In Rules:
Unfortunately, I will not always be able to personally meet all guests at their desired check in time.

If I'm unable to meet you, I'll provide the Digital Door Lock Code with very detailed instructions for entry which will be messaged through Airbnb messenger at your Check-In time. You'll be given instant access to the building whenever you arrive! Please TAKE YOUR SHOES OFF upon entering the home. 

Food and Beverages:
There is absolutely NO consumption of food or beverages (excluding water) outside of the kitchen, kitchen bar, and dining room.

All food and beverages in the fridge and kitchen cabinets belong to other guests and your host. Refrain from taking food/beverages that were not brought in or purchased by you. Coffee, creamer, and sugar on the coffee bar in the kitchen are complimentary and you may have as much of it as you'd like. 

Guest Policy:
"Guest" constitutes any person entering the property, whether spending the night or only visiting. Unverified, unauthorized guests are not allowed on the premises. If you'd like to have a guest during your stay, your guest MUST be verified and announced through the AirBnb messenger and approval of this guest must be explicitly given by us, the hosts. Violation of this rule will result in immediate cancellation of your reservation and termination of your stay. 

Mail:
Please notify the host if you want to have Mail/Parcels shipped to you during your stay.

Quiet Hours:
Quiet Hours at the residence are between the hours of 10pm and 7am Sunday-Thursday and 12am and 7am on Friday-Saturday.

This is a Shared Space with many Travelers all visiting Chicago for a different purpose.  Having common courtesy is more than enough to fulfill this rule.  If you're a Late Night personality, please respect those waking up early for work.  If you're up at the crack of dawn, please get ready as quietly as possible as to not disturb those still asleep.

Smoking:
There is absolutely no smoking inside of the building.  This includes Electronic Cigarettes and all other forms of Tobacco.

Travelers are more than welcome to Smoke outside of the building.  


Weapons:
Absolutely NO WEAPONS of any sort are allowed inside of the building.  This includes Firearms, Knives, and anything else that can be used in a malicious manner.  Host(s) will have Final Say in what constitutes as a weapon.

Violence:
There will be no violence of any sort tolerated inside of the building.  This includes Physical Violence, Verbal (Arguing, Threats, Intimidation, etc.), and any sort of behavior that causes another person in the house to feel upset. 

‘Common Sense’ Rule:
As this is a Shared Building, guests are expected to act in a way which is both Respectful and Inviting to everyone else sharing the space.   Actions which are deemed to have a Negative Impact on the overall experience of the other travelers will not be tolerated.  A few examples of this would be:  Leaving Dishes unwashed in the sink, being excessively messy or loud, or just having a negative, unwelcoming attitude.  If Behavior is causing other Travelers to feel uncomfortable, we will ask you to make necessary corrections, if these corrections are not made, we will terminate your stay.

Illegal Activity:
Any action which is in violation of any law within the city of Chicago and the state of Illinois is grounds for instant Termination


Check-Out Rules:
Check out is at 10AM, which is when the cleaning crew arrives. 
All guests that FAIL to vacate the premises prior to the 10AM check out will be charged $50 - No Exceptions!

- Bathrooms - Shared with all Travelers

description:
Located near I-290 and the Blue Line this private room is perfect for any Tourist or Business Traveler looking to explore Chicago.
		
2 Queen Beds (4 Guests)
65" Smart TV in Common Area
Fireplace 
Wi-Fi / Cable TV / Netflix 
Complimentary Coffee Bar
New, stainless steel appliances: Stove, Fridge, Microwave
2 Bathrooms stocked with Essentials
Minutes away from Popular Tourist Areas, CTA Public Transit, and various local attractions

Located near I-290 and the Blue Line this private room is perfect for any Tourist or Business Traveler looking to explore Chicago.
	
2 Queen Beds (4 Guests)
65" Smart TV in Common Area
Fireplace 
Wi-Fi / Cable TV / Netflix 
Complimentary Coffee Bar
New, stainless steel appliances: Stove, Fridge, Microwave
2 Bathrooms stocked with Essentials
Minutes away from Popular Tourist Areas, CTA Public Transit, and various local attractions
Room Specifications:
- Comfortable Queen Mattress (Hampton & Rhodes HR 200)
- Closet Space to hang your Wardrobe
- Lighting Fast Wi-Fi Internet 

Bathroom:
- 2 Shared Washrooms for all Travelers 
- Essentials Provided:
   - Toilet Paper 
   - Shampoo / Conditioner 
   - Soap / Body Wash 
   - Towels 
   - Hair Dryer 
   - Iron 
   - Ironing Board

Office:
This House contains a few shared “Study Areas” perfect for any Business Traveler, Student, or Tourist on the go!  
Comfortable living room and dining room areas and lightning fast Wi-Fi provide the perfect oasis to stay on top of your busy life!

Living/Dining Area:
The ‘Family Room’ contains a comfortable sofa and love-seat, a 65” Flat Screen Television, and a fireplace to share a few laughs with your fellow travelers!   

Kitchen:
New, stainless steel appliances (Stove, Microwave, Refrigerator) and cooking utensils will enable you to enjoy the luxuries of home while you're on the road!
A Coffee / Tea Kiosk will enable you to have your morning beverage of choice hot and ready to go for you each and every morning!
Dining Room Table with modern decor overlooking the fireplace and TV so you can always stay connected!

Laundry:
***Only available for reservations longer than one week***
Fully-Functional Washer & Dryer are located in the Basement. Laundry facilities are available only upon request and while a staff member and/or host are present.   
Laundry Detergent & Fabric Softener are not provided. 

Parking:
Parking on the street, directly in front of the house, is unfortunately not permitted. If you are bringing a vehicle, please ensure you are legally parked. 

Locks:
The Listing has a Digital Door Lock. The Door Code will be provided at 3PM on your Check-In date.

You and your guests will have access to the following areas:
	
- Bedroom 
- Bathrooms - Shared with all Travelers
- Kitchen / Dining Room Area - Shared with all Travelers
- Living Room Area (Couches & TV) - Shared with all Travelers

I love to meet new people, but due to the nature of my schedule, our interactions could be minimal.

I will, however, be on location in the event that you need anything during your stay, and I am always a Text, Phone Call, or AirBnb Message away to ensure that all of my Guests have an Amazing, 5-Star Experience!

Chicago Blue Line:
	
Located right on I-290 & only a mile away from Chicago's 'Blue Line', this location is perfect for anyone looking to take in the Sights of Chicago!  

Whether you're going Downtown to check out Navy Pier & Millennium Park, enjoy a Concert or Game at the United Center, or head to O'Hare International Airport to continue your journey; you'll always be just a few minutes away!

If you choose to spend an Evening around the House, you'll enjoy a diverse neighborhood with various options in terms of Shops & Dining.

Distance To Nearest Public Transit:

Bus: 0.3 mi (3 Blocks)
Train: 1 mi (Blue Line: Forest Park)

Want to know how far your Destination is from my Place?  Enter Harrison St. & 17th Ave. into Goo.gle Maps, then type in your Destination.  You'll see pretty accurate Travel Times whether you're driving, taking the bus, using the CTA system, or walking.  This will also take into account real-time traffic to give you an even more accurate estimate!

Travel Distance to Chicago Landmarks:
- MDW International Airport = 12 mi.
- ORD International Airport = 10 mi. 
- Union Station = 12 mi.  
- United Center = 10 mi.
- U.S. Cellular Field = 14 mi.
- Wrigley Field = 19 mi.
- Soldier Field = 15 mi.

In the event you need to access and use the Laundry Facility, please contact the host.

description:
Very light and airy apartment located in rogers park. Just a 15-minute walk to Loyola Park. Take the Redline down to Downtown and see all that Chicago has to offer!

Very comfortable and spacious apartment. With wifi and smart tv access to Netflix, fully equipt kitchen including a Keurig!

I do not stay at the property but I am alway's available but phone or email for whatever you may need.

Rogers Park the home of Emil Bach's house designed by the great Frank Lloyd Wright. Glenwood Sunday Market, which runs from 9 am-2 pm alongside the Red Line between Morse and Lunt. On select Sundays in November and December, the market moves inside the Glenwood bar for holiday shopping.

Two blocks down from Redline and Greenline that will take you in the heart of downtown Chicago and china town.

Absolutely no illegal activity will be tolerated. If these rules are not observed, authorities will be notified immediately.
City of Chicago requires hosts to identify all guests. Each guest will need to present ID at check in and copy will be made. For one night reservations the entire group needs to be present in order to check in.

access: Guests have the use of Unit 1, which spans over first floor and lower level, one parking space. There are 7 other units in the building
description:
Walk to all the action of Wicker park- restaurants, bars and shops; take a 15 min train ride to Downtown; explore 606 from this amazing 4 bedroom 3 bath condo spanning over two floors with soaring ceilings and all the amenities you can think of. 
Perfect for bachelor/bachelorette groups, families and get togethers.
This amazing space has separate living and dining rooms, deck, parking space and so much more

LAY OUT:
First floor: has a formal living room, dining room and spacious kitchen. There is a front foyer, deck with seating and grill. Plenty of space for a bigger group to spread out or celebrate together! One full bathroom and one of the bedroom are on this level. Three bedrooms and two bathrooms are on the lower level. Laundry is on the lower level. 

Behold this luxury contemporary renovation of a classic Chicago building in popular Wicker Park/Bucktown! Stay at the foot of the magnificent Bloomingdale Trail steps from boutique shopping, cutting-edge dining, and great nightlife.

Standout features of this duplex unit include large open living space, state-of-the-art eat-in kitchen, opulent bedroom suites. Also enjoy huge closets, recessed lighting, in-unit laundry, private deck and a parking space in an enclosed garage. Pets are welcome.

SLEEPING ARRANGEMENTS:
Bedroom 1 (first floor): 2 queen size beds
Bedroom 2 (lower level): 2 queen size beds
Bedroom 3 (lower level): 2 queen size bed
Bedroom 4  (lower level): 2 queen size bed
Sitting room (lower level): 1 double futon

OTHER AMENITIES:
~WiFi throughout the apartment

Guests have the use of Unit 1, which spans over first floor and lower level, one parking space. There are 7 other units in the building

I have a Superhost status on Airbnb. You can book my property with confidence knowing so many before you truly enjoy their stay and left five star feedback. You can be assured that all amenities will be as described and I am always around to help with anything needed.

Hip Wicker Park has been a residential enclave since Chicago was incorporated as a city in 1837. North Milwaukee Avenue is known for its bustling nightlife, dining and entertainment venues, with Subterranean and Davenport’s setting the bar for the city's trendy music clubs. North Damen Avenue draws hip crowds with its quirky shops, minimalist cafes, specialty grocery stores and cool fashion boutiques.
The Bloomingdale Line was a 2.7-mile (4.3 km) elevated railroad running east-west on the northwest side of Chicago. In 2015, the City of Chicago converted it into an elevated greenway called The Bloomingdale Trail, which forms the backbone of the linear park and trail network called The 606.

Two blue line stops within walking distance. This line is direct to the O'Hare airport and to downtown. Grocery store across the street, farmacy a few blocks away.

IF YOU ARE PLANNING ON HAVING A CELEBRATION: Unregistered guests are not allowed on the property. Presence of more than 18 guests is unlawful. A guest is anyone at the property, staying the night or just visiting. There is a counter installed and police will be notified immediately. This is not a place for a local house party. 

CONSIDER PURCHASING MY WORRY FREE CLEANING PACKAGE: For those of you traveling to Chicago to celebrate together: for additional $100 you do not have to clean anything. Just walk out in the morning (you do need to move furniture back if you make any changes to lay out). Note that this fee is additional to my regular cleaning fee.

Link to all of my properties: http://airbnb.com/p/chr
house_rules:
Presence of more than 18 people at the property is UNLAWFUL.
Absolutely no illegal activity will be tolerated. If these rules are not observed, authorities will be notified immediately.
City of Chicago requires hosts to identify all guests. Each guest will need to present ID at check in and copy will be made. For one night reservations the entire group needs to be present in order to check in.
This is a neighborhood residential street. All noise needs to remain inside the unit and quite hours observed.
There is absolutely no smoking anywhere inside the house or outside close enough the doors or windows so that the house has even a faint smell of smoke. $500 will be charged from the security deposit should we detect ANY signs of smoking.
interaction: I have a Superhost status on Airbnb. You can book my property with confidence knowing so many before you truly enjoy their stay and left five star feedback. You can be assured that all amenities will be as described and I am always around to help with anything needed.

access: You will have a private room and use of a shared bathroom. You can feel free to use the kitchen and common areas in the rest of the house.
description:
Enjoy the comfort of a room in an artful private home in Evanston, close to Northwestern, Chicago and the lake. Art and textiles, off-street parking, private yard, green and chemical-free home that will be your quiet retreat!

Enjoy the comfort of a room in an artful private home in Evanston, close to Northwestern, Chicago and the lake. Art and textiles, off-street parking, private yard, green and synthetic fragrance and chemical-free home that will be your quiet retreat! 

I also have a whole house listing for the same property that I make available when I travel. This listing is for a room, and the assumption is that it will be during times that I'm at the house. 

You will have your own room with a double bed in a lovely 1-story private home with a finished basement. There is a patio area with a sitting area outside the kitchen for candlelit evening dinners. Washer and dryer are available for your use. 

I live in a residential, safe historic district, with beautiful tree-lined streets and lovely old houses. downtown Evanston and Northwestern University are approximately 1.5 miles north, and Lake Michigan and beaches are a little over a mile to the east. 

Evanston has become a haven for local, sustainable cuisine, with several highly rated restaurants in the area that pride themselves on local sourcing and organic ingredients, including Found Kitchen, Campagnola, Union Pizzeria and more. We have two Whole Foods within 1-2 miles of the house. Evanston has a wonderful farmer's market every Saturday during the season. 

Parking is available on the street as well as a parking pad in the back of the house. Public transportation via the CTA or Metra train is available via an easy walk to Main and Chicago Ave. (about 8 blocks).

You will have a private room and use of a shared bathroom. You can feel free to use the kitchen and common areas in the rest of the house.

I'll usually be in town but you can have as much privacy as you prefer. I'm always happy to meet my guests and can help with local information to whatever extent you need.

additional_house_rules: 1.No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable and subject to a $250 fine. 2.Please ensure that you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6.Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $150 per key fee.

access: You'll have complete and private access to both apartments as well as building amenities.
description:
2 stylish corner apartments in a perfect location with fabulous city views in multiple directions. This bright and spacious four bedroom, four bathroom space is perfect for groups looking for a luxurious city escape in the heart of Chicago. These identical apartments are located in the same corner of a luxury building on separate floors (11th and 13th floors). The building has an amazing rooftop terrace with a hot tub and panoramic views of the skyline. This is the best location in the city!

Located in a secure, high-end building in the center of Chicago. This property is comprised of 2 identical two bedroom / 2 bath apartments (4 bedrooms / 4 baths in total) on different floors of the building. You can easily walk or take the elevator between the apartments, as they're separated by just one floor.

Once inside, you're greeted by a light-filled space with windows on every wall. The views during the day are fantastic - but it's even more magical at night! Right out the window, you'll see a unique scene of diverse and historic Chicago architecture with the bustling city below. 

Everything is top of line and interior design is a passion of ours - so the furnishing of the unit reflects that! There is fast internet, a smart TV with Roku, and comfortable modern furniture to lounge on. 

The kitchen and living room are open. Each kitchen is stocked with cookware and all the tools you need to cook a great meal. We have a 2-person bistro dining table and 3 counter stools for the granite kitchen island. Plenty of room for all guests to dine comfortably or to use as a workspace. 

For each guest, the comfortable beds have crisp, clean linens and the bathrooms are stocked with fresh towels and bath products. Sleeping arrangements are as follows:

Bedroom 1: Queen bed
Bedroom 2: Queen bed
Bedroom 3: Queen bed
Bedroom 4: Queen bed
Living Room 1: Queen sleeper sofa
Living Room 2: Queen sleeper sofa

We also provide towels, detergent, iron, etc. and you have full access to the in-unit washer and dryer!

The building has a 24 hour doorman and great amenities including a movie theater, gym, rooftop "sky lounge" with grilling stations, and a rooftop terrace with outdoor hot tub, sun beds, and lounge seating. The panoramic views from the rooftop are fabulous!You'll have complete and private access to both apartments as well as building amenities.

You'll have complete and private access to both apartments as well as building amenities.

We're always available to answer questions and provide recommendations!

The Loop is the heart of Chicago and the most central location in the entire city! You are surrounded by world-class architecture, shopping, theaters, parks, and other sites. You can quickly walk to Millennium Park, the lakefront, the Chicago River, the Magnificent Mile, the Art Institute, and so much more. The Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and Soldier Field are just a 5 minute ride. Oak Street for luxury shopping and the West Loop restaurant row for world class dining are only 5 minutes away as well!

Our place is surrounded by trains and buses that will take you anywhere in the city you want to go! Uber and Lyft is also available 24/7. You'll have no trouble getting around without a car.

Parking is not included with our listing, but there are many nearby parking garages close to our building (within a couple blocks). We also suggest using SpotHero or ParkWhiz to find and book discounted parking. You can usually find reasonable overnight parking for $15 to $25.

access: Access is available to the apartment unit and the pool with your key fob.
description:
This might be a studio, but don’t let that fool you—this cozy space packs a powerful punch, with glorious floor-to-ceiling windows, an even glorious-er view, and more amenities than you’ll know what to do with—basketball, pool, track, steam room, sauna, the list goes on. Plus, you’re centrally located to go anywhere in the city. If Chicago is your oyster, this loft is your all-you-can-eat deal.

This luxury studio comes complete with a spacious living/sleeping area, bathroom, full kitchen, and balcony. The building is fully loaded with amenities, ranging from pool deck to basketball court to steam room and sauna.

Access is available to the apartment unit and the pool with your key fob.

Check out our guidebook for local recommendations on the best places to eat, drink, and play and message us anytime for concierge services.

Step outside to be right in the heart of historic State Street and Magnificent Mile, steps away from the city’s choice of cultural offerings, such as the Museum of Contemporary Art, John Hancock Center, and Navy Pier.

Cab/Uber service is easily available in this location and is our preferred method of transportation downtown. The unit is three blocks from the Chicago Red Line that takes you directly down to Willis Tower or up to Wrigley Stadium. The apartment is also near several major bus routes.

If keys are lost or misplaced there will be a $20 charge. Also, please note that we may need to drop in between the hours of Noon-3pm to check on supplies. If anything is not to your liking, please notify us, and we will correct the situation as soon as possible. We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered.

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
6.) Please remove your shoes while in the unit.

access: Guests will have private access to the unit and shared access to the front patio.
description:
*SPECIAL* Dec-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

Close to Wrigley Field, 1.5 blocks to the redline train, 1/2 mile to the lake. The space boasts high ceilings and many updates, including kitchen and baths. Good for couples, business travelers, families (with kids), and big groups.  Please note that the building backs right to the elevated tracks for the Redline train, so you will hear the train during your stay.

Experience a grand Chicago vacation at this spacious 4 bedroom, 2 bath duplex in the middle of Chicago's historical Wrigleyville! What you can anticipate for your stay:
• Large front patio with Grill
• Fully Equipped Chefs Kitchen with Cookware and Cooking Essentials
• Formal Dining Table
• All Beds Freshly Made with Clean and Crisp Linens.
• Master Bedroom - Queen Bed
• Second Bedroom - Queen Bed
• Third Bedroom - Queen Bed
• Fourth Bedroom - Queen Bed
• A Pack-n-Play
• Bathrooms Stocked with Fresh Towels, Shampoo, Conditioner, and Body Wash
• Two Separate Media Rooms with Oversized Couches and Flatscreen TVs offering smart channels
• Children's reading nook
• Individually Controlled Heat and Air
• In-Unit Washer & Dryer
• High-speed internet
• Darts for entertainment
• And Much More!

Guests will have private access to the unit and shared access to the front patio.

Anchored by a beautiful stretch of shoreline to the east and dotted with train stops from two ‘L' lines, Lakeview is one of Chicago's liveliest and most accessible neighborhoods. Several distinct areas — East Lakeview, Central Lakeview, Boystown and Wrigleyville — meld together to form a lakefront community that celebrates diversity and boasts something for every type of visitor.
Hit the bustling commercial districts along Belmont Avenue, Lincoln Avenue, Southport Avenue, Clark Street, Halsted Street and Broadway Street to shop — be it for vintage frocks, designer jeans or leather biker gear — or live it up with the locals at the seemingly endless options for bars and pubs, and the dozens of celebrated restaurants in between.

Arts and culture come in the form of live music venues, several summer street festivals and a thriving scene for theater, dance and comedy (Belmont Theater District is a stellar collection of nearly 20 independent companies).

Not to be outdone by its extraordinary entertainment landscape, Lakeview makes full use of its slice of Lincoln Park, a 1,200-acre oasis dedicated to the outdoors. Here you will find the scenic Lakefront Trail, a golf course and driving range, a boat harbor, a bird sanctuary, tennis courts and grassy playing fields that are also perfect for picnics or just soaking in the views.

Just steps away from public transportation! For all else, Uber, taxis, and the citys shared bike program, Divvy, are all accessible in the immediate area!

2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.

description:
Our apartment is in the diverse Rogers Park neighborhood. It is on the top floor which means it is relatively quiet. The living room and one of the bedrooms face east toward Lake Michigan (which = beautiful sunrises!) and also south (bathroom, dinning room, bedroom and kitchen). There is plenty of light  all year round making this the perfect magical summer or cozy winter home.

We are located a seven minute walk to Lake Michigan and Loyola Park (which has the longest stretch of beach in Chicago), a five minute walk to the Loyola CTA metro stop making it easy to get around the city and into downtown Chicago. Also a five minute walk to Devon, Morse and Clark Street which are both full of yummy dinner spots, cozy neighborhood bars, bookstores and cafes!

Feel free to reach out with any questions or concerns during your stay.

additional_house_rules:
-No children under 7. 
-All children 7 and older must be included in the occupancy count. 
- Unless otherwise discussed do not arrive before 2pm or leave after 10am. 
- Early check-in and late check-out may be available for an additional fee. 
- No smoking in unit.
- No parties.
-No outside guests.
-If a guest brings more people than were booked, the reservation will be cancelled with no refund.
- Remove shoes at door.
- Please try to limit your use of strong scents. Apply perfume and cologne outside when possible, do not burn incense, sage or candles, and avoid using strong smelling spices when cooking. 
- Please respect our neighbors.
- Please be sure apartment is secure when you leave and that lights are off.
-Please conserve energy and turn the heat down when you are out of the apartment and when you check out. 
- Please note that we keep the nest locked at 72 in the winter and 71 in the summer. If your heating or AC needs diverge greatly from that please discuss prior to booking. 
- Please be respectful towards the space. If something breaks let us know.
- Use coasters. 
- Do not let food waste and garbage pile up in the apartment. Take it to the alley (through the gate behind the coach house). 
-There is a $75 lockout fee between the hours of 9am and 8pm and a $125 lockout fee between the hours of 8pm and 8am.
- If you are allergic to down it is imperative you let us know when you book so we can have alternatives available for you.

access: Guests have full access to the apartment which has been remodeled with your comfort in mind.
description:
Cute & cozy two bedroom apartment in Wicker park. Recently remodeled with brand new bathroom and kitchen. Comfortable beds, coin laundry, Nest thermostat, Netflix, Wifi! 1 block from the blue line, very close to the shops on Division and Milwaukee.

Hip and modern with a touch of vintage charm. As comfortable as it is cool!

This unit comfortably sleeps six, two in each bedroom and two on the sleeper sofa. Great porch for relaxing in the Chicago summers.

Each bedroom features full size beds with beautyrest mattresses, down pillows and blankets, soft cotton sheets. *If you are allergic to down it is imperative you let us know before your arrival so you are comfortable for your stay.*

The bathroom is modern and minimal. We provide shampoo, conditioner and bar soap, a hair dryer, wash cloths, a bath mat, bath towels and hand towel. 

The kitchen has all of your basic cooking needs covered. Coffee machine, French press, tea kettle and fresh roast local coffee. 

We have a large pullout couch in the living room and a nice flat screen tv with Netflix and roku so you can sign in with your personal subscriptions.  


Check out our Instagram to get a closer look! @goldinnchicagoairbnb

Guests have full access to the apartment which has been remodeled with your comfort in mind.

You will enjoy full privacy and minimal to no interaction with us, depending on the needs of our guest.

Centrally located between the hip restaurants, bars and cafés on Division St. and the six corners in Wicker Park. 

Thrillest called Wicker Park "one of the coolest neighborhoods in America"

Forbes ranked Wicker Park "4th hippest neighborhood in the country"

One block from the Division blue line stop which runs between downtown and O'Hare Airport. And just 1 block to the Milwaukee, Ashland and Division buses.

There is a 1-bedroom coach house and a 2 bedroom apartment on this property as well. Get all three for large groups!

Our units feature a digitial lock. Once we confirm your reservation, a code will be supplied that will give you access to your apartment for the duration of your stay.

Find us on Instagram.

@goldinnchicagoairbnb

description:
Brand new service property. Beautiful single family house in a very convenient and safe Chicago west suburb, Forest Park. This cozy basement bedrm. Common areas including living & dining rm, kitchen, and laundry area. Accommodates business travelers with office amenities ( e.g., Wifi, printer, copier, iron, ...) & washer+dryer. 

Close to public trans & I-290 exprwy. 15 min to downtown via train & 15 min by car (normal traffic). Clse to Loyola Med Ctr, Hines VA & Rush Hsptls.

Cereal, waffles and coffee are provided by the host for the ARRIVAL day/night of the guests. 

The closest grocery stores are Fair Share Finer Foods, Amer Grocery Store and Carnival Grocery. Nearby coffee shops include Circle K, Buzz Cafe and The Happy Apple Pie Shop. Nearby restaurants include Pete's Red Hot's, Happiness Chinese and Bodhi Thai Bistro.

access: Make yourself at home! You have free range of the entire apartment!
description:
Steps from the Logan Square Blue Line stop that connects you from O'hare Airport to the Loop and everything in between! You also have the Milwaukee Bus steps away that takes you to all the hip neighborhoods.  All types of food right at your finger tips Reno, Billy Sunday, Longman and Eagle, Lulu Cafe, NewWave Coffee, or if you want to just relax on the grassy blvd and watch the world go by.

Large, green, sunny apartment with free street parking right out front! Lots of entertainment at walking distance, movies, coffee, cocktail bars, dive bars, and a variety of restaurants! And two furry snuggle monsters that are a crowd favorite! Come Jan 1st 420 friendly!

Make yourself at home! You have free range of the entire apartment!

I work during the days, and am in and out of the apartment in the evenings.

Logan Square is the Brooklyn of Chicago, lots of intimate restaurants and cocktail bars! During the summer every Sunday the Logan Square Farmers market is just steps away. The neighborhood is the right amount of busy. You'll absolutely love the convenience to all the things!

The blue line is a block away, there is also the Milwaukee bus and the Diversey bus, as well as Divy bikes. Lyft, Uber & Via are all available as well!

All types of food right at your finger tips Reno, Billy Sunday, Longman and Eagle, Lulu Cafe, NewWave Coffee, or if you want to just relax on the grassy blvd and watch the world go by.
transit: The blue line is a block away, there is also the Milwaukee bus and the Diversey bus, as well as Divy bikes. Lyft, Uber & Via are all available as well!

access: Guests can access the living/ dining room (which has a mini-fridge, coffee maker, and a microwave), 2 shared bedrooms, and bathroom. We do have a couple storage closets and a utility room in the basement which we ask that you don't use while you stay with us. Other than that, it's all yours and you won't see any of our personal belongings as this space is intended specifically for our guests.
description:
Welcome to your new vacation suite! This is a completely renovated basement listing with separate access from the home. Conveniently situated near McCormick Place, our home offers visitors an ideal location in the center of everything the Windy City has to offer. Guests can easily reach the best shopping, dining, museums, landmarks, and attractions with ease. We're just minutes away from some of Chicago's most exciting attractions and activities. Hope you enjoy your stay and welcome to Chicago!

The space is a two bedroom garden unit with a living/ dining area and a bathroom. The living/ dining area has a sofa, dining set, television, mini –fridge, coffee maker, and microwave. Guests have their own private entrance which has a code so checking in and out will be a breeze. Also, there is free street parking as well.

Guests can access the living/ dining room (which has a mini-fridge, coffee maker, and a microwave), 2 shared bedrooms, and bathroom. We do have a couple storage closets and a utility room in the basement which we ask that you don't use while you stay with us. Other than that, it's all yours and you won't see any of our personal belongings as this space is intended specifically for our guests.

We are a small family who live in the upper levels of the house. We are friendly and can be available for questions but completely respect your privacy so just let us know if you need us! Entry door is equipped with key-less entry and the code will be provided to you prior to your arrival.

Bronzeville is a neighborhood on the South Side of Chicago. It is near the Illinois Institute of Technology, VanderCook College of Music, and Illinois College of Optometry. 
Chicago Attractions Nearby include McCormick Place, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium, Field Museum of Natural History, Millennium Park, Chicago Children's Museum, Soldier Field, Museum of Science & Industry, Navy Pier, & Wrigley Field.

Chicago offers a variety of ways to get around. They include the bus and trains of the Chicago Transit Authority, as well as the Metra Electric District Main Line.

- NO PARTIES, EVENTS, ETC. ARE ALLOWED ON THE PROPERTY. 
- Codes are not to be shared with others...only with members of the booking party.
- Only the amount of people that have been booked are allowed to enter the unit. Additional guests will be charged a per person per day fee. 
- Film crews are not billed at the same rate as a normal staying guest.
- NO SMOKING of any kind is allowed in the property.

Our home is located in Chicago, Illinois, United States. It takes approximately 20 minutes to drive to Chicago Midway International Airport. It takes 40 minutes to drive to O'Hare International Airport.
Chicago Attractions Nearby include McCormick Place, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium, Field Museum of Natural History, Millennium Park, Chicago Children's Museum, Soldier Field, Museum of Science & Industry, Navy Pier, & Wrigley Field.

additional_house_rules:
Luggage Storage and Check In Times must be arranged at least 24 hours in advance. Otherwise, check in times are subject to our schedule and may involve waits up to 4 hours from the time you say you would like to be checked in

Luggage Storage and Early Check In are subject to availability.  

We meet all new guests personally and do a tour and answer questions.  Due to this, it's important to us that you do not wait for us, and we do not wait for you.  Alterations or arriving late to check in times may be subject to a 15 per hour charge to pay an employee to sit around and wait for you.  In some cases, you may have to wait for a few hours for someone to be free to check you in if you change your time last minute to go explore, eat, drink, or visit friends.  

 If you have provided your flight/train/bus information and we can confirm it was delayed no charges will apply for being late and we’ll make it work.  



Quiet time is after 10pm.  What this means is the upstairs common area is off limits if there are guests.  If you or the other group in your bedroom is trying to sleep you are obligated to be quiet, do not turn on lights, do not use your cell phones or laptops.  You can do this in the first floor in our 24 hour common area.  This kitchen on the first floor may also be used for cooking during quiet hours if you are quiet about it.  The upstairs kitchen is off limits from 10pm to 8am so as to not wake guests in the living room.


Dishes are placed into the dish rack.  If there is no room in the dish rack, please put enough dishes away to fit yours, and then put yours in the dish rack. 

Cigarette and marijuana can be smoked outside in the backyard.  

If your clothes require laundering, we can wash them for you for $4 a load. We will provide you with a bag for the laundry if you need.  We will return it within 24 hours, washed and dried.  We only provide folding for additional charge.  We do not guarantee guest laundry on Fridays due to it being a busy linens day.  

No Shoes Inside.  Please carry them to your space and keep stored away.

Do not open or close windows without getting permission via the Airbnb app.  We have automatic thermostats and are usually running either the heat or the air conditioning.

access:
Guests have access to their sleeping rooms at any time.  During the evening the upstairs living room is off limits from 10pm until 8am as it is used for sleeping.  We maintain a downstairs kitchen and 24 hour common area on the first floor for use during quiet hours.  Do keep cooking noises to a minimum during that time.  We have a backyard with fire pit, chairs, and garden that can be enjoyed.  That is the approved smoking area for cigarettes and marijuana.  

Guests do not have access to the basement, laundry facilities, or any bedroom they have not booked personally.  Guests may not open or close windows without permission and may not adjust the thermostat.
description:
This is for a private room in our apartment. The room contains a full bed and a twin bed. There are two closets for guests to use to store their belongings. The room has a mini fridge for storing personal food items. Breakfast is included in your stay. We keep the pantry stocked with eggs, bacon, milk, orange juice, jam, bread, fruit, pancake mix, coffee and tea. Any of these items can be used to make yourself breakfast in the morning.

We run dorm-style listings here with 2 beds per bedroom.  We have and enforce quiet hours from 10pm until 8am in sleeping areas.  We maintain a 24 hour common space that can be used during quiet hours.  We have two bathrooms and two kitchens.  We have gigabit internet shared among everyone.    We have two cats.

Guests have access to their sleeping rooms at any time.  During the evening the upstairs living room is off limits from 10pm until 8am as it is used for sleeping.  We maintain a downstairs kitchen and 24 hour common area on the first floor for use during quiet hours.  Do keep cooking noises to a minimum during that time.  We have a backyard with fire pit, chairs, and garden that can be enjoyed.  That is the approved smoking area for cigarettes and marijuana.  

Guests do not have access to the basement, laundry facilities, or any bedroom they have not booked personally.  Guests may not open or close windows without permission and may not adjust the thermostat.

We generally work from home and will normally be around.  If we are not, you can always reach us for non-emergencies from about 9am until midnight 7 days a week via Airbnb messaging.  If there is an emergency then please call or bang on our door.  

We prefer most questions to be sent via messaging as we have 3 sets of people who monitor those messages and you're likely to get a faster response.  Do not knock on our door for any reason when it's closed unless there is an emergency.  

We are happy to give any guest their space, but also have no trouble socializing and interacting with you.  Just make your preferences known!

We are in the far north neighborhood of Chicago almost as far as you can be from downtown while still being in Chicago.  We are the largest concentration of sub-saharan african in the city and as such have an assortment of amazing ethnic food from Jerk Chicken to Senegals national dish.  

The Red line that is exactly 1.1 mile walking from our front door run 24 hours a day.  You will encounter homeless people on and around the red line.  

Based off the recorded crime statistics from prior years, of 77 neighborhoods in chicago, we are ranked in the lowest 10 neighborhoods for crime.

1.1 miles to nearest train station.
45-75 min to Downtown via Public Transit 
My house to O’Hare in 60 minutes via bus/train and a single transfer.
$35 from My house to O’Hare by flat rate cab.
$6 from the nearest train stop to my house by cab 
$2.25 from ANY eL stop in Chicago to the Red/Purple Line train stop by my house (Howard)

We run this property as an Airbnb property. It is most similar to a dorm or hostel setup, but cleaner and better amenities than your typical hostel or dorm.   We do not have a lot of privacy here unless you book a private room and on any given day there will be between 10 and 15 people among all three floors and two bathrooms.  If communal living and sharing spaces with other people is a problem for you, please seek out alternative accommodations.

If you DO find anything out of place or needing replacement like food, toilet paper or similar, we are very responsive through messaging.  We do twice daily walk throughs but it only takes one guest to mess something up and unless you tell us we wont catch it until our next scheduled walk through.  

We schedule by appointment between 2pm and midnight.  If you do not set an appointment, you agree and understand that you may have to wait up to 4 hours past the time you wish to check in due to letting us know within 24 hours of your check in.  

In addition, if you fail to meet your scheduled appointment time you may be charged 15 dollars per hour pro rated in order for an employee to sit and wait for you. This includes check-ins requested after midnight as this is outside our normal check-in window. Delayed flights or bus situations are exempt from this.  

We can usually meet 99% of our guests at the time of their choosing assuming they let us know 24 hours or more in advance.  Those we cannot are offered some type of compensation or a full refund if they wish to cancel.  

Failure to clean dishes will result in a $5 charge for the cleaning person who cleans up after you.

Laundry service is provided and only available for a $4 per load charge.  We have an above average size machine and most guests have no trouble having a weeks worth of laundry being one load.  We require $4 before we return your clothes and will wash it, dry it, and return it within 24 hours. Please empty all pockets.   We do not provide service on Friday except for people checking in on Friday who need it by Saturday. Unless told otherwise, all clothes are washed machine wash warm and high heat dry.  

Dishes when used are to be washed right away so they are available for the next guest.  Most people wash them while the food is still too hot to eat and do their plates and such when done eating.  Do not leave things to soak or come back to them an hour later.  
|
Do not store any cooked food in the fridge other than in tupperware containers.  No plates, pots, pans, or similar.  

Utilize your in-room fridge before using the kitchen fridge.  Kitchen fridge items must be removed from any grocery bags, labeled with your name using the marker on top of the fridge, and placed in the fridge, NOT on the breakfast shelf

notes:
We run this property as an Airbnb property. It is most similar to a dorm or hostel setup, but cleaner and better amenities than your typical hostel or dorm.   We do not have a lot of privacy here unless you book a private room and on any given day there will be between 10 and 15 people among all three floors and two bathrooms.  If communal living and sharing spaces with other people is a problem for you, please seek out alternative accommodations.

If you DO find anything out of place or needing replacement like food, toilet paper or similar, we are very responsive through messaging.  We do twice daily walk throughs but it only takes one guest to mess something up and unless you tell us we wont catch it until our next scheduled walk through.  

We schedule by appointment between 2pm and midnight.  If you do not set an appointment, you agree and understand that you may have to wait up to 4 hours past the time you wish to check in due to letting us know within 24 hours of your check in.  

In addition, if you fail to meet your scheduled appointment time you may be charged 15 dollars per hour pro rated in order for an employee to sit and wait for you. This includes check-ins requested after midnight as this is outside our normal check-in window. Delayed flights or bus situations are exempt from this.  

We can usually meet 99% of our guests at the time of their choosing assuming they let us know 24 hours or more in advance.  Those we cannot are offered some type of compensation or a full refund if they wish to cancel.  

Failure to clean dishes will result in a $5 charge for the cleaning person who cleans up after you.

Laundry service is provided and only available for a $4 per load charge.  We have an above average size machine and most guests have no trouble having a weeks worth of laundry being one load.  We require $4 before we return your clothes and will wash it, dry it, and return it within 24 hours. Please empty all pockets.   We do not provide service on Friday except for people checking in on Friday who need it by Saturday. Unless told otherwise, all clothes are washed machine wash warm and high heat dry.  

Dishes when used are to be washed right away so they are available for the next guest.  Most people wash them while the food is still too hot to eat and do their plates and such when done eating.  Do not leave things to soak or come back to them an hour later.  
|
Do not store any cooked food in the fridge other than in tupperware containers.  No plates, pots, pans, or similar.  

Utilize your in-room fridge before using the kitchen fridge.  Kitchen fridge items must be removed from any grocery bags, labeled with your name using the marker on top of the fridge, and placed in the fridge, NOT on the breakfast shelf
space: We run dorm-style listings here with 2 beds per bedroom.  We have and enforce quiet hours from 10pm until 8am in sleeping areas.  We maintain a 24 hour common space that can be used during quiet hours.  We have two bathrooms and two kitchens.  We have gigabit internet shared among everyone.    We have two cats.
summary: This is for a private room in our apartment. The room contains a full bed and a twin bed. There are two closets for guests to use to store their belongings. The room has a mini fridge for storing personal food items. Breakfast is included in your stay. We keep the pantry stocked with eggs, bacon, milk, orange juice, jam, bread, fruit, pancake mix, coffee and tea. Any of these items can be used to make yourself breakfast in the morning.
transit:
1.1 miles to nearest train station.
45-75 min to Downtown via Public Transit 
My house to O’Hare in 60 minutes via bus/train and a single transfer.
$35 from My house to O’Hare by flat rate cab.
$6 from the nearest train stop to my house by cab 
$2.25 from ANY eL stop in Chicago to the Red/Purple Line train stop by my house (Howard)

additional_house_rules:
The House Manager lives at the AirBnB. You can contact him for anything. However, I may be out of town. 

1. Quiet time after 10p.m. until 8a.m.
2. Naturally, please clean up after yourself (i.e. dishes, trash, anything left on countertops, etc.) to avoid a cleaning fee. 
3. Strip the bed of sheets and pillow cases; leave the blankets folded on the bed; throw all dirty linens into the laundry baskets or the floor. 
4. No visitors permitted on the property with the express permission of the Host. 
4. Enjoy your stay! :-)
p.s. The laundry room is only available to guests staying a week or longer.
Thank you.

access: Please remove your shoes at the front door. You may want to bring slippers.  Kitchen and bathroom and office center are common areas. Living room has cable, Netflix, & Amazon Firestick.
description:
Self-service, both SHARED ROOM is on the 2nd Floor. One room is 450 sq ft (41 sq m) and one's 100 s.f.  Make your own bed and remove the bed sheets at check out. House Rules. 
Very SAFE area with single family homes and  in walking distance. 
There are 2 private rooms, also, if you prefer.
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/15094729?s=51
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/15871357?s=51

Early check in is available $10 for every 2.5 hours. 
Prices are subject to change.

This 2nd floor room is Shared, SELF SERVICE. Meaning, your bed is one of the beds in the 110 sq ft room or 450 sq ft room. Cozy bungalow in safe neighborhood. Longer stays are on the 1st floor in private rooms.  The kitchen & bathroom are shared so we all need to clean up after ourselves.  Thanks.

Please remove your shoes at the front door. You may want to bring slippers.  Kitchen and bathroom and office center are common areas. Living room has cable, Netflix, & Amazon Firestick.

Guest's can text me or call anytime.  I'm happy to help.

Very residential and safe neighborhood. 2 houses away from the highway & corner. All local amenties nearby.  Less than 1 mile to: train, grocery store, library, pharmacy, USMLE testing center, 10 restaurants, banks, gas station, Chicago Blue Line station (.97km).  3.8 miles from O'Hare airport. 45 minutes to the center of downtown; 4 miles to Rosemont; 6 miles to downtown Des Plaines.

There's I-90 Kennedy Expressway 2 doors away from us. The Harlem Avenue Blue Line train station is 6 blocks away, which will take you to the airport or downtown. 45 minutes to the heart of downtown. Easy to get a Lyft or Uber because the highway is Nextdoor. Walk to CTA Blue Line, which goes straight into the airport or downtown.  24 Hour Pass is $10, 3Day pass= $20; 7 Day pass= $28. Easy access to highway, taxis, Uber.  Walking to restaurants, grocery store, etc.

There's plenty of FREE street parking.

description:
BRAND NEW BUILDING!!! This is the most IMMACULATE property in the City of Chicago!!!  This listing consists of 2 Suites directly next to each other (you will have 2 units in the entire building). Perfect for your group of 7 - 31 people!  There are 7 bedrooms that each contain 2 queen beds, 6 bathrooms, 2 incredible kitchens and fancy living rooms.  There is also a private rooftop patio for you and your group to enjoy.  We also have attached garage parking available for your cars.  

2 Units!!!!

additional_house_rules:
Luggage Storage and Check In Times must be arranged at least 24 hours in advance. Otherwise, check in times are subject to our schedule and may involve waits up to 4 hours from the time you say you would like to be checked in

Luggage Storage and Early Check In are subject to availability.  

We meet all new guests personally and do a tour and answer questions.  Due to this, it's important to us that you do not wait for us, and we do not wait for you.  Alterations or arriving late to check in times may be subject to a 15 per hour charge to pay an employee to sit around and wait for you.  In some cases, you may have to wait for a few hours for someone to be free to check you in if you change your time last minute to go explore, eat, drink, or visit friends.  

 If you have provided your flight/train/bus information and we can confirm it was delayed no charges will apply for being late and we’ll make it work.  



Quiet time is after 10pm.  What this means is the upstairs common area is off limits if there are guests.  If you or the other group in your bedroom is trying to sleep you are obligated to be quiet, do not turn on lights, do not use your cell phones or laptops.  You can do this in the first floor in our 24 hour common area.  This kitchen on the first floor may also be used for cooking during quiet hours if you are quiet about it.  The upstairs kitchen is off limits from 10pm to 8am so as to not wake guests in the living room.


Dishes are placed into the dish rack.  If there is no room in the dish rack, please put enough dishes away to fit yours, and then put yours in the dish rack. 

Cigarette and marijuana can be smoked outside in the backyard.  

If your clothes require laundering, we can wash them for you for $4 a load. We will provide you with a bag for the laundry if you need.  We will return it within 24 hours, washed and dried.  We only provide folding for additional charge.  We do not guarantee guest laundry on Fridays due to it being a busy linens day.  

No Shoes Inside.  Please carry them to your space and keep stored away.

Do not open or close windows without getting permission via the Airbnb app.  We have automatic thermostats and are usually running either the heat or the air conditioning.

access:
Guests have access to their sleeping rooms at any time.  During the evening the upstairs living room is off limits from 10pm until 8am as it is used for sleeping.  We maintain a downstairs kitchen and 24 hour common area on the first floor for use during quiet hours.  Do keep cooking noises to a minimum during that time.  We have a backyard with fire pit, chairs, and garden that can be enjoyed.  That is the approved smoking area for cigarettes and marijuana.  

Guests do not have access to the basement, laundry facilities, or any bedroom they have not booked personally.  Guests may not open or close windows without permission and may not adjust the thermostat.
description:
This is for a private room in our apartment. The room has a queen and twin bed in it. There are two closets available for guests to use. The room also has a desk, and mini fridge.

Breakfast is included in your stay. We keep the pantry stocked with eggs, bacon, milk, orange juice, jam, bread, fruit, pancake mix, coffee and tea. Any of these items can be used to make yourself breakfast in the morning.

The two levels of our home are set up as individual apartments. The bedrooms and living rooms have spaces rented out to guests.  We have and enforce quiet hours from 10pm until 8am in sleeping areas.  We maintain a 24 hour common space that can be used during quiet hours.  We have two bathrooms and two kitchens.  We have gigabit internet shared among everyone.    We have two cats.

Guests have access to their sleeping rooms at any time.  During the evening the upstairs living room is off limits from 10pm until 8am as it is used for sleeping.  We maintain a downstairs kitchen and 24 hour common area on the first floor for use during quiet hours.  Do keep cooking noises to a minimum during that time.  We have a backyard with fire pit, chairs, and garden that can be enjoyed.  That is the approved smoking area for cigarettes and marijuana.  

Guests do not have access to the basement, laundry facilities, or any bedroom they have not booked personally.  Guests may not open or close windows without permission and may not adjust the thermostat.

We generally work from home and will normally be around.  If we are not, you can always reach us for non-emergencies from about 9am until midnight 7 days a week via Airbnb messaging.  If there is an emergency then please call or bang on our co-hosts door located at the end of the hallway on the first floor.  NOT the bedroom closest to the bathroom.

We prefer most questions to be sent via messaging as we have 3 sets of people who monitor those messages and you're likely to get a faster response.  Do not knock on our door for any reason when it's closed unless there is an emergency.  

We are happy to give any guest their space, but also have no trouble socializing and interacting with you.  Just make your preferences known!

We are in the far north neighborhood of Chicago almost as far as you can be from downtown while still being in Chicago.  We are the largest concentration of sub-saharan african in the city and as such have an assortment of amazing ethnic food from Jerk Chicken to Senegalese national dish to Ethiopean.  

The Red line is exactly 1.1 mile walking from our front door run 24 hours a day.  You will encounter homeless people on and around the red line.  

Based off the recorded crime statistics from prior years, of 77 neighborhoods in Chicago, we are ranked in the lowest 10 neighborhoods for crime.

1.1 miles to nearest train station. 45-75 minutes to Downtown
O’Hare in 60 minutes via bus/train and a single transfer (prior to 10 PM)
O’Hare in 120 minutes via train and single transfer (after 10 PM)
$35 from my house to O’Hare by flat rate cab.
$7 from the nearest train stop to my house by cab.
$2.25 from any eL stop in Chicago to the Red Line train stop by my house.
There are 3 bus stops within 3 blocks of our house which bring you to the Red, Blue, or Brown lines.  Its generally quicker to walk down Howard as the buses run less often.
from our house to downtown is approximately 25 minutes to 1 hour Depending on time of day and traffic

We run this property as an Airbnb property. It is most similar to a dorm or hostel setup, but cleaner and better amenities than your typical hostel or dorm.   We do not have a lot of privacy here unless you book a private room and on any given day there will be between 10 and 15 people among all three floors and two bathrooms.  If communal living and sharing spaces with other people is a problem for you, please seek out alternative accommodations.

If you DO find anything out of place or needing replacement like food, toilet paper or similar, we are very responsive through messaging.  We do twice daily walk throughs but it only takes one guest to mess something up and unless you tell us we wont catch it until our next scheduled walk through.  

We schedule by appointment between 2pm and midnight.  If you do not set an appointment, you agree and understand that you may have to wait up to 4 hours past the time you wish to check in due to letting us know late.  

In addition, if you fail to meet your scheduled appointment time you may be charged 15 dollars per hour pro rated in order for an employee to sit and wait for you. This includes check-ins requested after midnight as this is outside our normal check-in window. Delayed flights or bus situations are exempt from this.  We do need to be provided with your flight/bus/train information prior to the day of so we can monitor on our end.  

We can usually meet 99% of our guests at the time of their choosing assuming they let us know 24 hours or more in advance.  Those we cannot are offered some type of compensation or a full refund if they wish to cancel.  

Failure to clean dishes will result in a $5 charge for the cleaning person who cleans up after you.

Keep in mind shared Airbnb places may result in you being roomed with someone who snores.  We offer free complimentary earplugs for this but that isn’t always enough. As this is something beyond someone's control, we do not wake guests up who snore nor do we offer discounts to people who cannot sleep due to snoring.  We recommend having earbuds or high quality ear plugs anytime you travel to account for this risk.  

Laundry service is provided and only available for a $4 per load charge.  We have an above average size machine and most guests have no trouble having a weeks worth of laundry being one load.  We require $4 before we return your clothes and will wash it, dry it, and return it within 24 hours. Please empty all pockets.   We do not provide service on Friday except for people checking in on Friday who need it by Saturday. Unless told otherwise, all clothes are washed machine wash warm and high heat dry.  

Dishes when used are to be washed right away so they are available for the next guest.  Most people wash them while the food is still too hot to eat and do their plates and such when done eating.  Do not leave things to soak or come back to them an hour later.  

Do not store any cooked food in the fridge other than in tupperware containers.  No plates, pots, pans, or similar.  

Utilize your in-room fridge before using the kitchen fridge.  Kitchen fridge items must be removed from any grocery bags, labeled with your name using the marker on top of the fridge, and placed in the fridge, NOT on the breakfast shelf.
house_rules:
Luggage Storage and Check In Times must be arranged at least 24 hours in advance. Otherwise, check in times are subject to our schedule and may involve waits up to 4 hours from the time you say you would like to be checked in

Luggage Storage and Early Check In are subject to availability.  

We meet all new guests personally and do a tour and answer questions.  Due to this, it's important to us that you do not wait for us, and we do not wait for you.  Alterations or arriving late to check in times may be subject to a 15 per hour charge to pay an employee to sit around and wait for you.  In some cases, you may have to wait for a few hours for someone to be free to check you in if you change your time last minute to go explore, eat, drink, or visit friends.  

 If you have provided your flight/train/bus information and we can confirm it was delayed no charges will apply for being late and we’ll make it work.  



Quiet time is after 10pm.  What this means is the upstairs common area is off limits if there are guests.  If you or the other group in your bedroom is trying to sleep you are obligated to be quiet, do not turn on lights, do not use your cell phones or laptops.  You can do this in the first floor in our 24 hour common area.  This kitchen on the first floor may also be used for cooking during quiet hours if you are quiet about it.  The upstairs kitchen is off limits from 10pm to 8am so as to not wake guests in the living room.


Dishes are placed into the dish rack.  If there is no room in the dish rack, please put enough dishes away to fit yours, and then put yours in the dish rack. 

Cigarette and marijuana can be smoked outside in the backyard.  

If your clothes require laundering, we can wash them for you for $4 a load. We will provide you with a bag for the laundry if you need.  We will return it within 24 hours, washed and dried.  We only provide folding for additional charge.  We do not guarantee guest laundry on Fridays due to it being a busy linens day.  

No Shoes Inside.  Please carry them to your space and keep stored away.

Do not open or close windows without getting permission via the Airbnb app.  We have automatic thermostats and are usually running either the heat or the air conditioning.

additional_house_rules:
We have surveillance and/or recording devices at the property ONLY in our common areas including: 
2 in the kitchen, 1 in the upstairs hall, 1 in the downstairs hall, 1 in the living room, 1 in the family room,  1  pointing at the front door, 1 in the dining room, 1 ring doorbell,  1 outside pointing at the patio. 

Renting with us means that you have read and accepted that fact that common areas are being surveyed and/or recorded for the safety and security of our home, ourselves and our guests. 


All guests must clean what they use. That includes dishes. 

NOTE: The private bedrooms lock with a key. In the case of a guest forgetting to leave his key or if a key is lost, there will be an additional fee of $20.00 to replace said key. This covers the cost of replacing the lock and is non negotiable.
