access: Guest will have complete and private access to the entire unit.  IMPORTANT:  Please include in your booking request some information about your trip to Chicago and with whom you will be traveling.  Thanks!
description: Host movie nights in a sleek screening room with a surround sound system. Follow warm timber floors to the many other areas in this spacious loft, including an industrial-chic chef's kitchen and elegant bedrooms decorated in soothing shades of gray.
interaction: We are here to help if you have any concerns, questions, or want local recommendations.
neighborhood_overview: The loft is in a former picture-frame factory in the River West neighborhood. Walk to Wicker Park in 10 minutes and Buck Town in 15 minutes. Restaurants, coffee shops, and bars are near and abundant. Buses and subway are two minutes from the door.
notes: Inside the property there is a camera pointing at the back entrance.  It is in a fixed position (does not rotate or zoom).  Your privacy is important to me, as is your security.   You can see what it sees in a photo in my listing.
space:
Shangri-La is a fictional place described in the 1933 novel Lost Horizon, by James Hilton. Hilton describes Shangri-La as a mystical, harmonious valley. Shangri-La has become synonymous with any earthly paradise, particularly a mythical Himalayan utopia – a permanently happy land, isolated from the world.

This Shangri-La is a completely updated and newly renovated home that was an old picture frame factory, 110 years ago. You'll fall in love with the exposed brick + high timber ceilings, hardwood floors, Grohe body spray showers, huge Jacuzzi, granite + SS kitchen, new LG washer, pool table and home theatre with an Xfinity cable package (125+Channels + Netflix, Amazon, etc).   Alexa lives on the kitchen counter and you can ask her anything about the neighborhood, weather, or just have her play music.  The home includes two Nest thermostats for convenient temperature adjustments. 

The three bedrooms feature 2 kings (Serta Masterpiece mattress & Brentwood Home 13" gel memory foam mattress in the other) and 1 queen, all equipped with smart TVs for your comfort and pack n play for traveling families. Enjoy your stay in high-end comfort and privacy.
summary: Host movie nights in a sleek screening room with a surround sound system. Follow warm timber floors to the many other areas in this spacious loft, including an industrial-chic chef's kitchen and elegant bedrooms decorated in soothing shades of gray.
transit:
Super convenient to get downtown. The 66 bus to Magnificent mile is 10 minutes. 

Blue Line L to downtown or Wicker Park/Bucktown in 2 stops either direction, and O'Hare in a snap.

access: You will have access to the entire apartment, this is NOT a shared apartment. You will also have access to private balcony's.
description:
Come stay in this enormous and completely private brand new 3BR sanctuary, located in Chicago's Bucktown neighborhood, steps from bustling Damen Ave shopping, dining & loads of entertainment. 

Bucktown Chic II is a brand new modern masterpiece w/ loads up upgrades including a huge shower,  heated bath floors, fireplace, high end appliances, private washer/dryer, 3 enormous BR's, 2.1 baths, private balcony &  garage parking. 

Steps from brand new Midtown Athletic Club and endless shopping.

This is a completely private condo, approximately 1,800 SF on the second floor of a new condo building. Enjoy a huge and open space for entertaining, 3 private bedrooms including a master suite with spa-like shower. Enjoy two private balconies - one off of the living room and one off of the master. Plus, you have access to an indoor attached parking space and street parking is easy and available.

You will have access to the entire apartment, this is NOT a shared apartment. You will also have access to private balcony's.

I'm available 24/7 and  I'm available as much or as little as you need. Gaining access is easy as you'll receive a private access code with very simple access instructions.

Bucktown Chic II is right on the edge of Bucktown, less than 1/3 mile from Logan Square and steps from Lincoln Park. Getting around Chicago's neighborhoods couldn't be any easier. When heading west, you exit at Damen Avenue and the property is two blocks away and when heading east, you exit at Fullerton. This property also sits at a very vibrant intersection of Damen, Elston and Fullerton. Midtown Athletic Club's brand new state of the art fitness center and hotel is a block away. If you're looking for entertainment, dining and shopping - you can look no further. You can walk to Bucktown's infamous Damen Avenue or Lincoln Park's Clybourn Avenue corridor. You are two blocks from Target, Fresh Thyme grocery store, TJ Max, Marshall's, Jewel Osco and so much more.

Street parking is very easy and free. Guests also have access to one attached garage parking space.

Please note that this property is completely private. We do have a property manager who has installed cameras at the front of the building and in the stairwells on the outside of the apartment. This service is to prevent guests from having parties and making reservations that are falsely represented. Please note that we charge a fee of $35/person initially. If you make a reservation for less people that are actually staying, we will require a $50 per person fee. If you have a party, we will immediately cancel the reservation, mandate that you leave the property immediately with no refund and a loss of security deposit.

additional_house_rules:
* Quiet hours extend daily from 10 pm to 7 am to honor work/sleep schedule of most guests who work in Oak Brook or nearby. 
* Smoking is not allowed in your room or anywhere inside the home. 
* Smoking is allowed outside, if you properly dispose of all ashes, cigarette butts, etc. 
*  No street shoes or boots are worn inside the house.  Please wear gift socks you receive at checkin or your home shoes/slippers inside the house.
* Guests always leave the lower level guest kitchen, gym, entertainment center in as good or better condition as you found it each time you use it--in order to maintain this privilege during your stay. 
* Only registered guests may stay overnight and be present inside the home or on the property. 
* Music, Computers, Entertainment may be loud enough for you to enjoy inside your room or in the entertainment center, without booming throughout the entire house. 
* No pets are invited to stay with guests. 
* No concealed firearms or weapons are allowed in the home or surrounding property, for safety of all present. 
* Extended stay guests who use laundry facilities always start/finish each load within a two hour period so equipment is available for next guest. Laundry may not be done during quiet hours of 10 pm to 7 am. 
*When an issue arises in your room or in the common areas, please inform the owner immediately.
Check-in: Anytime after 3PM
Check-out: 12PM (noon)

description:
Ascend grand foyer stairway to private room w/ wooded views for inspiration.Enjoy exclusive use of a nearby marble bathroom; shared access to lower level guest kitchen w/ dining table, pool table, big screen TV, gym. Stroll 1.2 idyllic acre home landscape; dine on garden patio in upscale, safe neighborhood near corporate office, fine dining and boutique shopping in Oak Brook.Breakfast foods included.For security at checkin guest provides Photo ID verification, Driver's license, Credit card.

An upscale neighborhood of large homes with wooded landscaping has an English countryside feel.  Gorgeous wildlife visits from nearby forest preserve.

It's a 10 minute drive to commuter trains in Elmhurst and Hinsdale.  It's a quick drive to corporate offices, Oak Brook center, golf club, polo, pool, library and hiking trails.

description:
This Polk Community listing is for one bedroom in a three bedroom apartment. The community is made up of 6 bedrooms, spanning two apartments in the same building. For longer stays, feel free to message for better rates.

Polk Place brings in ambitious professionals together within a cozy, vintage themed apartment. The common area is perfect for game nights, reading, potlucks, or even laptop work. Each room is designed for comfort in mind with a Lucid Memory Foam Mattresses and soft bedding to go with it. There is ample wardrobe, closet, and desk space for flexibility in your needs.

Polk community is a part of our larger community that spans through Logan Square. You'll be sharing the common spaces with ambitious professionals, also new to Chicago, so say hello and meet the very interesting people  around you!

Polk sits right next to Chicago's Medical District, home to plenty of bars, restaurants, and a newly finished rugby field! This location is perfect for professionals in the medical field doing rotations or research. We are right next to the Western Blue Line stop which takes you directly downtown in 10 minutes.

We are right next to the Western Blue Line stop which takes you directly downtown in 10 minutes. The Western Bus Line going North goes directly to Bucktown/Wicker Park.
house_rules:
Quiet after 10pm on weekdays
Quiet after 11pm on weekends
No Guests are allowed to sleep in the common areas

additional_house_rules:
- A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled
- Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty)
- Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a fee.
- All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property.
- Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance
- Please contact us for details

description:
Show up and start living from day one in Chicago with this comfortable one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped River North home with stunning high floor views over the city. (#CHI161)

As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Chicago vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- Swimming Pool
- Gym
- Indoor Parking

- Bike Storage
- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

access: All of the place is pretty much able to be used .There will be a few items in the fridge (space will be made to accommodate my guest) and a few of my personal care products in the cabinets .Any questions or concerns please just refer back to me.
description:
Relaxing studio with tech amenities. My place is equipped with Smart tv(complimentary Netflix and hulu),Amazon Alexa , Controlled lighting (by voice) and Playstation 4 and other cool gadgets.Crash on a comfy(tuft and needle brand) bed when the day comes to a end.Located in Andersonville a place sprawling with events and arcade bars with Starbucks literally right next door to get your morning off to a fantastic start.Free street parking on my block (for about a mile).Plus your only a 10-15min Uber ride from lively downtown Chicago!!!

This place is great for single or couple guest that want to get the biggest bang for there buck and enjoy what Chicago has to offer.

All of the place is pretty much able to be used .There will be a few items in the fridge (space will be made to accommodate my guest) and a few of my personal care products in the cabinets .Any questions or concerns please just refer back to me.

You can always reach me through txt on airbnb app.. I will reply a quick as possible.

Uber, Lyft, Metra,Cta and redline are readily available.

My friends that suffer from mobility aliments please keep in mind that i live on the 3rd floor and there is no public elevator. You are welcome but this can prove very challenging.
house_rules: - Please leave shoes at door and be courteous to neighbors when it come to noise at night.
interaction: You can always reach me through txt on airbnb app.. I will reply a quick as possible.
notes: My friends that suffer from mobility aliments please keep in mind that i live on the 3rd floor and there is no public elevator. You are welcome but this can prove very challenging.

description:
The unit is a cozy 1 bdrm luxury apartment with stunning city views. We are 10 minutes from Soldier Field. It is in a secured building with elevator access.   The bedroom features a queen size bed and large closet. The living room has a sofa bed and large Smart TV.  We also have a luxury queen air mattress. The kitchen is equipped with all essential needs.  It has a dishwasher and Keurig for your comfort and convenience.

The unit also has access to a sun deck!

We are available via phone or email.  If you need assistance please do not hesitate to contact us immediately. We want your stay to be enjoyable.

We are just blocks from Chicago museums, shopping, fine dining,  pubs, and upscale clubs.  There is a Whole Foods Grocery in walking distance.  Navy Pier and the lakefront beaches are 10 minutes away via train, cab, or Uber.

We are conveniently located near the Metra, CTA, and several major expressways.  There is a ton of things within walking distance as well.

access: Guests also have access to the main living space. Available to cook and use the kitchen/dining room upon request!
description:
Beautiful private guest bedroom located in Lakeview East in Chicago! Great for those looking to get away and did we mention breakfast can be included?!

Right in the heart of a great neighborhood, close to many restaurants, shops and nightlife.  Steps away from the lake, Wrigley Field, Belmont train station and plenty of buses to take you downtown within 10-15 minutes.

Breakfast can be provided upon request, and dietary restrictions are happily accommodated :)

Bedroom includes private bathroom and sofa pulls out into queen size bed with a comfortable foam mattress pad.

Bedroom also has it's own tv with Apple TV - Netflix, Hulu, HBO & various streaming apps are all set up.

Guests also have access to the main living space. Available to cook and use the kitchen/dining room upon request!

We love socializing with our guests, but also respect our guests space. We are often available to chat and love providing recommendations for the neighborhood and city!

Lakeview East is a vibrant, hip neighborhood great for adults and families.  Cute coffee shop on the corner, many local restaurants, bars, nightlife, and shops one block away.  We have a great list and are happy to share our recommendations upon your arrival!

Close to many public transit options including the bus and the L train.  Free street parking on the street and nearby streets as well.

description:
Show up and start living from day one in Chicago with this pretty one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped River North home with stunning  views over the city. (#CHI144)

As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Chicago vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- Dog Park/Run
- Gym
- Roof Deck

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

- Please contact us for details
interaction:
The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
space:
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Chicago vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- Dog Park/Run
- Gym
- Roof Deck

- Elevator
summary: Show up and start living from day one in Chicago with this pretty one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped River North home with stunning  views over the city. (#CHI144)

access: You have access to shared spaces like the bathroom and sitting room.  You can use the microwave and stove in the kitchen.  To heat food, boil water for tea or prepare any food you may have brought.   We prefer kitchen use at a minimum
description:
For you I have an efficient space with everything you need: quite, clean, and safe neighborhood.  In your private room you will have: Work space with desk and chair, a comfy chair to watch Netflix, Hulu, amazon, and a comfy queen bed. At this west lawn gem there is no shortage of good food.   But if your looking for the city’s bright lights and lively energy downtown is only 30 min away.

Park and fly now available please inquire for more details 

MUST LOVE DOGS to book room.

Only one block away from the 63rd bus that take your straight to midway airport.  If you take a cab or Uber it’s a quick 8 minute drive to the airport.

You have access to shared spaces like the bathroom and sitting room.  You can use the microwave and stove in the kitchen.  To heat food, boil water for tea or prepare any food you may have brought.   We prefer kitchen use at a minimum

I start my day between 8-10am and spend most of the morning cooking, cleaning, and playing with my dog.   I will mostly stay out of your way unless you have questions or need help with anything.

Neighborhood is very clean and quite.   Friendly neighbors and great food walking distance

Easy 3 minute walk to Pulaski bus to take to shops, restaurants almost everything is available off Pulaski.   Also takes you straight to orange line bus stop.  If you prefer to walk to orange line takes about 10-15 minutes.  

Brochure available for bus/train lines  

Easy 3 minute walk to 63rd bus line to take toward midway airport. 

Depending on destination transfer maybe required.

Uber and lyft always available through app service

Midway airport: 2.8 miles. 
(8-12 minute drive) 

Balzekas Museum of Lithuanian Culture: 0.3 miles 
(2 minute drive 7 minute walk) 

Marquette Park and Fishing Spot: 1 mile 
(2 minute drive 10 minute walk) 

Ohare airport: 27-32 miles.  (38-55 minute drive) 

Center of Chicago: 11 miles.
(25-30 minute drive)

Field museum: 11 miles.
(25-30 minute drive)

Navy pier: 13 miles 
(30-35 minute drive)

Shedd aquarium: 11 miles 
(30 minute drive)

Willis tower: 11 miles
(30 minute drive)

Lincoln park zoo: 16 miles
(35-40 minute drive)

Brookfield zoo: 11 miles
(30 minute drive)

Breakfast provided is Quaker oatmeal single serve.   Variety packs.  No extra charge we will leave stocked in kitchen. 

 More things to note: 

We do offer discounts on weekly and monthly stay.   

Just keep in mind we will not be restocking or resetting your room after check in.  I will set you up for success and stock accordingly to your stay.  

Pets:  we are pet friendly but will require an additional cleaning fee for pets. Amount will be determined by length of stay.  

Laundry drop off is available for personal cloths $10 per medium/large load

If your with us long enough that blankets need to be washed just let me know and I can get your linens washed with 48 hours of notice

access: Kitchen, washroom,  living room, Deck and grill outside.
description:
This are separate private rooms with full size beds or twin beds.Rooms are great for single or couples, or small groups. You have access to washroom, living Room and kitchen.  All in same floor. WiFi access.

Its a two floor house.  I live in house and will be in house at times. Rooms have its private  area w doors. Please ask me of room options because some room have different size beds. The house has a total of four bedrooms. 6 beds total. One room in first floor . Three rooms  in second floor.

Kitchen, washroom,  living room, Deck and grill outside.

I will be in house. Not much. I respect privacy. I'm here to provide a pleasant and warm welcome stay. Some days and nights my children will be around house . They are grown . Most of the time they keep to themselves.

Its in a great Chicago area. House is 8 miles west of Wrigley field.  15 minutes away from downtown. Minutes away from public transportation.

Public transportation within walking distance.  Bus can take you to blue line.

I have other small rooms available.  With twin size beds. Please ask me what's available if you have a small group. The bad review I received was due lack of understanding. I will correct the errors and make sure my guest have a great experience

expectations: [{'type': 'security_deposit', 'title': 'Security Deposit - if you damage the home, you may be charged up to $250'}]
description:
Close to downtown Chicago, IIT, McCorMick Place Convention Center. Private  bedroom. Shared bathroom with just one other person. Renovated historic Victorian rowhouse with charming original architectural structures.  High ceiling. Exposed brick walll. Hardwood floor.

Full bed, desk, closet, linen organizer. TV.


FREE use of washer/Dryer. FREE WIFI. 15 minutes drive to downtown. 15 minutes on Redline or Greenline train (only 2 stops to reach downtown). Also many buses to downtown. Central air conditioning at nights and weekends in the Summer. 24 hrs (thermostat) central heat in the Winter.

Duplex home with kitchen and living room on the 1st floor. Back yard with wood deck equipped with bbq. You will have a private bedroom. Shared bathroom with just one another person.

* 3 blocks to Green Line and Red Line. Half a block to bus #4 from downtown. A few blocks to bus #3 to Water Tower, and #29 to Navy Pier.

* 15 blocks to McCormick Place convention center. Taxi should cost less than $10. Or take bus #3. Or nice long walk in Summer.

* 3-block walk to Illinois Institute of Technology (IIT), 35th street campus.

* 6 blocks to Vandercook college of music

* 7 blocks to IL college of Optometry 

* 13 blocks (biking distance) from Mercy Hospital 

Plenty of free street parking at the front of the house. Very friendly homeowner. We provide a safe and secure homestay -- once confirm your booking, you will need to confirm your identity by emailing me a copy of passport, or student ID, or intern letter or evidence of employment. 

Full access to kitchen, living room, and back deck. However, light cooking only, please - no splashy oily or smoky cooking.

PLEASE NOTE: Up-and-coming neighborhood. Police head-quarters is just a block away. We, all at the house, use public transportation -- "VERY" convenient.
house_rules:
Light cooking OK.

We provide bed linen, pillow, and blanket. 

For long term booking,  price doesn't include cleaning services inside bedroom.

"Free" street parking is very easy to find at the front of the house. I always find a spot for myself within 1 block. 

No smoking. No pet.

Cancellation and refund through airbnb only.
space:
Full bed, desk, closet, linen organizer. TV.


FREE use of washer/Dryer. FREE WIFI. 15 minutes drive to downtown. 15 minutes on Redline or Greenline train (only 2 stops to reach downtown). Also many buses to downtown. Central air conditioning at nights and weekends in the Summer. 24 hrs (thermostat) central heat in the Winter.

access: This spacious apartment has a separate entrance and the whole apartment is private.
description:
This spacious 3-bedroom apartment is on the main level of a historic home just blocks away from popular restaurants, bars, shops and cafes.  The apartment features a full kitchen, dining room, private bathroom, and laundry.  Perfect for a group getaway!

Our spacious 3-bedroom apartment includes a full kitchen, dining room, private bathroom, washer/dryer and dish washer.  Enjoy staying in a premier neighborhood just blocks away from all the action!  We're also just minutes away from downtown, United Center and Wrigley Field.

This spacious apartment has a separate entrance and the whole apartment is private.

We are a fully staffed Bed & Breakfast. Our office is open 7am - 9pm, Mon - Fri and 8am - 8pm, Sat & Sun.

Wicker Park is a thriving community full of restaurants, bars, shops, and cafes along with beautiful historic and newly-remodeled homes on quiet tree-lined streets.  Just minutes away from downtown, guests can easily experience Chicago attractions or catch a game at Wrigley Field or a show at the United Center.  The apartment is centrally located and close to many popular spots in Chicago.  Come stay and live like a local!

We are blocks away from the nearest train station and a block from the Milwaukee Ave bus.  Both take you directly into downtown.  You can also rent a Divvy bike or electric scooter or request an Uber, Lyft or hail a cab.  A car is not needed to get around town.

We offer secure parking and a full breakfast each morning at the B&B. Ask about adding these amenities to your reservation for an additional fee.

access: Laundry facility located on the basement of the main house. The digital door code to the back door of the main house will be provided before check in.
description:
Fantastic location! Steps to restaurants, shops, Lincoln park Zoo, Lake Michigan, Brown line.

This is a budget-friendly option for someone who needs to be in the perfect location of town but prefers not to spend a lot of money on rent.

A cozy 2nd floor Guest House apartment located in the heart of Historic Old town triangle.

Fantastic location! Steps to restaurants, shops, Lincoln park Zoo, Lake Michigan, Brown line

This is a budget-friendly option for someone who needs to be in the perfect location of town but prefers not to spend a lot of money on a rental.

The space is a studio apartment with a comfortable queen size bed, large TV, a kitchenette and a small bathroom.

The kitchenette features a full size refrigerator, stove, microwave, coffee pot, tea pot, pots and pens and utensils. 

Laundry facility (2 sets of LG washer& dryer) is available on the property.

Two bicycles with locks located on the property for the guests to explore the city. 

Guest parking permits are provided upon request.
This home is perfect for business and pleasure, short and long term living. Couples or all ages, business travelers, students, interns, or anyone considering a stroll to many great shops, restaurants, neighborhood bars and Lincoln Park

Enjoy many great things Chicago has to offer and return to your cozy city spot.

Video link:

https://vimeo.com/312821247/9ad87bc182

Laundry facility located on the basement of the main house. The digital door code to the back door of the main house will be provided before check in.

I am always available via message or phone. The property manager is available in person on a short notice.

The home is situated on a quiet, tree-lined, and secluded street on Old Town Historic District of Lincoln Park. The location is truly ideal - a very private block but just steps (1 block) walking distance from Wells St. where many restaurants, and fun things like the Second City comedy club, coffee shops, fine dining, workout facilities, and grocery stores are located. Just 2 blocks from the Brown Line! Two blocks to Lincoln Park, the Zoo and Lake Michigan running/biking path. A quick uber ride or a 30 min pleasant walk through the park and Gold Coast to Downtown.

Walkable to many attractions in the city. Public transportation (brown line and buses) are within 2 block walk. Uber/Lyft are plentiful and quick. If you are driving your own car, we provide complimentary guest parking permits upon request. Bikes are a great option as well to explore the city.

additional_house_rules:
Attention all guests!!!

ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING AND NO SHOES in the apartment.  you will be charged for cleaning fee for smoking in the apartment.  Respect our neighbors and NO LOUD MUSIC!!!

Check in Text or Call my cell phone to get instructions for check in

*Late check out is optional but request that guest must clean the entire apartment and get it ready for the nexy guest or $300 late check out fee may apply.
*Late check out time is usually between 11am-2pm.  Time may vary depending on what time will our next guest will be arriving.

you can always leave the keys in the apartment when checking out and close the door on your way out.

if you don't follow the house rules you can be charged $300!!!

access: Pool will be close by the end of September depending on the weather.
description:
In The Heart of Chicago.  Everywhere you turn is a Social Media Photo Opt.  Hands down the best spot in the City.  One block away from Michigan Ave aka the Mag Mile (shopping and all the Flagship store).  2 blocks away from Millennium Park Cloud Gate Bean, 2 Blocks from the Chicago River (Architecture Boat Tour Chicago).  Art Institute of Chicago (one of the biggest art collection in the world) etc.

Pool will be close by the end of September depending on the weather.

Private Area
-King Size Bed
-Loveseat Couch
-50 inch Flat Screen with NetFlix, Youtube, iHeartRadio etc ready
-Kcup Coffee 
-Full Stainless steel Kitchen 

Common Area
24 hour fitness center on the 2nd Floor
Sixth Floor Lounge 6th Floor
Urban Garden on the 6th Floor 7am -11pm 
Forty One Lounge 41st Floor Open 24 hour 
Pool on 41st Floor Open 5am-11pm daily (NO GLASS containers, No Food, No Smoking permitted on pool deck at anytime) Wristband with you all times when in pool area

Pool will be close by the end of September depending on the weather.

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- In-suite laundry
- Fully-equipped kitchen

Building amenities
- Rooftop terrace

Greektown highlights
- Walkability score: 93
- 3 minute walk to Greek Islands (eatery specializing in traditional Greek cuisine)
- 6 minute walk to Lou Mitchell's (historic diner serving breakfast and lunch)

Getting around
- 1 block to Halsted & Jackson bus stop
- 10 minute drive to downtown
- 60 minute drive to ORD Airport

Known for its perfect mix of modernism and tradition, Greektown stuns with vibrant markets and rich history. Originally a popular settling place for Greek immigrants, the neighborhood has maintained its warm culture of hospitality and friendliness.  With easy access to downtown, you can experience genuine Greek culture through authentic eateries like Artopolis and Greek Islands or family-owned businesses like the Athenian Candle Company.

License: HL 2684667

There is no elevator.

This Sonder is centrally located and prone to city and construction noise.

There's no cable. We've provided an HDMI cord for streaming.

access: Private Bedroom that is only for guests on the second floor. Guest-only bathroom adjacent. Complete first floor access to living room and kitchen, back deck and yard. There's also a grand piano you are welcome to play.
description:
Private bedroom with two Twin Size beds in single family house.  Cable TV and private bathroom. Use of kitchen and first floor common areas. Charming and peaceful street.   One of two available bedrooms.  To book both, reserve under my "Combined Bedrooms" listing and save $22 per night vs. booking separately.

In addition to the host, guests are free to socialize with my six pet ducks!  After a full day, watching these feathered friends paddle in the backyard pond is quite relaxing.  They'll happily take some corn or mealworms from your hand.  So come on "down". (Ha ha).

Private Bedroom that is only for guests on the second floor. Guest-only bathroom adjacent. Complete first floor access to living room and kitchen, back deck and yard. There's also a grand piano you are welcome to play.

I reside in the space as well and have my own master bedroom. I am away at work during the day, though you can call or text me.

4 Minute Walk to CTA Redline which will take you to the Magnificent Mile or the Loop in 35 minutes. The #36 Broadway Bus is a 2 minute walk. That will take you to the Uptown entertainment district (Aragon Ballroom, Riviera Theater, the Green Mill) in 10 minutes.

description:
Offering free WiFi and a restaurant, Corporate Apartments is situated in Chicago, 300 metres from Millennium Park. Art Institute of Chicago is 300 metres from the property. All units are air conditioned and include a TV. There is a seating and/or dining area in some units. A microwave and coffee machine are also offered. Some units also have a kitchen, fitted with an oven.

Each unit is fitted with a private bathroom with a bath or shower. Guests can enjoy a meal at the on-site restaurant. Art Institute of Chicago is 400 metres from Millennium Park Corporate Apartment. The nearest airport is Midway International Airport, 14 km from Corporate Apartments.

description:
Chicago Rogers Park Home , Private  Bedroom with queen bed, Spacious kitchen and bathroom, great location and safe. 
Great amenities and perfect for short or long term. Catch bus only a block away or walk to RedLine Train at the Loyola Station.

Home Amenities:
WiFi, Washer and dryer in unit, Flat Screen Smart TV, Sheets, towels, blanket & pillows, Iron and iron board, Hair dryer, Hangers, Dishes & utensils , Basic cooking ware, Luggage drop off, Luggage storage, Outdoor area, Street Parking based on availability.
Soap, shampoo, toilet paper for reservations 4 nights or less

Garage Parking in the building with a fee. 
Optional Early check-in with a fee
Optional Late check-out with a fee
During stay cleaning with a fee

Private Bedroom
All common areas.

Text or email works the best.

“ Rogers Park is one of Chicago’s most diverse neighborhoods, with approximately 40 different languages spoken. As you might expect, the neighborhood’s dining options are just as diverse. The area’s restaurants will take you on a journey from Mexico to Peru, Jamaica to Ethiopia, Korea to the Middle East, and beyond.
If you want a taste of Chicago’s artsy side, Rogers Park is the perfect place to be. Check out the Glenwood Avenue Arts District, an inviting urban stretch with cobblestone streets, sprawling murals, three award-winning theatres, live music venues, art studios and galleries, and more.
Head east until you hit the water to see the neighborhood’s sandy shoreline and peaceful waterfront vistas. Near the lake, you’ll find the Emil Bach House, designed by Frank Lloyd Wright. Completed in 1915, it was one of Wright’s last Chicago commissions. Architecture buffs can even book an overnight stay “
Choosechicago.com

Train, bus, Uber or car.

access: In addition to your room, you'll have shared access to the kitchen, living room, dining room, bathrooms, and washer/dryer.
description:
This is a private room in a shared 4BR apartment (all 4 rooms are available on Airbnb). Restaurants, shops, bars, and public transit are all within walking distance. Downtown is a 10-minute train ride away via the nearby Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station.

Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.

Thanks so much for your interest in staying with us! We ask that you read through our entire listing to make sure that we're the right hosts for you. This is a private room in a shared 4BR apartment (all 4 rooms are available on Airbnb). 

THIS TROVE HAS

✔ Twin-size bed
✔ Turkish cotton bath and hand towels
✔ 55" HDTV w/ Netflix (no cable TV)
✔ Keurig coffee maker
✔ Body wash and shampoo
✔ Iron and ironing board
✔ Hair dryer
✔ Keyless Entry

--and more!

EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS

During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower.  Included with your membership:

✔ Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars
✔ Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan
✔ Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck

Metropolitan Club Hours:

Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm
Saturday: 5pm – 10pm
Sunday: Closed

HAVE A QUESTION?

Check out the “Other Things to Note” section of this listing for the answers to our most frequently asked questions.

In addition to your room, you'll have shared access to the kitchen, living room, dining room, bathrooms, and washer/dryer.

We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.

Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber.

→ The Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station is a 10-minute walk away.
→ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber.
→ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?”

Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're around the corner from the Wrightwood 659 art gallery. Search for “Wrightwood 659 Gallery Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest.

2. When is check-in/check-out?

Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room.

Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest.

3. “Can a third person stay in the room with me?”

We allow a maximum of one guest in this room. We have additional rooms available if you need accommodations for more than two people. Send us a message for more info.

4. Will I have my own private bathroom?

The apartment has two shared bathrooms.

We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.

access: Guests have the entire first floor that entails private kitchen, eating area and sun room, living room, bath and two bedrooms with a total of three beds.
description:
Two bed room apartment in a vintage 130 year old red brick two flat overlooking 70 acres of Mckinley Park in a sleepy working class neighborhood.  Ten minute 1/2 mile walk to the 35th/Archer ave CTA Orange line station with rapid transit service to Chicago's loop Midway Airport and the many cultural attractions the city has to offer.

Much of the interior layout is original to 1885 with a few tasteful updates. Decorated with an artists eye and a working-class budget the apartment puts a focus on calm and comfortable.

Guests have the entire first floor that entails private kitchen, eating area and sun room, living room, bath and two bedrooms with a total of three beds.

You are staying in my former beloved park side home. My trusted friend Alexander lives in the downstairs garden unit and is on call for any smaller needs you may have.

McKinley Park has long been a working-class area throughout its history.  Two blocks to the south along Pershing is the historic Central Manufacturing District. It has been described as the United States' first planned industrial district and features some surprisingly decorative warehouses from the turn of the century as well as an old clock tower. The juxtaposition of a city park on one side of Pershing with old huge seven story warehouses on the other is incredibly unique and worth scoping out.

The McKinley Park neighborhood is more of a quiet refuge from the night life scenes Chicago has to offer. You'll have to venture a little further for restaurants or bars. Pilsen to the north and Brideport to the east are excellent destinations for restaurants and Chicago's China town is a quick trip down the Orange line.

The nearest grocery market is three blocks to the north at Damen and Archer Ave.

The walk to the Orange Line stop is mostly park side and through family oriented city residential blocks all of which are well lit at night. The #9 Ashland ave and #49 Western ave buses both a quick walk to operate 24 hours and cover much of the city north to south.  Street parking is available most of the time especially one block south on Damen. There is also a Divvy bike share station about 2 blocks away.

The building is 132 years strong. With all the vintage charm comes a few squeaky floor boards.

Being an older building you may hear the other floors on occasion and hear guests going up the stairs.

It's overall a quiet building and I ask that you respect upstairs guests and downstairs tenant. Parties will not be tollerated here.

There is a 8 step porch to gain access to this apartnent.

It has been described as the United States' first planned industrial district and features some surprisingly decorative warehouses from the turn of the century as well as an old clock tower. The juxtaposition of a city park on one side of Pershing with old huge seven story warehouses on the other is incredibly unique and worth scoping out.

The McKinley Park neighborhood is more of a quiet refuge from the night life scenes Chicago has to offer. You'll have to venture a little further for restaurants or bars. Pilsen to the north and Brideport to the east are excellent destinations for restaurants and Chicago's China town is a quick trip down the Orange line.

The nearest grocery market is three blocks to the north at Damen and Archer Ave.
notes:
The building is 132 years strong. With all the vintage charm comes a few squeaky floor boards.

Being an older building you may hear the other floors on occasion and hear guests going up the stairs.

It's overall a quiet building and I ask that you respect upstairs guests and downstairs tenant. Parties will not be tollerated here.

There is a 8 step porch to gain access to this apartnent.
space: Much of the interior layout is original to 1885 with a few tasteful updates. Decorated with an artists eye and a working-class budget the apartment puts a focus on calm and comfortable.
summary: Two bed room apartment in a vintage 130 year old red brick two flat overlooking 70 acres of Mckinley Park in a sleepy working class neighborhood.  Ten minute 1/2 mile walk to the 35th/Archer ave CTA Orange line station with rapid transit service to Chicago's loop Midway Airport and the many cultural attractions the city has to offer.
transit: The walk to the Orange Line stop is mostly park side and through family oriented city residential blocks all of which are well lit at night. The #9 Ashland ave and #49 Western ave buses both a quick walk to operate 24 hours and cover much of the city north to south.  Street parking is available most of the time especially one block south on Damen. There is also a Divvy bike share station about 2 blocks away.

FREE Wireless internet access.

FREE parking on public street in front of the building. Or you can rent a private parking spot in the lot in the back for only $10/night.

CALL/TEXT BEFORE YOU CHECK IN. We need to know the time of your arrival. Thx

Everything around the house.

When necessary.

An Old World heritage meets modern charm in the Lincoln Square neighborhood. Small stretches throughout the area still maintain its roots such as a traditional German dining hall and a turn-of-the-century, European-style apothecary. 
Neighborhood gems dot the streets along the commercial heart of Lincoln Square at the intersections of Lawrence, Western and Lincoln Avenues (walk in distance), as well as the Ravenswood corridor — a unique cross-section of industry and creative businesses. Great description made by Choose Chicago.

Bus is in front of the building. Train about 10-15 min walk.

description:
If comfort and location matters when you are looking for an space to stay, then this is the right place for you . A great studio, a short walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, perfect location for shopping, many restaurants, bars, grocery stores, like Whole Foods, a just 2 minutes walk distance. Our amenities includes WI-FI, NETFLIX,  pool and gym. Make this your next place in Chicago,  even for business or vacation travel!

Room:
- brand new queen bed and medium firm mattress for a comfortable sleep. IF you are a group of 3, please request an extra bed.
- fully functional kitchen with all tools you need to prepare a delicious meal 
- bathroom with shower and all you need to have a relaxing bath
- Sofa, comfortable to put your legs up and watch the flat screen TV with Netflix installed. Please advise me if you are a party of three then we can provide extra linen and more towels.

Perfect location to explore Chicago and its beautiful beaches. The building offers a rooftop pool and if you feel like it you can go up and chill next to the pool and meet interesting people. Also you can exercise in the fitness centre available at the building.

Building:
- access to the laundry.

Location: 
- walking distance to Oak Beach & Harris Beach
- walking distance to Bondi Junction 
- 24h Bus stop right at your doorstep - LaSalle & Huron, 0,1 mile distance
- supermarket just across the street, Whole Food a just 2 minutes walk
- lots of fantastic Restaurant options nearby from awarded international cuisine.

During your stay you will have access to the studio common area spaces and gym and pool available at the building.

If you need us, we are only a phone call or text message away! Keep in touch and we will respond as quickly as possible.

We are very responsive and can help as things pop up. We let the guests do their own thing though and only interact with them in person only when needed!

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty.
3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
6.) Please remove your shoes when inside the house.

description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

This newly renovated house on Logan  Square is the perfect place to stay for your trip to Chicago.  Logan Square is full of the hipest restaurants and new bars in the city. There are 5 bedrooms, 3 full baths & a full basement to ensure everyone has a place to stretch out.  My gourmet kitchen & wet bar are great places to cook dinner and enjoy a cocktail.  Did I mention the back deck and yard?  Garage parking included!

Cheap eats and bike-friendly streets. Gourmet coffee, scruffy dive bars and artisanal cocktail lounges. Some may say it's a recipe for a hipster haven but there's a proud, working-class sensibility that keeps this Northwest Side neighborhood grounded. In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands.

At the heart of this community is the actual "square" in Logan Square. It comes together at the intersection of Kedzie and Logan Boulevard, where a circle interchange meets with Milwaukee Avenue. The boulevards themselves are widened thoroughfares that are set apart by grassy, landscaped medians and tall, stately trees that border both its sides. The neighborhood boasts four of them in total and these link together to form Chicago's "Emerald Necklace," an expansive system of interconnected parks and streetscapes dotted with beautifully-restored mansions, handsome greystone homes and majestic churches.

2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty.
3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
6.) Please remove your shoes when inside the house.

description:
Totally separate, detached private house located in a quaint, quiet and picturesque streets of Chicago suburban territory. The property is large enough to hold a party of up to 15-20 people at a time. Detached garage offers billiard, table tennis, and other entertainment activities/opportunities including chess, domino, cards, little cigar room, all in an old-country style of environment!

Special reservations of VIP clients is available by arranging 24 hours airport pickup (perfect option for international students coming to Chicago of F-1/J-1 visas) of other valuable guests!

We're available 24-hours!

Quiet, with quaint little streets!

Uber can take you anywhere! There are lots of dining places in the neighborhood!

access: You will have access to the common lobby area, the garage (1 parking space), and the balcony.
description:
Step into the chic, curved bathtub for a rejuvenating soak at this expansive escape featuring color block walls in calming rose and cool graphite. Clean lines, upscale materials, and refined black-framed windows contrast with retro egg chairs.

This expansive condo is 1800 SQFT and includes 3 bedrooms featuring king-sized platform beds. Off of the master bedroom is the master bathroom offering a walk-in shower and full-sized tub. A second bathroom is also available with a shower/tub combo. Of course, all bathrooms feature premium fixtures and modern design.

In the sprawling main area, you will find the kitchen, dining area, and living room, which have been furnished with luxury furniture great for hosting baby showers, birthdays, and other special events - If you are planning to use the space for an event, please inform me before your stay.

As for the kitchen, it is outfitted with top-end appliances and almost every tool you will need to cook delicious meals for you and your guest. This includes a gas range cooktop, built-in oven & stacked microwave, and counter-depth custom fridge.

Lastly, you will find a balcony to stand out & enjoy the infamous Chicago weather, as well as a beautiful foyer to take off your coats and shoes off when arriving.

You will have access to the common lobby area, the garage (1 parking space), and the balcony.

The unit sits in an extremely walkable area in the heart of North Center Chicago. Shopping and dining surround the building, while the brown line is only a half a mile away for quick access to the city.

The condo is squarely located in the heart of North Center, which is a prime location for taking the bus (49, 49X, 50, & 80), or taking the brown line from Irving Park station (less than 0.6 miles away) to the city center. Of course, we offer a gated garage with 1 space to park — this great for people who drove to Chicago or are renting a car.

The listing comes with one garage parking space, but there is always plenty of free street parking right next to the building.

access: The room is private with a lock but the rest of the apartment is common space.
description:
If you're looking for a true Chicago neighborhood experience, look no further! I have a private room available in East Pilsen, a diverse neighborhood near downtown Chicago. The neighborhood is thriving with city life and the beautiful murals that bleed from its walls are a testament to its pulse. The apartment is situated just two blocks west of the arts district and a short walk from UIC, and downtown is conveniently located just 2 miles away. In addition, Chinatown, Greektown, and Little Italy are also nearby. It's fun to experience these neighborhoods on a bike ride and there is a Divvy bike station located on the next block. Access to the train or bus is undemanding. However, if you prefer to drive, a Zip Car parking space is located within 2 blocks. 
The apartment has two bedrooms and a single bathroom.  Wireless internet and cable are available. For your convenience, there is also a washer and dryer in the unit.
Plenty of bars, cafes, and restaurants are within walking distance. During the warmer months, a farmer's market is located just around the corner and on every 2nd Friday of the month, the art galleries in the neighborhood host an open house. It's a great place to catch some local theater, art, and dance. In addition, the various block parties and festivals are also city celebrations not to be missed.

washer/dryers
kitchen
bathroom
living/dining area


This is a two bedroom apartment. If I'm not there or the other room isn't booked, you'll have the entire apartment to yourself. Otherwise, the other bedroom could be occupied with another traveler.  

The # 18 18th street bus is located a block away and the #8 Halsted bus is located 2 blocks away. Both bus will connect you easily to the metro.

The room is private with a lock but the rest of the apartment is common space.

No Pets.
Please be respectful of the space and neighbors. If you use the kitchen,please clean up after yourself.

description:
Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts building. Promise, it's all good.

Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts rental building with 24-hour door staff, ginormous windows that look out onto the lake, harbor and park from every room. Whip-up breakfast in a yarn-wrapped kitchen under a disco ball, and then settle down to eat on a rosewood table under a turn of the century chandelier. Super swank pad of electric blues, chocolate brown, and an orange so vibrant it almost pulsates. Because the universe is kind, we're a show-house for the Jennifer Norback gallery, so brace yourself for some insanely cool art. The place has a good vibe. 

The kid's room has one twin bed. My room has a totally dreamy king-size pillow top bed, the same kind they use at the Four Seasons. Both bedrooms have full bathrooms. 

Our pad is walking distance to the Lincoln Park Zoo, Wrigley Field, museums, and tons of great playgrounds, restaurants, shops, bars, gyms, comedy clubs and theaters, and a weekly farmer's market. The best part is the park and harbor just across the street--miles of lakefront, perfect for a morning run or a late night stroll. 

Some nights, our entire apartment can be booked for $450; other nights, we're game to share for $130. 

Promise, promise, it's all good.

Sometimes will be staying nearby, sometimes not. If we're in town, we're happy to share a meal, leave you alone, or point you in the right direction.

East Lakeview/Boystown is eclectic neighborhood is a vibrant mix of hipsters, families, socialites, buskers, orthodox Jews, and gays, with just enough heart and grit to make you feel good about living in the city. Plus, we have the best gelato, cupcakes, falafel and fried Korean chicken in Chicago, hands-down.

Hop a five minute cab or the 146 express buss to downtown and the loop right out our front door. The Belmont stop El train (brown/red line) is a ten minute walk away. Hail a cab right out front in minutes. Parking is a big drag in my neighborhood, so skip the rental car. I don't own a car and happily get around on foot, cab, or bus. If you are driving, there's street parking and  a public lot just a block away (Broadway and Roscoe).

There's a Divvy bike station right outside my building. If the weather's nice, grab a bike and ride downtown along the lake or explore any of Chicago's great neighborhoods.
house_rules:
No pets, no smoking. 
As much as we love fun and games, no parties or extra guests who are not listed in the original booking.
--no shoes in the house
--please refrain from wearing strong perfumes and colognes 
--use place mats on the dining room table, especially for water glasses
--Before leaving, please change the sheets and towels and empty the garbage.
Be nice.
interaction: Sometimes will be staying nearby, sometimes not. If we're in town, we're happy to share a meal, leave you alone, or point you in the right direction.
neighborhood_overview: East Lakeview/Boystown is eclectic neighborhood is a vibrant mix of hipsters, families, socialites, buskers, orthodox Jews, and gays, with just enough heart and grit to make you feel good about living in the city. Plus, we have the best gelato, cupcakes, falafel and fried Korean chicken in Chicago, hands-down.
notes: There's a Divvy bike station right outside my building. If the weather's nice, grab a bike and ride downtown along the lake or explore any of Chicago's great neighborhoods.
space:
Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts rental building with 24-hour door staff, ginormous windows that look out onto the lake, harbor and park from every room. Whip-up breakfast in a yarn-wrapped kitchen under a disco ball, and then settle down to eat on a rosewood table under a turn of the century chandelier. Super swank pad of electric blues, chocolate brown, and an orange so vibrant it almost pulsates. Because the universe is kind, we're a show-house for the Jennifer Norback gallery, so brace yourself for some insanely cool art. The place has a good vibe. 

The kid's room has one twin bed. My room has a totally dreamy king-size pillow top bed, the same kind they use at the Four Seasons. Both bedrooms have full bathrooms. 

Our pad is walking distance to the Lincoln Park Zoo, Wrigley Field, museums, and tons of great playgrounds, restaurants, shops, bars, gyms, comedy clubs and theaters, and a weekly farmer's market. The best part is the park and harbor just across the street--miles of lakefront, perfect for a morning run or a late night stroll. 

Some nights, our entire apartment can be booked for $450; other nights, we're game to share for $130. 

Promise, promise, it's all good.
summary: Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts building. Promise, it's all good.
transit: Hop a five minute cab or the 146 express buss to downtown and the loop right out our front door. The Belmont stop El train (brown/red line) is a ten minute walk away. Hail a cab right out front in minutes. Parking is a big drag in my neighborhood, so skip the rental car. I don't own a car and happily get around on foot, cab, or bus. If you are driving, there's street parking and  a public lot just a block away (Broadway and Roscoe).

access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.
description:
Welcome to Chicago, home of the World Series Champs, the Cubs. Our apartment is a perfect place to stay on any Chicago getaway, whether business or vacation. It is professionally designed with a full kitchen, living room, and modern decor.

Also, parking won't be a problem as we have one parking spot available during your stay.

In the heart of trendy Boystown Chicago, our sophisticated 1-bedroom apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston.

Illuminated by sunny natural light, our apartment features a Queen-size bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units.

The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower!

There’s ample space for guests to relax on the sofa and watch on a large flat-screen TV. Like the rest of the unit, you’ll live it up in luxury among hardwood floors and contemporary decor.

Whether you’re craving a home-cooked meal or just somewhere to put the box of deep-dish, our kitchen is fully stocked with cookware, dishes, utensils, and has swanky granite countertops. Appliances include a full-sized fridge and freezer, gas stove, oven, microwave, toaster, and coffee maker. The only things missing are your favorite farmer’s market finds!!

Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.

We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.

Aldine's neighborhood Lakeview is not only a local favorite but one of Chicago's traveller's top choices. A metropolitan area that will let you experience an exciting land and water attractions during your stay. The stretch of shoreline, different districts with its own unique vibe that offers nightly entertainment, shopping destinations and an award winning food joints and bars.

 
You will never miss your favorite teams on game season as it is home to the iconic Wrigley Field Baseball Stadium. Head on to Millenium and Lincoln Parks that cover a wide area of nature reserves, botanical landscapes, architecture and museums. Spend an afternoon strolling through the gardens or just taking in the view from the river cruise that gives you the closer perspective of Windy City’s iconic buildings and the Chicago skyline

Truly a delightful experience staying on this culture rich and diverse community.

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.

access: Your room, bathroom, common areas in the basement (living room and kitchen), washer and dryer (for $10 cash fee), patio, and yard. The fridge may be used to store your left overs.  Please respect host's food and drinks by not consuming them.
description:
My place is close to Midway airport and the Orange Line train, which takes you downtown or allows you to transfer to other trains or public transportation. It is also close to McKinley Park. You’ll love my place because of the location. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).

The space is semi-private, meaning that we or visitors may use the washroom periodically and do come down in the basement to common areas (kitchen, living room, and bathroom).

Your room, bathroom, common areas in the basement (living room and kitchen), washer and dryer (for $10 cash fee), patio, and yard. The fridge may be used to store your left overs.  Please respect host's food and drinks by not consuming them.

We are in and out, so there will be limited interactions. We live upstairs, so the two places are separate, but we do use the bathroom downstairs occasionally.

We have great Chicago-style pizza places near us: Giordano's and Beggar's.
We also have lots of great Mexican restaurants around us. We know lots of great places to dine. Just ask us!

We are 10 minutes walking from the Pulaski Orange Line stop. There is ample free street parking.

I do have a 7 year old, so you can expect to hear the noises of children running, crying, playing. Also, being a basement room, sound is amplified. You can expect to hear footsteps, etc. Quiet time is generally between 10:30PM and 6:30AM. We reserve the right to extend quiet time hours without notice. If this is not convenient to you, our room may not be a good accommodation for you.
As the two spaces are separate, you will enter through the back door. Your room is the last room in the hallway in the basement. The bathroom is the second door on the left.
All guests must be registered due to safety reasons. 24 hour surveillance in common areas is available for everyone's safety.
house_rules:
No special events on the property or parties in the room.
All guests must be registered due to safety reasons.

access: Private guest bedroom, shared living room, bath, large kitchen and lots of flexibility.
description:
FEMALES ONLY Please.  Private Comfy Guest Bedroom. Perfect for student or new transplant to Chicago. Bright sunny 2 bedroom corner apartment in Jefferson Park. Full use of kitchen and living room.  Flat screen TV, Wifi,  printer available. This is a quiet 5 unit building incl. yard and garden. Near expressways, O'Hare and 30 minutes CTA to city. Newly painted, newly sanded floors, new ceiling fans and new a.c. unit. Fully furnished guest bedroom, sweet, comfy cozy and ready for your stay!

(Females only please). You get the lovely guest bedroom, fully furnished, with comfy single size bed with new memory foam mattress, work table, sitting chair, dresser, shelves, and full closet in a nice bright apartment with great vibes :)  White updated bathroom and a large newly painted kitchen. Top (2nd) floor corner unit with great light and tree top views. Sanded wood floors, new ceiling fans and a.c. Entire apartment newly painted and tastefully (whimsically) decorated (I'm a designer). A small 5 unit building with European style back yard with fruit trees (you don't get that in the city often!!) and covered patio sitting area. Parking free on street. Near Blue line. 30 minutes into Loop only a few stops from O'Hare airport and near expressways.

Private guest bedroom, shared living room, bath, large kitchen and lots of flexibility.

I share the apartment with you when in town. Travel a lot so you may have it to yourself for some time or if there is another guest in my master bedroom will advise you of such! My mom lives in the building you always have someone to contact should you need. She may even give you some homemade goodies! :)

Nice residential area great for walking, reasonable walk to shopping, close by pizza, CVS, Jewel.

Easy walk (15 minutes) to train. 3 blocks from I-90 Expressway into the city or 10 minutes to O'Hare. Near Blue line into the loop (30 minutes) and near Higgins bus station.

This is a very safe and easy building run by same family for 35 years. My mom is on site and there is a lot of quiet and good light and big kitchen for your use.

access: Guests will have access to the main floor kitchen where continental breakfast will be served, & the back yard garden area
description:
1904 Greystone 2-Flat gut rehabbed into Single Family Home: Loft style w/ exposed brick & duct work. Private GUEST SUITE (w/ separate entrance) that sleeps 2-4 persons, There is a King bed (or 2 Twin trundels) in the private bedroom & queen tempurpedic topped sofa sleeper in the living area, wet bar, 2 flat screens TVs,  private bath, access to Kitchen/LivingRm

1904 Greystone 2 flat gut rehabbed into Single Family Home: Loft style w/ exposed brick & duct work. Home has Private GUEST SUITE that sleeps 2-4 persons, Suite has bedroom w/ king bed (or 2 twins-Trundle Bed) & Flat Screen TV. Living Area has double Sleeper Sofa w/ Flat Screen TV, Full Bath, Wet Bar, Access to kitchen & living Room. 2 pianos.  Home has W-Fi Internet Access and Platinum Cable Television. Also there is a back yard garden area available for use. Non-smoking (except back yard) Dog Friendly Household.  Dogs OK for additional $25.00 per night. Great Street Parking.

Guests will have access to the main floor kitchen where continental breakfast will be served, & the back yard garden area

We are a gay couple, married & together for 24 years (Todd owns a hospitality staffing company, Tripp owns a dog walking service)  We will be around and available to help guests with suggestions on things to do and directions to tourist areas, shoping, theaters, restaurants, & sites to see. Dog Friendly Household

Edgewater is a historic neighborhood with many single family homes, Great Street Parking (no meters or zone parking) close to shopping, restaurants, beach, park, and 20 min on red line to Chicago Loop. Neighborhood Borders Andersonville, Uptown, and Rogers Park

Red Line 2 blocks walk from our home, Taxis are easy to get close to house, Many bus options, and always Uber and Lyft (always around close by)

We are very close (walking distance) many shops and restaurants in Edgewater, Andersonville & Rogers Park.   Also, our home is a short 3 block walk to Hollywood Beach.
