access:
The apartment is technically a suite located inside of a River North hotel called FieldHouse Jones.  As a guest of the hotel, guests of this listing will enjoy access to hotel amenities like 24/7 frontdesk and security, daily housekeeping, guest kitchen, lounge and washer & dryer.  The hotel also has a cafe and restaurant as well as two full-size slot car tracks which guests have access to.

Parking is available in our adjacent surface lot.  The rate for guests that book a room through Airbnb is $30/car/night.
description:
My place is close to Magnificent Mile, Water Tower Place, Museum of Contemporary Art, Signature Lounge, Signature Room At the 95th.. You’ll love my place because of the ambiance. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and big groups.

Our Luxury Loft Apartments (550 square feet) offer 4-Full-size bunk beds in a defined sleeping nook and 2-Twin-size bunk beds, all with plush mattresses and luxurious linens. These suites feature a clever+functional kitchen, leather sofa, dining table, oak flooring, a desk area and a modern private bathroom with a walk-in shower and deluxe fittings. Additional amenities include a large flat screen television with cable TV channels, custom furniture, original art, in-room safe, complimentary eco-friendly bath products, and free high-speed WiFi.

The apartment is technically a suite located inside of a River North hotel called FieldHouse Jones.  As a guest of the hotel, guests of this listing will enjoy access to hotel amenities like 24/7 frontdesk and security, daily housekeeping, guest kitchen, lounge and washer & dryer.  The hotel also has a cafe and restaurant as well as two full-size slot car tracks which guests have access to.

Parking is available in our adjacent surface lot.  The rate for guests that book a room through Airbnb is $30/car/night.

Our frontdesk is staffed 24-hours a day to assist any of your needs at any time.  Additionally, we offer guests daily housekeeping.

FieldHouse Jones is located in the River North neighborhood of Chicago.  Geographically speaking, it’s the area just north of the Chicago River, hence the name.  It’s home to most of Chicago’s heavy hitters like Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, the John Hancock Building, Merchandise Mart, and the Museum of Contemporary Art to name a few.  Anyone that has come to Chicago to see its main tourist attractions has definitely come through this part of town.  But don’t let the high concentration of tourist destinations fool you.  With an incredible art scene, boisterous nightlife, and some of the most accoladed restaurants, River North has plenty of appeal for tourists and locals alike.

Public Transportation: We’re about two blocks from the Chicago stop of the Brown Line.  It goes from the Loop to Albany Park.  It’s your go-to train to for getting you downtown fast.  But know that it does not run from 1am to 5am.  The Red Line is about four blocks away and basically runs up and down Lake Michigan.  Also, unlike, the Brown Line, it runs all the time.

Parking: FieldHouse Jones has an on-site lot.  Spaces are available to guests for $30/car/night.  An advance reservation for one is advised as the number of spaces is finite.

At check-in, guests will be asked to put down a credit card for incidentals.  The card will only be charged in the case of damage to the property.
house_rules: At check-in, guests will be asked to provide a valid photo ID as well as a working credit card that will be authorized for $50 per night.

description:
Our Deluxe Overnight Guest Rooms offer honest to goodness pillow top mattresses with 500 thread count linens. 

Comfortable and clean, additional features include: Private marble steam showers, chez lounges, custom woodworking and molding abound.

"Best in the City" - Chicago Magazine. Ruby Room Inn & Spa is one of Chicago's most unique overnight destinations. Just 8 minutes from downtown, in the heart of historic Wicker Park's restaurant, shopping and nightlife scene. Modeled in the European tradition, Ruby Room is neither a hotel nor a traditional B&B. Our concept is an urban inn. By design, we do not offer telephones or televisions. We do not offer 24 hour reception or bellman services. We make a practice of not entering your room during your stay, unless requested. Ruby Room is a historic property and does not offer an elevator. Please keep this in mind, if you or any of your guests have a challenge with mobility. What we do offer are outrageously comfortable pillow top mattresses with hi thread count linens, large marble & glass showers, commercial steam units in 4 our deluxe rooms, complimentary Malin + Goetz products, crown molding and fine woodworking throughout. Modern furniture peppered with antiques, community kitchen, gorgeous garden with waterfall and all a part of a day spa, retail boutique, and a serene healing sanctuary. If you're looking for something clean and relaxing, we offer a restful room attached to a unique spa in a super cool neighborhood. Your peace is our passion

Guests will recieve a welcome message prior to arrival. 24/7 communication via text.

Located near the CTA Blue Line we are surrounded by amazing things to see and do. Take a bike ride on the 606, grab a beer at Gold Star Bar, Go shopping in the trendy Wicker Park neighberhood.

Hardwood floors, oriental rug, modern décor/furnishings, CD player, high speed internet access, down comforters, thirsty towels, spa robes, slippers, 500 plus thread count sheets and of course fluffy pillows, double top King beds and an extra set of sheets.

additional_house_rules:
Please note that there are tenants that live in the same building. After 10 PM please respect their peace by not being too loud.

No large parties allowed at the property.

Please note that there is an additional cleaning charge of $25 for leaving dirty dishes behind for the cleaning crew.

If there is evidence of smoking inside the property fees will apply.

Persons renting are responsible for their guests and must make sure everyone staying understands the house rules.

Trash cans are in the courtyard along with recycle bins.

Also, if you do not follow the 11AM checkout rule and the cleaning crew has to wait for you to vacate there will be a $25 fee. If there is a prenegotiated late check out this will not apply.

Please see the attached full list of amenities.
description:
Welcome to the Grand Champions Suite. This modern 3 bedroom home is perfect for groups or couples looking for a night on the town. The property is conveniently located on Grand Avenue in the Ukrainian Village just minutes by car, bus or train from Downtown and the Lakefront.

Catering to the discerning sports fan and concert goer the United Center is a 5 minute Uber ride door to door!

The theme is based on the Championship teams that played at the Madhouse on Madison. Formerly The Chicago Stadium now flying under the disguise of The United Center. Obviously there is one player from those Bulls teams that is known the world over and he is prominently featured in the living room here, MJ!

The apartment has all the comforts of home. 55" Samsung LED TV for watching sports, movies, or catching up on your favorite shows. Additionally you have access to Xfinity stream pics, Netflix, Bluetooth Sound, and high speed internet.

Plenty of places to relax throughout. Chill on the oversized couch or grab a cocktail at the bar. The kitchen is fully equipped for cooking and there is seating to eat in both the Kitchen and Dining Room.

There are three Bedrooms for sleeping and for overflow guests there is a Queensized  air mattress. The extra large couch can easily sleep 2 more guests should you need the space.

The entire apartment is there for use. Additionally, there is an outdoor common area courtyard out the back with table and chairs as well as a grill for BBQ.

Please see the attached full list of amenities.

Hosts Brad and Darin are very easy to reach and knowledgeable on the City. Both live in the area and are great guides for local restaurants, bars, amusements, and shops. They are happy to show you around personally, or leave you to explore the awesome neighborhood and city on your own. Both always available by phone 24/7.

There is a reason this neighborhood is rated one of the best in the country. Only about half a square mile, Ukrainian Village manages to serve as a shopping hub, hipster haven, cozy neighborhood for the stroller set, and, yes, outpost for immigrants from Ukraine. As you wander along Chicago Avenue, you’ll see storefront signs in Ukrainian, no English in sight, even though the original population has dwindled to a couple of thousand from its one-time high of around 30,000. Indeed, the rest of the city has discovered the well-maintained housing stock and double-wide sidewalks of Division Street—welcoming features that in 1983 prompted Mayor Jane Byrne to designate Ukrainian Village an official neighborhood, the first in Chicago.

We are a short ride via the Milwaukee North Metra line non-stop to Downtown. The Metra is a 2 minute walk from the front door. There is also a Divvy Bike rental located at the Metra stop and there is a new electric scooter program in the City.

Plenty of street parking abounds and Uber and Lyft will typically be at the front door in 2-3 Minutes.

If Navy Pier is your destination you can catch the 65 Grand Bus right out front direct, with no changes.

Please note that there are tenants that live in the same building. After 10 PM please respect their peace by not being too loud.

Please note that there is an additional cleaning charge of $25 for leaving dirty dishes behind for the cleaning crew.

Also, if you do not follow the 11AM checkout rule and the cleaning crew has to wait for you to vacate there will be a $25 fee. If there is a prenegotiated late check out this will not apply.

你有自己的房间，可以用客厅、厨房、卫生间。

access: Guests have access to the entire apartment!
description:
Welcome to our chic 1-bedroom apartment in Chicago's West Loop neighborhood! 

Thoughtfully appointed and centrally located, we are sure that our guests will find it easy to make themselves at home. Guests tell us that they love the modern amenities, the proximity to public transportation, and our comfy memory foam beds.

 We welcome business travelers, urban explorers, students, small families, and everything in between!

This apartment is on the third floor of the building, which we share with other long term tenants. We don't have an elevator, so you'll have a chance to work off some of that famous Chicago deep dish pizza! Guests will have be able to make use of our fully equipped kitchen, in-unit washer and dryer, and can enjoy an evening watching TV and hearing the faint sounds of the city.

Guests have access to the entire apartment!

We don't live on-site but we are always nearby to answer questions or give recommendations.

Chicago's West Loop is one of the fastest growing sectors of the city. Home to Millennials, Baby Boomers, business people, students, hipsters, and everything in between, you are sure to find something that suits your tastes in the West Loop.

Public transportation is a breeze! There is an L stop just a short walk away, or you can catch a bus and get a little more off the beaten path.

There is no parking available unfortunately, we recommend using parking apps like SpotHero. We are near the train but have white noise machines to drown out any noise!

There are 3 flights of stairs to get to the apartment and no elevator

description:
Located on the second floor of Ina Mae Tavern & Packaged Goods, one of Chicago's best new restaurants, the Beachwood Inn has a private balcony overlooking the entire restaurant's bustling action so guests will never miss out on the happenings - from live music to brunch and dinner. The space is perfect for travelers who want to immerse themselves in a true local experience. Guests looking for an all encompassing Eat, Drink, No-Frills Stay are encouraged to spend the weekend at the Beachwood Inn.

The Beachwood Inn has a vintage cabin like feel and be catered to travelers who want to immerse themselves in a true local experience, right in the heart of Wicker Park. The space includes large oversized bunk beds, a private bath, and a kitchenette. The real perk is that Po'Boys, Seafood Towers & Cocktails are waiting for you right downstairs. What we lack in a concierge services, and fancy amenities, we make up for in a food, drinks and fun. There is also in-room dining provided by James Beard nominated Brian Jupiter, executive chef of Ina Mae Tavern (available during kitchen hours). Beachwood Inn guests will also receive exclusive deals and specials at Ina Mae's sister venues - Frontier (1027 N Milwaukee Ave) and Lottie's Pub (1925 W Cortland Ave).

Not available.

Ina Mae's Beachwood Inn is located in the heart of Wicker Park, a hip neighborhood just a short drive or train ride away from Chicago's loop and tourist attractions. Wicker Park  is known for its bustling nightlife, dining and entertainment venues, which include Ina Mae Tavern & Packaged Goods' sister venues - Frontier and Lottie's Pub. Beachwood Inn guests receive exclusive deals and specials at all affiliated locations.
The restaurant can get noisy, Ina Mae Tavern & Packaged Goods offers live music 3 nights a week: 
- Wednesday from 7-10PM
- Friday from 9:30PM-12:30AM
- Saturday Brunch from 12-3PM
- Saturday night from 9:30PM-12:30AM

In addition to being in walking distance to all of Wicker Parks boutiques, shops, and restaurants, Ina's Beachwood Inn is less than a 10 minute walk from both the Damen and Divison Blue Line stops on the L, which will take visitors right to the heart of Chicago's downtown.

access:
Guests have access to the entire home, including the outdoor patio and the laundry area so you don't have to leave with dirty clothes in your luggage. 
Your stay includes continental breakfast, which you prepare yourself.   I provide an orientation to the kitchen so you know where to find everything: eggs, bread, , cereal, oatmeal, juice and coffee or tea. Most of the time, I prepare a nice brunch on Saturdays or Sundays for all my guests,
description:
This is a 7 bedroom, 3.5 bathrooms house in a quiet neighborhood. House has 2 kitchens, spacious dinning and living rooms, a small family room, and enclosed patio.  This room has 1 comfortable double bed. Homestay includes  breakfast & some dinners.

The house is well distributed, therefore everyone enjoys their privacy, while also giving the opportunity for great inter-cultural and international interactions.  We have 3.5 bathrooms, so there is no bumping into each other at shower time.  The focal point of the house is the main kitchen and dinning room where everyone gathers during the evening for a little while.

Guests have access to the entire home, including the outdoor patio and the laundry area so you don't have to leave with dirty clothes in your luggage. 
Your stay includes continental breakfast, which you prepare yourself.   I provide an orientation to the kitchen so you know where to find everything: eggs, bread, , cereal, oatmeal, juice and coffee or tea. Most of the time, I prepare a nice brunch on Saturdays or Sundays for all my guests,

I am self-employed, therefore I spend a good amount of time in the house, except when I have meetings or special assignments.  I like to cook so sometimes we all sit to have breakfast or dinner together. 
I always provide a good orientation about the transportation system, various neighborhoods and other amenities that you probably want to do while in Chicago.

The area is very safe, clean and quiet; yet, very close to entertainment, sports bars, movies, bowling, restaurants, groserie stores and other amenities. The home is well located close to three Blue Line train stations and two busses.

I'm close to three Blue Line trains and three main busses that take you wherever you want in the city. I also have couple of Metra Stations that can take you to the suburban areas for some  of the main outlets and other interesting areas out of Chicago.  Once we have full access to each other, you will be able to enter my website to find the links to some of those places.

For all the great places to visit while you are in town, visit this link:
(URL HIDDEN)

I have high speed ATT - WIFI. Ask me for the code. I have my business license.

Cleaning fees are charged per visit, or per month, depending on the length of your stay.  Minimum charge per stay in this room is $50.  
Monthly cleaning fee for short-term guests is $75 and includes other toiletries such as toilet paper and and additional home goods, cleaning and kitchen supplies used by the long-term guests.  Long-term cleaning and supplementary fee is $50 per month, in addition to the monthly rental fee. For your convenience this fee can be paid either all at once when doing the homestay booking, or it can be paid on a monthly basis to the host via (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN), or Chase Quickpay.
house_rules: Everyone is here for school, work or special occassions. Many have to wake up very early, so I ask that everyone tone down their personal, TV and music noise after 10:30-11:00pm during the week.  Weekends are more relaxed, but usually everyone is out, so the house is relatively quiet anyway.

access: Guests have access to the hostel's kitchen facilities and social spaces, including an outdoor patio and a common room complete with a TV, bar, and laptops that are free to use.
description:
Wrigley Hostel is an excellent hostel located in the heart of Wrigleyville, one of the most fun and exciting neighborhoods in Chicago. We offer a private dorm room for up to 10 guests with free breakfast.

Wrigley Hostel is a new hostel located in the heart of Wrigleyville, one of the most fun and exciting neighborhoods in Chicago.

Guests have access to the hostel's kitchen facilities and social spaces, including an outdoor patio and a common room complete with a TV, bar, and laptops that are free to use.

Come socialize in our common room and meet guests from all over the world. Enjoy spontaneous hostel-run activities during the week.

Wrigley Hostel is located in the heart of Wrigleyville -- in the shadow of Wrigley Field -- steps from all the fun and excitement of the neighborhood's famous Clark Street bars.

The CTA 'L' Red Line Addison stop is around the corner and it only takes 15 minutes to get downtown. We are also less than 5 minutes away from late-night and all-night bus services that make getting to and from the lake, the loop, and the airport a breeze!

All guests who stay must have a State ID or Drivers License and guests with a Illinois ID are not able to stay at Wrigley Hostel.

No animals
Check-in is anytime after 4 PM and checkout by 11 AM
Do not disrespect Neighbors
Please follow check-in and out instructions
Please wash dishes you use.
Do not wash dishes in the bathroom sink
Do not flush paper towels or baby wipes down toilet (even flushable ones).
Do not burn candles, incense or any other open flames
Lock the door AT ALL TIMES. We want you and your things to be safe
No parties, events, birthdays, bachelor or bachelorette stays, get-togethers and hangouts 
No Smoking/No Vaping, no marijuana usage or any controlled substance at anytime anywhere on the property
Do not have more guests than stated in your reservation and no unapproved visitors
No Loud music or disturbances, especially noise past 10 pm
If you open it, close it; if you borrow it, return it; if you turn it on, turn it off; if you break it, fix it; if you use it, take care of it; if you make a mess, clean it up; if you move it, put it back

We cannot be responsible for any items left behind

- Laundry room

- Less than 15 miles to Downtown Chicago

This house is a perfect option for big groups, families, students and family gatherings. 

We pride ourselves on the cleanliness and attention to detail in all of our units. Each unit is professionally cleaned and sanitized after every stay.

access: Guest will access the unit via a lock box. Guests are encouraged to download the Airbnb app on their phone which contains step by step checkin instructions.
description:
Renovated in January 2019! Modern two bedroom, two full bathroom apartment located on the forth floor of a five story complex hosted by a five star rated Super Host. Hardwood floor, stainless steel appliances, and granite counter-tops makes this a luxuries home.  Includes one garage parking (free and paid street parking also available) and all amenities (towels, shampoo, linens, coffee) of a luxury hotel. Our housekeeper used to clean for the President so you'll be guaranteed a spotless place.

Guest will access the unit via a lock box. Guests are encouraged to download the Airbnb app on their phone which contains step by step checkin instructions.

I travel out of town every week, so my availability for face to face interactions will be limited. However my parents are 20 mins away and will take care of any needs. I will also be accessible through email/text/phone.

-Close to McCormick's place (15 min walking to main entrance and 10 min walking to west entrace)
-Short bus ride to museum campus
-Taxi headquarter located nearby
-Near Chinatown
-Deli and grocery store across the street

Property is one block away from the two busiest street of Chicago (State St and Michigan Ave). 
For public transit, bus #29 (1 mins away), #1 and #3 (3 mins away) can you take you downtown in 20 minutes. 
For those with cars, this propery is close to all major highways (I-90/94, I-55, I-290, and Lakeshore Drive)
There is a taxi company next door (45 sec walk to taxi company's parking lot) so you can get a cab easily 24/7. Ride to downtown for ~$10 and 10 minutes

Absolutely no smoking and pets. We are located close to a train track (it does not operate during late night). If you are a very very very light sleeper you should sleep in the smaller bedroom instead of the master bedroom. Ear plugs will also help.

access: Guests will have access to common areas, living, dining, kitchen, bathrooms and their private bedroom.
description:
Drexel Suites Two welcomes you to the comforts of a home away from home.  Conveniently located in the culturally diverse and historic neighborhood of Hyde Park and minutes walking distance to former President Barack Obama's mansion.  Only 10 to 15 minutes travel time to the University of Chicago Campus, McCormick Place, downtown Chicago, Grant Park, Navy Pier, Lake Michigan and many historical museums.  Hyde Park offers a plethora of restaurants, shops and entertainment venues.

There are three private bedrooms in Drexel Suites Two. Although there are shared common spaces, each room is private and secure.  Perfect for extended stays, ideal for families and groups as well as for single travelers and couples.

Guests will have access to common areas, living, dining, kitchen, bathrooms and their private bedroom.

Upon arrival, you will be greeted by the host or co-host to acquaint you with the space and we will be available through-out the duration of your stay for any concerns, questions or friendly chats.

A neighborhood feature is the beautiful Washington Park only minutes away for morning jogs or strolls and during warmer weather features many festivals, outdoor movies, sporting events and jazz under the stars.  The historical African American "DuSable Museum " is also located nearby Washington Park.

Bus transportation is less than a block away and the metra train is about 10 minutes away.  The metra train will take you directly inside McCormick Place Convention Center.  Street parking is plentiful (free) and available in the neighborhood.
The University of Chicago Hospital and emergency room is 7-10 minutes away.  There is also a pharmacy and convenience store "Walgreens" 1/2 block away and a Walmart Food Store within walking distance.

description:
It's been a long day of work, touring or who knows what, and all you want to do is sink into a cozy bed in a clean room. Plus it'd be great if it was filled with anything and everything you may have accidentally left behind. Major plus if it's minutes away from grocery stores (yes! Jewel, Target, Best Buy), restaurants, synagogues, parks and even across the street from public transpo (CTA 93). What about awesome water pressure? Check. Family room to lounge and relax? Check. Fridge? Check.

What could be missing you ask? Well...a TV. But, that's where our Wifi password comes in handy so you can access whatever your heart desires from your personal device.

We are home during the evening hours and occasionally during the day. It's safe to say we'll always be available to answer any qs you may have!

CTA 93 bus is right across the street! And we are a quick drive/bus ride away from the L.

- We do have a young child at home and his room is above one of the guest rooms. We do everything we can to ensure you will enjoy a peaceful night's sleep, but would also recommend bringing a white noise machine just in case! :)
- There is plenty of free parking available! 
- This listing is mainly for lodging and lounging only. While there is no eat-in area at this time, light snacks and beverages are welcome.
house_rules:
Shoes must be left at the front door (don't want to ruin the carpet downstairs!)
We do not have an extra pack and play available, so if you are bringing a young child, please plan accordingly. 
Please no loud noise during the evening hours!

access:
The front gate and front door locks with key storage box with code at gate . You will be provided with a code prior to arrival. Please lock doors when arriving and departing. 

Security systems throughout the house for guest safety. Cameras inside and outside.
description:
We are located by the Lake Shore Blvd and a 12 minute walk to the Metra Train Station. Enjoy your stay in our home. You will have a private room with a full sized bed. Closet with hangers and extra storage space in the dresser. 43” Tv with Roku in your room. 

Shared office desk available.

55” TV with Roku in the shared Living Room. 

Plenty of free street parking available in front of the home.

-Located on the first floor. 
-Full Sized Bed comfortably sleeps two. 
-Carpeting in Room and Hard wood in common areas. 
-Bathroom stocked with shampoo/conditioner, and body wash.
-Kitchen has stove, microwave, fridge, and cooking utensils. All accessible to you at any time.
-Smoking allowed on front porch

The front gate and front door locks with key storage box with code at gate . You will be provided with a code prior to arrival. Please lock doors when arriving and departing. 

Security systems throughout the house for guest safety. Cameras inside and outside.

I am not always on the property, but i am always a call or text away. When I am at home I do like to socialize with the guests.

Bus Stop 2 min walk
Metra train station 10 min walk
Jackson Park walk 5 min drive 2 min
Jackson Park Golf Course walk 5 min drive 2 min
University of Chicago 5 min drive
Museum of science and industry 5 min drive
63 Street Beach 5 min drive 
Rainbow Beach Park 10 min drive
Horseshoe Casino 10 min drive
Downtown Chicago 10 min drive
Millennium Park and Grant park 15 min drive
Shed Aquarium Field museum Adler planetarium 15 min drive
Navy Pier 15 min drive
Oak Street Beach 20 min drive
The free Lincoln Park Zoo 20 min drive
United Center 20 min drive
Midway airport 30 min drive

Uber and lyft is the easiest way to get around, but there is a metra train station near by. Bus stop down the street  and will take you to downtown fast.

access: Guests will have full access and use of the house 24 hours a day. Electronic locks, so no keys to keep up with.
description:
Beautiful newly renovated 2nd floor 5-bedroom apartment, 1.5 bath, wifi, 4 smart (3-40" and 1-50”) TVs, keyless locks, Safety Box. Located in Brighton Park, a quiet neighborhood in Chicago. Lots of restaurants & shopping near by. Minutes to downtown, Chinatown, McCormick Place, United Center, Soldier Field, Guaranteed Rate Field, Midway Airport, O'Hare 35 min, Medical District.Near Expressways. Bus stop right in front of the building that can go to the Orange Line.free one  private garage space

Stay in a private beautiful second floor apartment. Plenty of space for families, friends, or company employees. 5-bedrooms with 3 full size beds, 1 sofa bed, 1 twin bed, 1 bunk bed(twin and full bed can be converted to sofa), and 2 queen air mattresses.  Can sleep up to 16 people. This apartment has a kitchen with all the amenities (huge fridge, stove, microwave, dishwasher), 4 smart tvs, keyless entry, wifi, safety box, huge back patio, free one car  private  parking garage

Guests will have full access and use of the house 24 hours a day. Electronic locks, so no keys to keep up with.

You won't see me during your stay, which allows you with more privacy and convenience. If you need to reach out, I am available at anytime. Send me a message via AirBnB if you have any questions or need anything.

Restaurants close by (Don Rafa's, Leon's BBQ, Popeyes, Dunkin Donuts, and many more). 

Stores are Walgreens(Archer & Kedzie), Pete's Market(47th & Kedzie), Target(Pulaski & 44th).

Near expressways 55 (can hit 90/94 going North or 294/355 going South). 

Bus stop is right in font of the building that can go to the Orange Line on Archer.

Free One Car Garage Space is included.

No living room, it’s converted into a master bedroom with a full bed, large futon, and has space for a queen air mattress.

Quiet hours after 10 pm. 

No guests after 10 pm.

No parties and no more than 6 people in the unit at one time.

No smoking or vaping. Please do not tamper with the smoke detector.

Check-out instructions: Please put all trash and recycling in the appropriate containers under the sink. If you have more trash or recycling than can fit in the bins, please use the extra trash bags located in the bottom drawer across from the sink (white for trash and blue for recycling) and place by the door. Please wash all dishes (a clean sponge is provided with the dish soap).

description:
Private basement studio with separate entrance in the heart of Andersonville, one of Chicago's coolest neighborhoods! Tons of restaurants, shopping, etc. nearby. 10-15 minute walk to/from Red Line, Brown Line and Metra! The unit has a kitchenette  with microwave/convection oven, refrigerator and coffee maker (there is no stovetop or conventional oven in the unit). Sleeps up to four people.

Enjoy the privacy of your own unit while exploring all of what Andersonville and Chicago have to offer!

Unit is completely separate and locked off from the main living space. Enter from the side of the house.

We're likely to be at home during your stay (though we work during the day) and would be available to answer questions.

Andersonville is a special place with lots of options for dining, entertainment and people watching. We're also about 1.5 miles from Lake Michigan, perfect for a walk, run or bike ride on a nice day!

We are conveniently located to several transit options. The CTA Red and Brown lines will take you downtown and many other places in the city, and are 10-15 minute walk away. We're about a 10-minute walk from the Metra, which is only a 15-minute ride from downtown. Several buses also stop outside of our house.

If you'd rather bike, we are near to several Divvy (Chicago bikeshare) stations.

Street parking is available if you are driving in.
house_rules:
Quiet hours after 10 pm. 

No guests after 10 pm.

No parties and no more than 6 people in the unit at one time.

No smoking or vaping. Please do not tamper with the smoke detector.

Check-out instructions: Please put all trash and recycling in the appropriate containers under the sink. If you have more trash or recycling than can fit in the bins, please use the extra trash bags located in the bottom drawer across from the sink (white for trash and blue for recycling) and place by the door. Please wash all dishes (a clean sponge is provided with the dish soap).

access: Backyard and balcony available to guests
description:
Welcome to Lakeview/Wrigley/Boystown, Chicago, IL, USA. Come stay in a 1400+ SF unit in a fantastic vibrant neighborhood close to all public transportation and play in one of Chicago’s best known entertainment districts. Everything is within walking distance (Wrigley Field, many restaurants/bars, coffee shops, shopping, grocery stores, Vic Theatre, comedy clubs, and our beautiful Lake Michigan beach). Close to DePaul University, Lincoln Park Zoo and just a short distance to downtown Chicago.

Wifi and Premium Cable in unit. Central Air and Heating. Private Balcony. Shared Patio and Yard. Pets will be allowed if requested and additional Deposit/Cleaning Fee Paid.

Please note that the third bedroom listed is in an open-spaced bonus area.

Backyard and balcony available to guests

I live nearby and will be available immediately, if needed.

Amazing neighborhood with all nightlife and entertainment Chicago has to offer nearby.

CTA Train and Buses within 2 blocks. Lake Shore Drive and bike path also within 4 blocks. Divvy bikes on the corner.

Wifi code will be available in the unit on the desk.

additional_house_rules:
****bookings without reviews will have to provide an ID via the Airbnb messaging system or at check in. LOCAL, one night stays must provide IDS of all guests via messaging system PRIOR to check in. NO UNAUTHORIZED GUESTS ALLOWED****

NO SMOKING IN THE UNIT. $200 fine + cleaning fees.

NO SHOES in the apartment (its a Japanese thing). We have provided slippers for you. It keeps the place cleaner. If you have a pet we can consider it based on a case to case basis but please contact me first. 

Please no one under 21 yrs old without a parent or guardian. Thank you.

Please wash any dishes you use. There will be a $25 extra cleaning fee for anything more than a few dishes left behind.

Please BE HONEST about extra guests. Additional guests without prior approval will be charged DOUBLE the original guest rate per night. Thank you.

ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES! Any parties will immediately forfeit your stay with NO refund. We have security cameras on the EXTERIOR of the building for your safety as well. *IF YOU ARE TRYING TO BE SLICK AND BOOK TO THROW A PARTY AND/OR THEN TRY TO CANCEL: I WILL KEEP WHATEVER FEES PER THE CANCELLATION POLICY. 

For stays with children under 2 yrs old: The unit is not "baby proofed" but is suitable for small children if under constant supervision.

I want to preface the following by saying 95% of our guests leave our places in amazing condition. We are very understanding about small messes that may have been overlooked as I know I am by no means perfect. That being said the following is to address the 5% who may not understand quite how airbnb works yet. 
1. We are not a hotel. 
2. We are not your personal maids. 

While there is a cleaning fee, the fee is to cover changing of linens, washing of towels and "normal" cleaning of the kitchen, bathroom and living areas. What is not covered and WILL incur an extra fee are the following: 

1. A pile of dishes left in the sink (violates house rules)
2. Excessive kitchen messes such as cooking grease all over the stove.
3. Excessive food on the floors (I dont mean a few crumbs-I mean it looked like someone was feeding pigeons).
4. Chewing gum ground into the furniture (yes, that has actually happened).
5. OBVIOUS wearing of shoes in the unit (we are a no-shoes house- see house rules) ie shoes foot prints, tracked in dirt and mud.
5. Anything else above and beyond what is considered "normal" cleaning. 
6. smoking in the unit will AUTOMATICALLY  incur a $200 fee. 

Again- this ISNT the majority of our guests and we understand things can be overlooked. Upon an "excessive cleaning" situation, I will not leave any review, I will simply send a request for an extra cleaning fee (usually around $25-50) depending on how much extra time it took to clean. Thank you for your understanding.

access: Entire unit is accessible.
description:
Very sunny top floor unit in the fabulous neighborhood of Ukranian Village/West Town. Very spacious unit with 3 bedrooms and 1 bath. In unit laundry, wifi and 2 large flat screen TVs with access to Netflix, Hulu, and hbogo. 1 TV is in the master. The bedrooms have memory foam mattresses w/ 1000 tc sheets and duvets. There is also an air mattress for more guests. There is a fully stocked kitchen with a full size stove, fridge and in-unit laundry. FREE street parking too!

**NOT CORPORATE OWNED**

Roomy 3 bedroom, 1 bath in the heard of West Town (named one of the best neighborhoods in Chicago). Newly decorated with high quality memory foam mattress, luxurious 1000tc sheets, large flat screen TV in the living room with Netflix, Hulu and hbogo. TV in the master bedroom as well. The space is situated on the top floor of a 2 story walk up. Kuerig coffee maker with pods in the kitchen. Toaster oven as well. Kitchen is also supplied with dishes, glasses, pots, pans and cooking utensils. For security reasons we have a camera in the foyer of the building (not in the unit). With that being said please be honest with how many guests are staying over also. If this unit is booked please check out my other places!

 If you need a parking permit to park on the adjacent street please ask ahead of time because we are only allotted a minimum number by the city. Thank you!

*NOT CORPORATE OWNED

Ps... Please be aware this is an old building. The exterior and entryways are a work in progress but the INTERIOR of the unit is as pictured.

Entire unit is accessible.

I can be as available as needed. I am always more than happy to help put together an itinerary. 

.....Also PLEASE, PLEASE let me address any issues that would warrant ANYTHING LESS THAN A 5 STAR RATING. Loud neighbor, broken appliance etc. (Anything less than 5 stars - even 4 stars is considered "bad" on airbnb and takes multiple 5 star ratings to make up). If a host's average falls below 80% "5 star rating" we may lose certain distinctions on the website or be pulled off entirely. Thank you.)

Really convienent area that is close to great neighborhoods like Wicker Park, Logan Square, Humboldt Park and downtown. Cute little corner store (that carries craft beer! The store has a better selection than some of the big liquor stores!) and great restaurants around the corner.

4 miles to Gold Coast/mag mile
5 miles to downtown proper
1.5  miles to Wicker Park
1 mile to Humboldt Park
5 miles to Wrigley Field
7.5 miles to McCormick Place

You can get around by car, Uber and  public transportation.

PARKING: Please let me know ahead of time if you will need temporary parking permits. Just place them inside the passenger side windshield. Parking is FREE on the street you just need neighborhood permit which I can provide.

EARLY CHECK-IN/LATE CHECK OUT: IF it is available, anything prior to NOON will incur an additional $25 fee. 9am being the earliest check in allowed. Any checkOUT from 2pm-6pm (IF available) will also be allowed with an additional $25. Anything earlier or later can be discussed (IF available).

access:
There is one parking spot provided but we can accommodate more than one vehicle with advance notice and preparation.

The 2-story private living space of the home is available to guests,  Access to the basement is for owners use only.
description:
Our huge 3-bedroom, two full bath, Victorian home sits in historic Oak Park next door to Frank Lloyd Wright's Home and Studio. This well kept private and intimate home is situated only blocks away from the train to downtown Chicago!  Nestled in the heart of Oak Park's oldest neighborhood, our property has Oak Park's original Oak trees.  The people and the neighborhood are unbeatable. It's a great place for families to stay or friends to meet. Our place is where you visit when you visit Oak Park.

What makes our space's location unique is it's urban yet quiet appeal of a Village neighborhood.  This is 2 story home has plenty of spaces for privacy or large gatherings.  The house sleeps 9-12, the back garden is gorgeous and perfect for hosting friends and family, and the privacy and discretion can't be beat.  We are 5-star hosts managing five owned Airbnb with extremely high ratings.  This newest listing is the one to grab!

Outdoors:
There is a back porch that's great for evening sit outs under alfresco evening lighting.  There is a playground for children to play and plenty of space to have a cook out, play games, or catch fire flies in the summer time.  It really is a special place and we hope you enjoy it.

There is one parking spot provided but we can accommodate more than one vehicle with advance notice and preparation.

The 2-story private living space of the home is available to guests,  Access to the basement is for owners use only.

We are all for privacy and simplicity.  If you want self check-in, it's available to you.  If you prefer, we're happy to check you in and out and will always be available to provide information about the area.  We own this home and live in Oak Park the property itself has direct access to the historic Frank Lloyd Wright Home and Studio. If you'd like interaction with us, we're here.  If not, the distance from our house (next door) makes 'distancing yourself' a fairly easy goal to achieve. :-)

Our space is centrally located amongst Oak Park’s largest and most historic homes.  We love everything about this neighborhood; it's quiet, all of the homes are +100 years old and meticulously kept.  This home is next door to the acclaimed Frank Lloyd Wright Home and Studio grounds. The original settlers of Oak Park (the Kettlestrings) lived around the corner from our home, so taking a walk in our neighborhood is like taking a stroll back through history.

We are four blocks away from centralized el/subway and we are a 15-20 minute train ride to Chicago's State Street. If you're driving, we are also a short distance away from the Eisenhower Expressway (I-290) and thus a short drive to Michigan Ave in Chicago.  Cabs are also easily accessible as we live only steps away from FLW Home and Studio where there is a cab stand.

There is a spacious garden, basketball hoop, children's toys, a tree swing and full playground which guests will have full access to.  The outdoor space is shared with homeowners and other guests for the guest house above the garage. The grille and fire pits are available upon request and in the summer months.  

The basement to the home is locked at all times from inside with owner-only access to be used during the day for Airbnb staging.  All doors and windows are alarmed and will sound when opened.  

We are casual hosts, we enjoy a carefree lifestyle and often enjoy taking walks in our neighborhood.  Come be our guest.
house_rules:
AM events may be OK with additional information - parties in any form are not allowed.
One parking spots available (two upon request), shared backyard with my family and coach house guests, so you must be comfortable that we may be present. 
Quiet hours after 10pm during week days (after Sept 1), 11pm on weekends

Suite consists of bedroom, private bath, study/office. Interior entrance, but suite is separate from rest of the first floor. We are 2 blocks from restaurants and shopping and public transport.  A quick 10 minute walk to Ryan Field and 1 1 /2 miles from Lake Michigan and NU. Children welcome. Quiet family neighborhood.

Large bedroom with queen size bed.  Private bath and study/office/with comfortable sofa bed on first floor.  Please let us know in advance if you will need  the sofa bed.

. Feel free to spread out on our entire first floor - kitchen, living room, dining room.

We like to socialize with our guests but will respect your privacy if you wish. We will be here to assist you with any questions about Evanston or Chicago.

2 blocks to METRA train into Chicago - 25 minute ride to downtown.
20 minute walk to CTA - 60 minute ride to downtown.
2 blocks to Evanston city bus stop

access:
You'll have access to the entire apartment. A shared space includes a washer and dryer that are free to use. 
Lockbox on door with keys. Pin to be provided upon receiving trip confirmation. 
Make sure to keep all doors locked when not in the apartment.
description:
Minutes away from some of the city's best authentic Mexican restaurants, this recently renovated 2-bedroom & 1 bath ground floor apartment offers privacy, quiet and comfort with a true Chicago feel.  
The unit is an affordable option with nearby access to the L-train and buses that will take you to downtown Chicago within minutes. 
Enjoy a full kitchen, plenty of closet space, free Wi-fi, access to a free washer and dryer and a private entrance in a safe and friendly building.

The apartment is in a 3-unit building that is personally managed and looked after by your host.
The apartment is equipped with brand-new appliances, two full-sized beds, a brand-new sofa, cable TV, free-Wifi and some coffee for those early mornings.

You'll have access to the entire apartment. A shared space includes a washer and dryer that are free to use. 
Lockbox on door with keys. Pin to be provided upon receiving trip confirmation. 
Make sure to keep all doors locked when not in the apartment.

I live and work in Chicago. I consider the Pilsen neighborhood and the building you will be staying at to be my home away from home. I will make sure your stay is a pleasurable one.

If you don't feel like taking the train or the bus to downtown Chicago (both less than 7 min away walking), there's always plenty to do in Pilsen, one of Chicago's most vibrant communities. 
Take a short walk north to visit the National Museum of Mexican Art, a local attraction. 
A 10 to 15-minute walk will offer a wide variety of authentic Mexican restaurants along 18th St. and Blue Island Ave. 
Within 2 blocks, you will find a local grocery store, a Walgreens and a churro cafe if you crave something sweet.

*No parties and no drugs of any kind. We appreciate you respecting our neighbors.

*No shoes in the house.

*Pets are subject to breed restrictions and pet fees:
1st pet: $200 per reservation for up to 2 nights and $50 per night after. 
2nd pet: $150 per reservation for up to 2 nights and $50 per night after.

access: You have the entire home to yourself. Guests traveling in groups can have personal smart lock access issued to each person. This way everyone in the group can securely come in and out of the home at their convenience.
description:
At this swanky home, you'll love the bold finishes, in-suite laundry, and private fully-equipped kitchen. Located in “village within the city” known for its charming and laidback vibe, you're near a nice array of casual taverns, independent shops, and cute cafes. Kick back on the couch over a good Netflix show, sleep in on an ultra-comfortable memory foam bed, or create a spa-like experience in the bathroom with rainfall shower, favorite tunes on the Bluetooth speaker, and ultra-soft towels.

The home is designed with every type of traveler in mind. Whether you're in Chicago on business, having fun with friends, or vacationing with family, you'll love this universal home. Business travelers can enjoy awesome high-speed internet and use the large communal table with great natural light as a work station. Groups of friends love the giant living/dining room for catching up over a drink and the full brand new kitchen to prepare a great meal. For traveling families and little ones, we have a pack 'n play along with a changing mat. We always strive to provide an exceptional experience.

You have the entire home to yourself. Guests traveling in groups can have personal smart lock access issued to each person. This way everyone in the group can securely come in and out of the home at their convenience.

I’m always available to make sure your stay is nothing less than 5-Stars. I can be reached by text or phone, and always available to answer a question or handle an issue.

Just 5 miles from downtown, Roscoe Village is a charming, laidback “village within the city” filled with casual taverns, independent shops, and cute cafes that spill out onto the sidewalks during the warm weather months. This cozy little pocket is an eclectic mix of unique boutiques, classic frame and brick homes, and locally owned eateries. It’s a wonderfully welcoming and quirky place. Case in point: popular comfort food spot Kitsch’n on Roscoe, where you can enjoy your brunch with a side of ’70’s-style kitsch. Check out Le Sud’s rooftop patio, where you can soak in the sun and laidback vibes with some French Mediterranean dishes. Come evening, head to Constellation, where you’ll find some of the city’s most progressive jazz, contemporary classical, and improvised music, founded by local drummer and Pitchfork Music Festival’s talent buyer. Shop a vintage clothing goldmine at Shangri-La Vintage. Get a free tasting on Sundays at Lush Wine & Spirits. Enjoy seasonal small plates and an approachable wine list on Volo Restaurant Wine Bar’s intimate, year-round patio.

By foot:
*1 block to Roscoe Street’s fun bars and restaurants
*0.6 miles to Chicago’s newest and largest Whole Foods
*1 mile to a Cubs game and Wrigleyville's nightlife
*1.7 miles to Regal Cinema theater
*2.4 miles to Lake Michigan, Belmont Harbor, and  the jogging trail

By train:
*Paulina-Lincoln/Roscoe Brown Line: short 7-minute walk
*Armitage Avenue shopping: 6 stops @ Armitage stop
*River North nightlife: 9 stops @ Merchandise Mart stop
*State & Michigan Avenue shopping: 10 stops @ State / Lake
*Loop: 10 stops @ Washington / Wells

By Uber:
*15-minute ride to the Loop and Millenium Park
*20-minute ride to McCormick Place

✪ This home comes with a private tandem two car parking space.
✪ Street parking is free and super easy all year round.
✪ The train is a short 6-minute walk.
✪ Excellent restaurant options around just the corner from the home.
✪ Traveling with pets? Got you covered. Subject to fees and breed restrictions.
✪ No smoking, no parties or events. To be respectful of our neighbors, please keep noise down after 9pm.
house_rules:
*No parties and no drugs of any kind. We appreciate you respecting our neighbors.

*No shoes in the house.

*Pets are subject to breed restrictions and pet fees:
1st pet: $200 per reservation for up to 2 nights and $50 per night after. 
2nd pet: $150 per reservation for up to 2 nights and $50 per night after.
Pets are not allowed on the couch nor beds. Any damages to home furniture or accessories are subject to fees.

access: Access is available to the apartment unit and laundry room.
description:
Feel at home in our two-bedroom plus den apt located in the quaint Horner Park neighborood. We are in the middle of Chicago's vibrant Northside while still having the benefit of coming home to a tree lined street. The apartment is easily accessible to great nearby bars and restuarnts by a short walk/train ride. Just one block away from the park and river. One block to bus access and a seven minute walk to CTA Brown line that will take you directly downtown and many other popular neighborhoods.

Private first floor apartment in our charming brick two flat home. Perfect for small groups, enjoy your own two bedroom and one bath apartment with a queen size bed in each room. There is a bonus room off the kitchen that has a queen futon mattress for extra space. The apartment includes a full kitchen and formal separate living and dining room. Coin laundry is located in the basement. In the summer months, enjoy the backyard that's fully equiped with patio furniture and grill.

Access is available to the apartment unit and laundry room.

I live close by and I'm available for your questions and needs.

It's right around the corner from Horner Park which has tennis, soccer, basketball courts and baseball diamonds. There are lots of paths and fields to enjoy as well. Great place to go for a walk or run. There is also a new brewery and great restaurants right around the corner.  There's a 7 Eleven thats a three minute walk from the apartment and also a 12 minute walk to Aldi. The apatment is a short drive to the Lincoln Square neighborhood, which also has lots of shopping and restaurants.

2 miles to 90/94. A short walk to buses on Montrose or Irving Park that will take you to the blue line to get to O'hare or downtown. A 7 minute walk to the Brown line that will take you to many other neighborhoods downtown, and midway airport. Take the train or bus to Wrigley field which is less than 3 miles away.

There's one queen size airbed availabe

access: Guests have complete access to our modern, fully-equipped kitchen so long as it's kept clean after each use.
description:
The Skydeck Experience by DivvyTrek features a private guest room in a modern condo unit one-half block to the Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) Green Line stop at Indiana that’s a 20 minute ride to major downtown attractions such as The Skydeck at Willis Tower. 

The McCormick Place Convention Center is just 20 minutes by train.

Close to lakefront, beaches, stadiums and Hyde Park. University of Chicago, IIT, UIC and Loop campuses are nearby.

We offer a one bedroom in a large, luxurious condo located in a hip, up-and-coming neighborhood with culture and soul near the Chicago Loop. Includes free parking, WiFi and washer/dryer access.

You'll enjoy the privacy and comfort of your own bedroom, a fully-equipped modern kitchen and full access to the dining and living rooms. Long-term stays are available as well. 

There may be additional guests staying in the other bedrooms during your stay which is great for meeting new people and networking. Essentially, we offer guests the convenience of a boutique hotel while providing the comfort of home. 

We're just a mile away from Chicago's lakefront, providing great bike trails, running paths, beaches and gardens, not to mention views of one of the world's most scenic waterfront skylines. Of course, we're conveniently situated for business travelers attending conventions at McCormick Place or meetings with major corporations downtown, as well as institutions of higher learning, such as IIT, UIC, Northwestern and the University of Chicago, both the downtown and Hyde Park campuses.

Getting around is easy as we're only a block away from the public transit stop. There, you can catch the train that'll take you directly downtown in minutes or you can transfer to other trains for connecting to all parts of the city, including both airports. 

If you have a car there is ample, free street parking and the Loop is only a 10 minute drive. In addition to the train, we highly recommend rideshare services from either Uber or Lyft, which are very economically priced from our place for getting around the city.

This is a great place for you if you'd like to be close to the energy of Chicago's vibrant Loop but want to experience a unique, local neighborhood.

Guests have complete access to our modern, fully-equipped kitchen so long as it's kept clean after each use.

Guests are provided city guides and public transit info via Acehopper, "Airbnb's front desk concierge", available for iPhone, iPad and Android devices, for tickets, guides and tips on local places to visit. 

When I’m around, I like to entertain. I’ll definitely make your stay a comfortable and memorable visit to the area.  Sometimes I’m busy, but I’ll do my best to accommodate your needs.

Experience the city like a true, native Chicagoan. Close to several parks and restaurants. Only a mile away from the beautiful Chicago Lakefront and Beaches! Plenty of trails for biking, walking and jogging.   
  
Enjoy water sports at the nearby harbor:   
* Jet skis  
* Kayaks  
* Flyboards  
* Paddleboards   

Plus spectacular views of Chicago's magnificent skyline.

Nearest public transit is less than one block away, arriving every 5-10 minutes. Bike shares are available at the station. Just download Acehopper for iPhone and Android for public transit times, bike sharing availability and info for local events and attractions, including maps and tickets for purchase direct from your phone or tablet. Of course, we also recommend rideshare services such as Uber and Lyft to navigate around the city.
house_rules:
• Check-in is anytime after 3PM
• No parties or events
• No pets
• No smoking

All shoes must be taken off at the door. Feel free to bring house slippers. No pets. Please be energy conscious and turn off lights and electronics when leaving. Please also clean up after use the common areas such as the kitchen (especially dishes and appliances), hallway bathroom, living and dining rooms.

When I’m around, I like to entertain. I’ll definitely make your stay a comfortable and memorable visit to the area.  Sometimes I’m busy, but I’ll do my best to accommodate your needs.

access: Full access to apartment.
description: Embrace the alluring aesthetics of this mid-century modern inspired home. The space boasts industrial accents, a mix of different textures and patterns, wood finishes, original architecture features, and designer touches.
house_rules: We are renting this place to get to know this amazing city and would be happy to share the space with others looking to do the same. This is a pet free, smoke free house. Please be respectful of the neighbors and keep volume to a reasonable level. No parties or guests allowed.
interaction: We are quick to respond via text/phone if you need anything.
neighborhood_overview: The property is located just 10 minutes west of downtown, accessible by public transportation nearby. The home is close to the Ukrainian Village, Wicker Park, and Bucktown, with cocktail bars, restaurants, and vintage shops.
notes: Having strangers in the building can be awkward for our neighbors so a smile friendly hello goes a long way. Please keep noise levels down and be respectful, our neighbors love us and we want to keep it that way.
space:
Plenty of free neighborhood street parking. This spacious two bedroom apartment is located in the heart of Wicker Park / Ukrainian Village, Chicago ...very close to public transportation (both the Chicago bus line just steps away and the Damen and Division St blue line train is a 15 minute walk) with some of the best restaurants, bars, clubs, galleries, live music venues, and cafes in town. 

Conveniently located in the center of this lovely Ukrainian Village neighborhood. The apartment is an amazing vintage building with personal modern touches. The neighborhood is full of character and beauty everywhere you look.

2 Rooms:
- 2 queen sized beds with new comfy mattresses.
- fresh linens and towels
- closet and space for suitcases
- full kitchen 
- private sun room
- back patio
- 1 bathroom 

The Building:
- Free laundry in the basement
- Free wi-fi 
- Big Screen with apple TV in the living room.
- 1 bedroom has TV with Chromecast 

About Us:
We are two California natives that relocated after we fell in love with Chicago. He is a chef who consults globally and she is local tech founder. We are big foodies and music lovers. We like exploring the city just as much as you so we will have plenty to share.
summary: Embrace the alluring aesthetics of this mid-century modern inspired home. The space boasts industrial accents, a mix of different textures and patterns, wood finishes, original architecture features, and designer touches.
transit: Public transportation by bus is a few steps away, blue line train is a 12-15 minute walk. Lyft and Uber are always one click away for the most convenient way to get around affordably.

access: Key in lock box
description:
Whether you want to be amidst the hustle and bustle of downtown or want to take a stroll through Hyde Park, you'll be close to it all. And added bonus public transportation is a quick 2 block walk. Newly remodeled and nestled on a quiet, tree lined street with 3 bedroom and 2 baths, plus additional common area with a queen sofa bed. Amenities include dinning area, work space, central air/heat, wifi, cozy deck and complimentary host concierges and tourist recommendations.

- 3 bedroom, access to a full kitchen with cookware, dishes, microwave, coffee makers 
- Complimentary wifi through out
- 2 televisions, bring your Netflix and Hulu log ins 
- Free parking on Sunday, parking permits provided upon request for Saturday and weekdays 
- Access to deck and BBQ grill, smoking allowed on deck only 

Other amenities include: toiletries (in case you forget something), wifi, bottled water

Please note our house is not kid friendly and we don’t except guests under 15 years old.

Key in lock box

We are Chicago Natives and always happy to welcome new comers or return visitors to our beloved city so please feel free to ask us questions and tell us how we can help make your visit memorable!

Quiet block on the south side of Chicago, 10 minutes to Hyde Park, lake front beach, Museum of Science and Industry. 20 minute bus ride to the heart of downtown.

The #14 bus is two blocks away, close to all the major highways including Lake Shore Drive, 94 and 55. We can supply parking permits upon request.

All guests must be 15 or over

description:
Spacious, family home with with traditional modest decor.. full open kitchen and dinning room. Upstairs living room. Downstairs living room with fire place and bedroom with TV / workspace desk and bathroom. 3 bedrooms on the third floor with a bathroom, master bedroom with walk in closer. Backyard and patio with driveway garage and 2 entrances. There is also a basement where the laundry room is located.

All spaces except the garage/ shed are open for guests. Guest must park in driveway.

Guest can contact us via air bnb app or upon booking via phone number.

Quiet family neighborhood near shopping malls  and 294 tollway and 94 expressway. 10 min from ORD and 20 min from downtown Chicago.

I recommend a car rental and or ride share services such as Lyft and Uber to get around.

Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking:

- The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred.
-Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am.
-Lost key fee - $300
-Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc.
-Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc.
-Smoking - $300
-Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300



**-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.

access:
In addition to full access to the apartment, you’ll also enjoy the building’s amenities. Feel free to use the laundry room (just BYO detergent and quarters), lobby lounge area, and the sunny patio. 

Our secure building’s doors are only accessible with a key fob, so make sure to bring the key fob with you anytime you leave the apartment.
description:
Searching for a quiet urban oasis in the Windy City? Look no further than our sunny, professionally decorated apartment in the heart of Chicago’s Edgewater neighborhood. 

Comfortably accommodating up to 5 guests for business or pleasure, our apartment includes a spacious living room, a fully equipped kitchen, and laundry room.

What’s better than an apartment smack-dab in the middle of the Windy City? How about your own place that’s just minutes outside of the downtown hustle and bustle so you can enjoy the best that Chicago has to offer AND get a good night’s sleep?

Welcome to our sunny oasis in Edgewater, a charming neighborhood slightly north of Downtown Chicago, and just a few stops from Loyola University, Evanston, the Magnificent Mile, and Grant Park via the Red Line train. Edgewater is blocks from Lake Michigan, which you can enjoy via numerous nearby beaches and the scenic Lakefront Trail.

Our one-bedroom apartment features two plush Queen-size beds, complete with premium linens and plenty of pillows. The private bedroom has a large window and ample closet space so you can unpack and make yourself at home. And in the living room, our couch unfolds into a Queen-size sofa bed to accommodate additional guests. It’s no normal sofa bed - it’s actually really comfortable!

Our one full bathroom is complete with fluffy towels, complimentary toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, and soap), and a hairdryer. It has a shower/tub combo, toilet, and sink with storage above and below.

Thanks to our open floor plan, the living room, and kitchen create one big living space, where you can whip up a gourmet meal, kick back with a movie, or just chill out with your travel companions. The living room’s 49-inch flat-screen TV has unlimited Netflix streaming and the entire place has fast WiFi. Throughout the apartment, you’ll find modern decor and stylish furniture which has been chosen by our professional designer - so we can’t take all the credit! 

In the kitchen, we have stocked the cupboards with all of the dishes, cookware, and utensils you’d need to cook up a storm. Appliances include a full-size refrigerator and freezer, stove, oven, dishwasher, Keurig coffee maker, and toaster. It’s seriously Top Chef-worthy, so feel free to hit up the nearby Target or Aldi for groceries and fill up the fridge.

Need to do some laundry or burn off last night’s deep-dish? Our building has a laundry room that you’re welcome to use at any time. And while parking is not included with our place, there is street parking available nearby.

In addition to full access to the apartment, you’ll also enjoy the building’s amenities. Feel free to use the laundry room (just BYO detergent and quarters), lobby lounge area, and the sunny patio. 

Our secure building’s doors are only accessible with a key fob, so make sure to bring the key fob with you anytime you leave the apartment.

We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.

Our unit is on the 4th floor of a building full of other apartments, and you can access it via the elevator. The front doors are locked at all times and access is granted with a key fob.

We highly recommend keeping your key fob in a safe place, because if you lose it, you’ll lose access to the entire building. Not fun. It takes time to replace it, which means you might be locked out of the building and the apartment for a while, and any fob replacement will incur a fee of $300. That’s probably not what you have in mind for a “memorable” trip to Chicago, so let’s just keep track of the fob.

Our apartment includes lots of awesome amenities, but it does NOT include a parking space. If you need to park a vehicle, there is some metered street parking nearby. We recommend using the Spot Hero app to claim a street parking space. The city is easily accessible with public transit and ridesharing, so having your own set of wheels isn’t necessary unless you plan on exploring far outside the city limits.

Our building has strict rules, so please don’t do anything illegal (this includes marijuana smoking). And our neighbors can (and have!) called the police on any illegal activities.
We know you want to jump up and down and shout about how awesome Chicago is, but our building has strict noise limits. No loud music, no parties, and there will be no problems.

Smoking is NOT allowed in our apartment. Any smoke in the unit will result in having your reservation cancelled and a $200 fee assessed for cleaning and restoring our place to its smoke-free condition.

Thank you for understanding, and we look forward to hosting you!

If you prefer to not worry about a possible run-in with a meter maid or an overpriced parking garage, we recommend utilizing Chicago’s awesome public transportation system (the CTA train and bus) to get around the city. 

The Windy City is also extremely walkable, and when you stroll down the Lakefront Trail, you just might find your own two legs taking you all the way to the South Side. Or, take a spin on two wheels using one of Chicago’s bike-sharing programs, like Divvy.

Our place is a quick 4-minute walk to Bryn Mawr Station, where you can hop on the Red Line, which will take you all the way north to Loyola and south to Wrigley Field and Downtown Chicago. At Howard Station (a 10-minute ride north), the Red Line turns into the Purple Line, which continues to Evanston and Northwestern University.

Ridesharing is also an option, and both Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro. During morning and evening rush hours - and during popular events - remember that Downtown Chicago can get filled with traffic and fares may increase.

-Access to the unit is through an elevator 

-There are many units inside this building.

-please be aware If you lose the key and entry fob, which is your access to the entire building, it can not be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment unit and all amenities until another one can be made.  There is a $300 fee for losing key and entry fob.

There is limited street parking. I recommend using "spot hero" app and claim parking near by for your stay. You can access the whole city through the CTA train near by.

-All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay, as they are other tenants at the property.

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.

We highly recommend keeping your key fob in a safe place, because if you lose it, you’ll lose access to the entire building. Not fun. It takes time to replace it, which means you might be locked out of the building and the apartment for a while, and any fob replacement will incur a fee of $300. That’s probably not what you have in mind for a “memorable” trip to Chicago, so let’s just keep track of the fob.

Our apartment includes lots of awesome amenities, but it does NOT include a parking space. If you need to park a vehicle, there is some metered street parking nearby. We recommend using the Spot Hero app to claim a street parking space. The city is easily accessible with public transit and ridesharing, so having your own set of wheels isn’t necessary unless you plan on exploring far outside the city limits.

Our building has strict rules, so please don’t do anything illegal (this includes marijuana smoking). And our neighbors can (and have!) called the police on any illegal activities.
We know you want to jump up and down and shout about how awesome Chicago is, but our building has strict noise limits. No loud music, no parties, and there will be no problems.

Smoking is NOT allowed in our apartment. Any smoke in the unit will result in having your reservation cancelled and a $200 fee assessed for cleaning and restoring our place to its smoke-free condition.

Thank you for understanding, and we look forward to hosting you!
notes:
-Access to the unit is through an elevator 

-There are many units inside this building.

-please be aware If you lose the key and entry fob, which is your access to the entire building, it can not be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment unit and all amenities until another one can be made.  There is a $300 fee for losing key and entry fob.

There is limited street parking. I recommend using "spot hero" app and claim parking near by for your stay. You can access the whole city through the CTA train near by.

-All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay, as they are other tenants at the property.

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.
space:
What’s better than an apartment smack-dab in the middle of the Windy City? How about your own place that’s just minutes outside of the downtown hustle and bustle so you can enjoy the best that Chicago has to offer AND get a good night’s sleep?

Welcome to our sunny oasis in Edgewater, a charming neighborhood slightly north of Downtown Chicago, and just a few stops from Loyola University, Evanston, the Magnificent Mile, and Grant Park via the Red Line train. Edgewater is blocks from Lake Michigan, which you can enjoy via numerous nearby beaches and the scenic Lakefront Trail.

Our one-bedroom apartment features two plush Queen-size beds, complete with premium linens and plenty of pillows. The private bedroom has a large window and ample closet space so you can unpack and make yourself at home. And in the living room, our couch unfolds into a Queen-size sofa bed to accommodate additional guests. It’s no normal sofa bed - it’s actually really comfortable!

Our one full bathroom is complete with fluffy towels, complimentary toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, and soap), and a hairdryer. It has a shower/tub combo, toilet, and sink with storage above and below.

Thanks to our open floor plan, the living room, and kitchen create one big living space, where you can whip up a gourmet meal, kick back with a movie, or just chill out with your travel companions. The living room’s 49-inch flat-screen TV has unlimited Netflix streaming and the entire place has fast WiFi. Throughout the apartment, you’ll find modern decor and stylish furniture which has been chosen by our professional designer - so we can’t take all the credit! 

In the kitchen, we have stocked the cupboards with all of the dishes, cookware, and utensils you’d need to cook up a storm. Appliances include a full-size refrigerator and freezer, stove, oven, dishwasher, Keurig coffee maker, and toaster. It’s seriously Top Chef-worthy, so feel free to hit up the nearby Target or Aldi for groceries and fill up the fridge.

Need to do some laundry or burn off last night’s deep-dish? Our building has a laundry room that you’re welcome to use at any time. And while parking is not included with our place, there is street parking available nearby.
summary:
Searching for a quiet urban oasis in the Windy City? Look no further than our sunny, professionally decorated apartment in the heart of Chicago’s Edgewater neighborhood. 

Comfortably accommodating up to 5 guests for business or pleasure, our apartment includes a spacious living room, a fully equipped kitchen, and laundry room.
transit:
If you prefer to not worry about a possible run-in with a meter maid or an overpriced parking garage, we recommend utilizing Chicago’s awesome public transportation system (the CTA train and bus) to get around the city. 

The Windy City is also extremely walkable, and when you stroll down the Lakefront Trail, you just might find your own two legs taking you all the way to the South Side. Or, take a spin on two wheels using one of Chicago’s bike-sharing programs, like Divvy.

Our place is a quick 4-minute walk to Bryn Mawr Station, where you can hop on the Red Line, which will take you all the way north to Loyola and south to Wrigley Field and Downtown Chicago. At Howard Station (a 10-minute ride north), the Red Line turns into the Purple Line, which continues to Evanston and Northwestern University.

Ridesharing is also an option, and both Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro. During morning and evening rush hours - and during popular events - remember that Downtown Chicago can get filled with traffic and fares may increase.

description:
My place is close to restaurants and dining, nightlife, and public transport. You’ll love my place because of the neighborhood, the light, and the comfy bed. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers and business travelers. 

The loft is noisy and located in a vibrant part of town and on a busy street so expect to hear the activity and noise, especially on the weekends. If noise is an issue for you, I ask that you to look for other accommodations, if it’s not then you’ll have a blast here!

The entire space is yours to enjoy and relax

I am available if you need me, and always a phone call or text away with whatever you may need

There is a number of public transportation just by stepping outside of the loft. There are buses and the Damen blue line is directly across the street.

There are a handful of delicious and delectable restaurants within walking distance and depending on your taste I would be happy to offer recommendations during your stay.

additional_house_rules:
****Guests without reviews will have to provide an ID via the Airbnb messaging system or at check in. LOCAL, one night stays must provide IDS of all guests via messaging system PRIOR to check in. NO UNAUTHORIZED GUESTS ALLOWED****

NO SMOKING IN THE UNIT. $200 fine + cleaning fees.

1. Please NO SHOES in the unit.
2. Please wash any dishes you use. There will be a $25 fee for more than just a handful of dishes left behind.
3. Parties and events have to be cleared PRIOR to your stay. IF YOU ARE TRYING TO BE SLICK AND THROW A PARTY AND/OR THEN TRY TO CANCEL: I WILL KEEP WHATEVER MONEY YOU PAY PER THE CANCELLATION POLICY. 
4. No smoking
5. No pets. I do have other units available that accept pets.
6. smoking in the unit will AUTOMATICALLY  incur a $200 fee. 

I want to preface the following by saying 95% of our guests leave our places in amazing condition. We are very understanding about small messes that may have been overlooked as I know I am by no means perfect. That being said the following is to address the 5% who may not understand quite how airbnb works yet. 
1. We are not a hotel. 
2. We are not your personal maids. 

While there is a cleaning fee, the fee is to cover changing of linens, washing of towels and "normal" cleaning of the kitchen, bathroom and living areas. What is not covered and WILL incur an extra fee are the following: 

1. A pile of dishes left in the sink (violates house rules)
2. Excessive kitchen messes such as cooking grease all over the stove.
3. Excessive food on the floors (I dont mean a few crumbs-I mean it looked like someone was feeding pigeons).
4. Chewing gum ground into the furniture (yes, that has actually happened).
5. OBVIOUS wearing of shoes in the unit (we are a no-shoes house- see house rules) ie shoes foot prints, tracked in dirt and mud.
5. Anything else above and beyond what is considered "normal" cleaning. 

Again- this ISNT the majority of our guests and we understand things can be overlooked. Upon an "excessive cleaning" situation, I will not leave any review, I will simply send a request for an extra cleaning fee (usually around $25-50) depending on how much extra time it took to clean. Thank you for your understanding.
