description:
The house is located in Jeffery Manor (southeast side of Chicago). Perfect for medical professors, minutes from Trinity Hospital, Jackson Park, and South Shore.

Private entrance, personal mini fridge, and microwave. Walk in tub, seated shower with jacuzzi jets.

I live on-site and am very available to guests to answer questions and provide recommendations.

My place is close to several hospital throughout the South and Southeast side of the city. Perfect for medical professionals, solo travelers, weekend adventurers, etc. A quick Uber ride to anyplace in the city.

Ample street parking, close to major expressway, short drive to Horseshoe casino (Hammond, IN), restaurants, nightlife.

description:
... Welcome to stay with Sonya!!
I been hosting for 3+ years. I love staying airbnb as well as hosting.
It's the house entire place, nothing fancy BUT
it's experienced set up in the house everything you need as a traveler.
You're taken care of if you decided last min booking & come bare hand.
Individual bathroom and your own space for privacy. Self check in/ host greetings check in available.

This is a private room with it's own lock, and there's 2 beds inside the same room just for your group. Both are queen beds.
Kitchen there's Microwave, water kettle, coffee maker, little dinner table, full set up kitchen, you could make easy meal, salad etc.
Two lovely living rooms. with a sofa in and all other essentials such as:
hair dryer, iron, water, etc.
WIFI and Cleaner including.

,, Host is one call away. 
We are living in the building could come help when needed.

hair dryer, iron, water, etc.
WIFI and Cleaner including.

it's experienced set up in the house everything you need as a traveler.

access: Our guests have access to our home during their stay. Living areas, guest bathrooms, kitchen, laundry and outside living areas
description:
Welcome to Logan Square and the historic and beautiful Bernard Street! We have everything you need for a great stay. Private suite in our quality home and the most comfy beds around! All 5 star reviews! Come Enjoy!

Welcome to The Chez EZ a Classic 1920's Four Square with large “hangout" front porch and entertaining backyard on the desirable Bernard St.  in HOT Logan Square.

This  listing is a 400 s.f. private room, with private entrance and a large private bathroom en suite- with a steam room / shower that has rain, wall and handheld jets- also has a seat!  It has a very comfortable bed with a queen size mattress, (top of the line Sealy posturepedic with pillow top and high thread sheets ), night stands and plenty of light. There's a comfy couch, 40" flat screen television with cable and wifi. This room also has a microwave, small refrigerator, nespresso machine (coffee and supplies provided), electric kettle, luggage racks,  hangers, dresser, full length mirror, iron/ironing board and anything else you may need for a comfortable stay, like extra pillows, blankets, etc.  You also have full access to the house- and can come and go through the main entrance as well- We love our guests and we love hanging out! We are only 2 blocks from the square and heartbeat of this neighborhood...which is important if you don't have a car or don't want to drive it!

We are conveniently located and after a short five minute walk you'll find yourself surrounded by Centennial Monument Park, Lula Cafe, Longman & the Eagle, Reno, Webster Wine Bar, The Double, Logan Theatre, The Burlington, Azucar, New Wave Café, Logan Square Auditorium, Rocking Horse, Same Day Cafe, Chiya Chai, Hopewell Brewery, Young American, Flat & Point Park and Field - and the list goes on and on. Logan Square offers a Farmers Market all year long and if you walk a little further (or one train stop over to California) you'll find the Congress Theater, Revolution Brewing, Café Mustache, City Diner, The Logan, Township, Bang Bang Pie Shop and much more. Our area is also full of bookstores (new and used), record stores, bike shops, galleries, unique shopping and wonderful architecture and history.
 
Our house is conveniently located near transportation as well. We're a five minute walk to the Logan Square Blue Line train and minutes from the #74 Fullerton and the #56 Milwaukee bus stops. Bernard Street also offers plenty of permit free parking and our block is in a residential neighborhood which is safe and has plenty of lights and neighbors. If you're arriving at O'Hare Airport, the Blue Line brings you directly into Logan Square- only 9 stops from ORD. There are also  DIVVY Bike Stations within 2 blocks of our home.

Our home is an artist's haven- has the original woodwork, built-ins and stained glass windows, but has fully modern heating and central AC, bathrooms, stainless cook's kitchen, etc. Our great room offers a large living space with plenty of entertainment choices, fireplace and a plethora of books. You can enjoy our wireless internet, access to kitchen, ping pong, washer & dryer and back yard living space.

 There are books and diverse magazines everywhere for your reading pleasure-or introduction to Chicago!   We have two great dogs- who are calm, well trained and love people- they get the best reviews!

 We have owned this home since 2006 and specifically moved to Logan Square for the richness of the neighborhood and convenience to downtown. We are proud Chicagoans and can assist you with any of your questions about our great neighborhood and City!

Please respect our neighbors as well-  they are great. The only parties allowed are OURS, but if you're nice...you're invited!

You may notice multiple police cars at the end of our block, they are here 24/7 because our Mayor lives near by and they are her security detail.

We generally do a 2 PM or later  check in and  12 PM checkout, but can be flexible if needed.

Enjoy our home! The Chez EZ

Our guests have access to our home during their stay. Living areas, guest bathrooms, kitchen, laundry and outside living areas

As much or as little as our guests want!

Logan Square has everything you need and want! A vibrant community  with great food, stores, transportation and people!

Our house is conveniently located near transportation as well. We’re a five minute walk to the Logan Square Blue Line train and minutes from the #74 Fullerton and the #56 Milwaukee bus stops. Bernard Street also offers plenty of permit free parking and our block is in a residential neighborhood which is safe and has plenty of lights and neighbors. If you’re arriving at O’Hare Airport, the Blue Line brings you directly into Logan Square- only 9 stops from ORD.

We generally do a 2 PM or later  check in and  12 PM checkout, but can be flexible if needed.

Again, we now have a police car 24/7 at our corner as part of the Mayor's security detail.

additional_house_rules:
- House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.

access: You'll have full access to the entire loft, a private bathroom and the building's laundry room.
description:
A renovated and cool loft in a building dating to the 1880s in Old Town is exactly where you want to stay during your trip to Chicago - the location is ideal for seeing everything you've got on your list: across the street from Second City, Steppenwolf, and Lincoln Park, and about 20 minutes' train ride from the Loop or Wrigley Field.

The Full-sized beds are bunk beds, so the top one is up a ladder!

You'll have full access to the entire loft, a private bathroom and the building's laundry room.

An incredibly popular neighborhood destination, largely because of its proximity to the lake and downtown, Old Town keeps up a lively pace day and night. Victorian-era buildings, brick alleyways and narrow, tree-lined streets are charming backdrops to a busy main strip that runs along Wells Street between North Avenue and Division Street.

My place is a few minutes' walk away from the Sedgwick Brown/Purple line train station, and equally convenient to the North Ave and LaSalle buses - it's almost more convenient to not have a car here! If you do bring your car, however, there are several garages nearby with overnight parking.

- House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.

access:
Earphoria offers:
- Complimentary bread, milk, eggs and condiments
- Full Kitchen Access
- Linens and Towels
- Wi-Fi 
- Free Washer and Dryer
- Family style breakfasts and dinners are often cooked by hosts, friends and guests of Hostel Earphoria. New guests are encouraged to participate. 
- We ask that each host and guest contribute by doing a daily chore.  
- Gated parking available on request.
description:
A long-standing interdisciplinary arts space in Chicago's Logan Square neighborhood.

Earphoria is a unique guesthouse in Logan Square Chicago that also functions as a community focused, interdisciplinary art space. We have transformed an entire house into an urban rest stop for musicians, artists, and lovers of the arts on the road, giving them a space to stay, play, practice, record, collaborate and perform.

If you are looking for the formal experience you would enjoy in a hotel, Earphoria is not for you. We are for those that are more "adventure travel" oriented, who want to learn about the communities they pass through and be a part of the real Chicago arts scene. 

Earphoria is a single family home that offers couch surfing spaces in a shared space and one bathroom. There is a community kitchen, living room, dining area, finished basement, back yard and deck.

Earphoria offers:
- Complimentary bread, milk, eggs and condiments
- Full Kitchen Access
- Linens and Towels
- Wi-Fi 
- Free Washer and Dryer
- Family style breakfasts and dinners are often cooked by hosts, friends and guests of Hostel Earphoria. New guests are encouraged to participate. 
- We ask that each host and guest contribute by doing a daily chore.  
- Gated parking available on request.

Logan Square is a dynamic, exciting neighborhood that is very walkable.

Parking is easy, with non-permit parking available on the street. There is a CTA bus stop right outside our door and we are a 6 minute walk away from the Logan Square Blue Line stop.
house_rules:
- We ask that each guest does one chore a day.

- During the week quiet hours begin at Midnight. 
- During the weekend quiet hours begin at 2am

access: Kitchen, laundry, patio/grill, living room.
description:
Recently featured on Houzz, this private room in a shared house has a Queen bed, desk, TV, lovely tree view-window, & space to hang your clothes. Enjoy your own private marbled bathroom with a beautiful shower, & vanity stocked with all the essentials you need. We supply sheets, towels & parking permits.

Beautiful private sunny room in a shared house. This room has a queen sized bed, marble vanity and shower, a sitting chair by a tree-view window, small desk, ceiling fan, flat screen TV, wifi. We provide parking permits, towels and sheets. 

In the rest of the shared house, you will also have access to our library, laundry, living room, kitchen, and patio with grill.  Our home has central air, so heat in the winter and AC in the summer.  You will hear the train as it passes (three lots over), but the sound will hopefully woosh you to sleep :)
See our recent feature in Houzz!
(website hidden)(phone number hidden)/list/my-houzz-eclectic-industrial-style-in-a-charming-chicago-home

Kitchen, laundry, patio/grill, living room.

We can be available to you often as you need. There will most likely be other guests staying in the two other guest rooms, but there's a chance you'll have the whole house to yourself!

5 minute walk to Wrigley Baseball Stadium/bars and restaurants, 10  minute walk to Southport Street's shopping and family friendly restaurants, 10 minute walk to Boystown, 7 minute walk to Belmont Redline EL station, 20 minute train ride to downtown.

7 minute walk to the Belmont Redline EL station.

We keep a fully stocked kitchen with some basics for you to have breakfast, a snack, or cook your own meal.  We also keep all the bathroom essentials including shampoo/conditioner, soap, face-wash/ moisturizer, extra toothpaste/toothbrush, and anything else you may need.  We have wifi, Smart tv with Netflix etc, games, books, and a record player.  We provide sheets, towels and parking permits.

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence.  Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.

description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

Our historic ivy-covered coach house has a private entrance and an airy queen bedroom. The newly renovated kitchen is outfitted with European-sized appliances - though you'll probably have no time to cook, since we're surrounded by the best restaurants Chicago has to offer. Book today!

You enter our coach house via private entrance - down a few stairs is the kitchen, with a table for two, and a spacious bathroom with standup shower. Up a few stairs is the living area/bedroom combo with a queen bed and a sofa that folds down into a twin bed as well as a spacious closet.  The TV is located here and includes channels from Direct TV. Wifi is included, too!

A transformation — or rather, an explosion — has taken place among the former factories, wholesale markets and warehouses on the edges of downtown. One of Chicago's fastest growing neighborhoods, the West Loop is a study of contrasts.

We're a 10 minute walk to the Morgan Green line station and the Racine Blue line station, and just steps to the Madison and Ashland buses - you won't have any trouble getting around town without a car from here! If you do bring your car, however, there's plenty of street parking in the neighborhood.
house_rules:

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence.  Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.

description: Fully furnished with either one queen bed or a twin and love-seat sleeper, this Double Studio comes with a kitchen equipped with silverware, dinnerware, cookware and basic appliances. Guests can also make use of a TV set and free, high-speed Wi-Fi in the studio.  Enjoy the comforts of home and everything Chicago has to offer in this artsy neighborhood. This is a pet-friendly apartment, so if your pet insists on joining you on your trip, for a small fee you’re welcome to bring them along! You'll feel like you're flying first class when you stay at the Ginosi 747 Apartel in Chicago.

description:
A bright cheerful, spacious private suite plus a sitting room and bathroom that can accomodate up to as many as 6 people and makes a wonderful retreat in the city one night of several weeks.  This is a place you will always remember and want to come back to.

We have a guest room with a queen sized bed  and a private bathroom on the third floor of our house. We are non-smokers who live in Chicago close to Oak Park. We are green line and 20 minutes from the Loop (Downtown Chicago) via the green line train.

We are also walking distance from grocery stores to the famous Oak Park Farmers Market.

We have a flock of chickens and backyard farm based on permaculture principles.  Longer term room rental includes a plot in a local community garden and use of bicycles.

All common areas

One of us is home most of the time.  We allow people their privacy, but love to share our knowledge of Chicago and what it offers.

Really great people who are very involved in the communty, diversity, amazing historic houses, urban agriculture, easy to get everywhere

We are two blocks from the Green line, 5 minutes from the expressway and convenient to the entire Chicagoland Region

Check in is after 6pm. Please communicate requests for exceptions in advance.
house_rules: Quiet hours between 10pm and 6am.

description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this bright River North furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and beautiful living room with great  views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI165)

Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your comfortable living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this River North apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- Swimming Pool
- Gym
- Indoor Parking

- Bike Storage
- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

access: You have access to our whole home, the private balcony, and the full size gym on the ground floor.
description:
Welcome to our Penthouse Loft in the heart of Chicago! When you are here, you have a walk score of 97 and a transit score of 100 to get whereever your trip leads you.

Guests love our home because:
-Lots of natural light
-High loft ceilings
-FAST WIFI
-Spacious layout
-Comfy beds
-Central Location
-Private Balcony!
-Close proximity to Grant Park, Soldier Field, Museums, and more!

We look forward to having you at our home!

(Pssst... Quick favor if you're thinking about booking: Please read the entire listing as it likely answers any questions you may have. Thanks!) 

To access the building, we give you a simple code to go in-and-out as you please. You walk up the stairs to the elevators, and take the elevator to the top floor, the 8th floor.

When you exit the elevator, you turn right and then left down the hallway to your home. When you enter the home, it opens to an open, spacious loft. There is a dining area, a kitchen, a living room, a half bathroom,and private patio for those staying on the first level. The private patio gives you a fresh feel and a cool cityscape view.

If you walk up to the 2nd floor, you will find a spacious loft with two full size beds, a huge closet, a full bathroom, and a half bathroom. This is truly a special place, and we look forward to making your stay a 5-star experience!

Q: Is the neighborhood safe?
A: Very much so. 24 hours a day.

Q: PARKING?
A: The home is very easy to get to via public transit. If you decide to drive, we recommend apps like SpotAngel or SpotHero to find free or cheap parking ($10-20 / night). 

Q: Do I need to bring towels, a hair dryer, or linens?
A: Nope! we provide all these things. Same with hotel-size toiletries (unless I happen to be out, which is rare).

Q: When can I check in or check out? 
A: Check in is 4pm and check out is 10am. Early check ins can be difficult if there are guests who checked out same day. We ask for an early check-in, or a late-check out fee, if you request either.

Q: Can I come and go as I please?
A: Yes. And we wouldn't trust any listing with which this isn't the case.

Q: Is the place professionally cleaned between guests?
A: Yes, and we take pride in providing a clean home for guests.

Q: What's my total booking price? 
A: We honestly have no idea. With fees included, it only shows the guest how much they pay. This figure should be present after you enter your dates. Note that, pricing varies on a daily basis, and it actually uses some crazy algorithm to adjust it automatically, so I don't actually control this.

Q: Are the beds comfortable?
A: Very. Some guests say they're the best they've ever slept on!

You have access to our whole home, the private balcony, and the full size gym on the ground floor.

We're here to help as you need it! We give all of our guests full itinerary for their trip 2 days before their stay.

Printers Row is “pocket” neighborhood just minutes from the Chicago Loop. After the Great Chicago Fire of 1871, the area became the Midwest hub of the printing industry with historically significant buildings designed by legendary architects like Daniel Burnham, William Holabird and William Le Baron Jenney. Today, many of those historic buildings remain but the quiet, tree lined streets are now largely residential. Of course, it continues to be a draw for fans of Chicago architecture.

During the day, the neighborhood is an easy walk to offices in the Loop, off Michigan Avenue, or in LaSalle Street financial centers. After hours, the district is alive with restaurants, boutiques, book and antique stores.

It boasts famous blues clubs, eclectic music venues and neighborhood taverns where residents gather. It also has an annual book fair: The Printers Row Book Fair gathers authors, poets, speakers and, of course, books.

Printer's Row is also walking distance to Chicago's Museum Campus, with the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium, and the newly redesigned Soldier Field.

With a 97 walk score and 100 transit score, you can get everywhere your heart desires in Chicago. The Red Line subway is one of the main subways in Chicago, and is only a block away. Many restaurants, shopping, parks, and museums are within walking distance.

No local guests
$1000 smoking/party fee

access: The entire space is for guest use with the exception of the closet in the office.
description:
1 Bedroom & 1 Office Space.

Keyless Entry (via an App or Daily Manual DoorCode).

Located on historic 18th street. Steps from restaurants, bars, shops and public transportation (#60 and #18 bus, Pink Line CTA train).

10 minute drive to Downtown Chicago, Chinatown, West Loop, and more!

5 minute drive to the National Museum of Mexican Art.

Forbes named Pilsen "One of the 12 coolest neighborhoods in the world".

Washer/Dryer + Tide Pods provided

Office Space - Desk and Chair.

Master Bedroom - King Size Bed, Dresser, Closet Space, 40 inch TV (Stream content your Phone, no cable). White Noisemaker for better sleep. 

Living Room - Large Sectional Couches, Ottoman, 55 inch TV with YouTube TV.

Kitchen - Basic Cooking Supplies.

Bathroom - 4 Bath Towels, Shampoo, Conditioner, and Body Wash.

The entire space is for guest use with the exception of the closet in the office.

Available via email/phone 24/7. I usually respond within the hour.

Close proximity to Thalia Hall, United Center, Downtown Chicago, West Loop, Lake Michigan, Millennium Park, Grant Park, Guaranteed Rate Field (White Sox Stadium) & Pink Line CTA.

Lyft/Uber, CTA bus and train, free parking available along Throop Street from 18th to 22nd, metered parking available along 18th street.

Keyless Entry - guests can download the Latch app (recommended for easier access, enter with the touch a button) or I can provide guests with a code to type in each time they enter.

additional_house_rules:
- A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled
- Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty)
- Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a fee.
- All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property.
- Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance
- Please contact us for details

description:
Discover the best of Chicago, with this one-bedroom Gold Coast apartment with balcony views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this airy Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, pretty living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#CHI82)

As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Chicago vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- Gym
- Indoor Parking
- Roof Deck
- Garden

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished rental is in the historic Gold Coast district. The area is located just north of downtown Chicago, nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline. Considered one of the most affluent neighborhoods in the country, the Gold Coast is every upscale shopper’s dream. The retail revelry on Oak and Rush Streets includes swanky boutiques and rare, designer fashions. There are many celebrated restaurants to try, including Michelin-starred winners and classic Chicago steakhouses. Amongst the prestigious hotels and celebrated eateries, there is a trove of booming nightlife hot spots and high-energy events.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
house_rules:
- A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled
- Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty)
- Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a fee.
- All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property.
- Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance
- Please contact us for details

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

access: Guests have the entire in-law basement unit with a private entrance to themselves. They are also welcome to relax in our front garden area or back yard. Families with children can help themselves to our backyard playhouse and sandbox!
description:
Sunny, private in-law basement unit with free parking permits for our guests! TV with Netflix and blue ray player. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, the 606 trail, and several parks.

Guests have the entire in-law basement unit with a private entrance to themselves. They are also welcome to relax in our front garden area or back yard. Families with children can help themselves to our backyard playhouse and sandbox!

We live upstairs and are happy to help with anything you may need.

Our home is on a quiet residential street that is walking distance to restaurants, cafes, parks, and the 606 elevated walking/bike trail. Fifteen minute walk to the heart of Logan Square.

15 minute walk to CTA blue line train (25 minute ride to O'Hare / 20 minutes to downtown). 15 minute walk to heart of Logan Square. One block from major bus route. Permit parking available in on our street.

*Guests have their own separate entrance and complete privacy. However - they will be staying in a house. We live upstairs and wake early. We have two young children and a dog. You will hear them during your stay and we will hear you! 

*This is a 100+ year old home with central heat/air. The building is insulated but during the winter months it can be chilly because it is a basement unit with tile floors. We do provide a space heater and can adjust the heat/air if requested.

description: Welcome to my humble Logan Square abode! My spacious studio apartment is only a short stroll to great shopping centers, XSport fitness(24 hour gym), the Movie Theater, and some tasty restaurants. The 90 94 expressway is under 5 minutes away, making it convenient to get Downtown, as well as the Airports. Logan Boulevard( great night life and restaurants) as well as surrounding neighborhoods such as Wrigleyville, Downtown, Uptown, Lakeview, Lincoln Park are a short 5-10 minute Uber ride!

access: You will have access to the entire house, including the laundry room that is located in the lower level. The house has an enclosed back porch and an outdoor patio with a grill that can be used for outdoor cooking.
description:
Room has lots of natural light. Room is arranged to give ea. person some semi-privacy.  It has 2 dressers, shared closet, separate lamps & small computer tables. Homestay includes  breakfast. Same sex buddy room only. Fee is per person-per night.

This is a 7 bedroom, 3.5 bathrooms house in a quiet neighborhood. The space is well distributed with 2 kitchens, spacious dining and living rooms, a small family room, and an enclosed patio.

You will have access to the entire house, including the laundry room that is located in the lower level. The house has an enclosed back porch and an outdoor patio with a grill that can be used for outdoor cooking.

We keep a family environment. We share some times at dinner time when everyone makes it around the same time in the evening.  The kitchen and dining room are the main gathering place.  We share conversations about our cultures and journeys around the world. On weekends, sometimes people gather in the living room to watch a movie. On special occasions, we go out together.

My house is located in the center of the city about 30 minutes from downtown and 20 minutes from O'Hare Airport. There are many amenities in the nearby area, including restaurants, sports bars, museums, movie theatres, bowling alleys, and shopping stores.
Access to any part of the city or suburbs is easy because our CTA and RTA / city busses and train system are easy to manage. I always provide guests with the link to our transportation system so they can plan and track their daily trips. If you rent a car, I have easy street parking.

Close to all city entertainment via the Blue Line train and CTA bus system. 
My website also provides you with the link to the bus system tracker so you can be always informed about the bus schedule. The same is for the train system.

Directions to the house:
Your “home away from home” is located at the West end of the Logan Square community – across from the Belmont-Cragin neighborhood.  The area is clean, safe and easy to walk. You have a Walmart - 24 Walgreens – a gym facility, and other amenities few blocks from the house.

If you are arriving from O’Hare Airport:
Before you take the train, make sure to buy the VENTRA (transportation card).
You will save money buying a 1-week pass, even if you are going to be here for couple of days; otherwise you will pay $2.25 every time you board a bus or train.
If you are staying for 30 or more, buy the 1-month pass $100 + $5 for the card.  You will be able to reload the card, if you are going to stay longer.

From O’Hare:
Once you take the Blue Line train (the only one from the airport) it will take you about 20 min (depending on the time of the day) to arrive to the Irving Park Station.  Go down the stairs and take the bus #53 going South Pulaski (right) to George St.
Walk West (right) to the house.

From downtown Chicago:
Take the Blue Line – you have three options to come to the house:
In general, the trip will take about 35-40 minutes.
1 – Get off on Logan Square – take the bus #76 – get off on Pulaski – walk North pass the Fire Station and the Self Storage warehouse – make a left on George street to find the house.
2 – Get off on Kinball/Belmont Station – take bus #77 – get off on Pulaski – take bus #53 to George Street – walk West (right) to the house
3- Get off on Irving Park - take the bus #53 going South Pulaski (right) to George St. - walk West (right) to the house.

I have high speed Xfinity- WIFI. Ask me for the code. I have my business license. Cleaning fees are charged per visit, or per month, depending on the length of your stay. Monthly cleaning fee for short-term guests is $75 and includes other toiletries such as toilet paper and and additional home goods, cleaning and kitchen supplies used by the long-term guests. Long-term cleaning and supplementary fee is $50 per month, in addition to the monthly rental fee. For your convenience this fee can be paid either all at once when doing the homestay booking, or it can be paid on a monthly basis to the host via (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN), or Chase Quickpay.
house_rules:
We keep a respectful and private environment for all guests. 
Given that all guests have different school, work and traveling schedules, I ask that everyone keep the noise down after 10:30pm during the week and by 12:pm during the weekend, unless we are having a gathering at the house.
Everyone should clean after themselves and keep their areas organized.

additional_house_rules: All bookings require a security deposit of $250 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance.  Kindly note that the special reduction in Cleaning Fees is only for the Winter Season hence the regular Cleaning fees of USD 100 will be applicable for all arrivals on or after 01 March, 2019 on wards.  For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in.   Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds.   Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine.   No parties, gatherings or events of any kind are allowed in the unit.   Our locations do not allow pets.   If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $25 for every extra hour of cleaning required.   Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events.   Lost or unreturned keys at the time of checkout will be charged a $50 per set.  If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full.   We may ask to hold in advance a damage/security deposit for last minute reservations or local stays.  If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or to any individuals, let us know immediately.   If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $50. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 11 am and 1 pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if our team has approved a late checkout in advance.   When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.  Shoes off, please.

description:
Roll up venetian blinds first thing in the morning and look out the bedroom window at a view of an arty and multicultural neighborhood. Plan a day's visit to nearby galleries and restaurants while having breakfast around a glass-top dining table.

Neighborhood Overview
This apartment is situated perfectly for the traveler looking to experience Chicago’s largest attractions while staying in one of its intimate communities. Pilsen is a cultural hub of flavorful and visual attractions, from The Art Walk and Thalia Hall to its authentic Mexican and Vietnamese restaurants, all of which are still only a short drive away from the Museum District, the Magnificent Mile, and Navy Pier.

Enjoy the best tres leches in town—Kristoffer's Cafe & Bakery is a few blocks away!

The apartment is in Pilsen, a cultural hub of attractions from The Art Walk and Thalia Hall to authentic ethnic restaurants. It's situated perfectly for travelers looking to experience Chicago while staying in one of its intimate communities.

Please note there is currently neighboring construction, potential for noise between 8am to 6pm.

Paid parking @ USD 25$ per night,please contact us for more information.

description:
The room is within walking distance to the University of Chicago and President Obama's home is footsteps away. It is along University of Chicago's free evening shuttle bus route for students and faculty living near campus. Simply board next to university's main library and get dropped off a 1 minute walk away. This shuttle runs every 30 minutes from 5 pm to 4 am. Additionally, the # 2 bus to downtown is also a 1 minute walk from the apartment.

Location: Ellis Ave and East Hyde Park Blvd

The unit is on the 2nd floor. A lockbox is on the left of the entrance door

There is a shared porch and terrace for guest to enjoy.
description:
Stay in a newly furnished executive apartment with its own beach on Lake Michigan. Watch the waves from your living room or sit out on the terrace and enjoy a drink provided by the host.   Steps away from parks, restaurants and minutes away from Northwestern and Loyola Universities. Less than 25 min drive to Wrigley Field, Downtown Chicago, Soldier Field, and museums  Onsite parking included.

A very private and unique residence has direct access to Lake Michigan that includes impeccable design, furniture & art.  A fully equipped kitchen, In-unit washer/dryer, Nespresso, Drip coffee, snacks, and bottled water are provided.

The unit is on the 2nd floor. A lockbox is on the left of the entrance door
There are 14 stairs that lead to the unit. 
There is a shared porch and terrace for guest to enjoy.

available via text, call or email

This property is located in Rogers Park and bordering Evanston, Illinois. 
Eastlake Terrace Street is a private 3 block street located in East Rogers Park and bordering Lake Michigan.  There are 4 parks along Lake Michigan. Shopping, transportation, and restaurants are a 10minute walk.

Red Line Train station stops are Howard and Jarvis.

Parking is in front of the building 
Wi-fi is provided
Netflix and Amazon Prime are available on each TV. 
Wireless Speakers are connected to Wifi

additional_house_rules:
No shoes in the house, the guests will be provided with brand new spa slippers.
No cooking in the house. There is a kitchenette in the room with microwave, toaster, coffee maker, and fridge; if you want to prepare your own food. We do not offer any meals. 

Additional rules
- No shoes in the house, spa slippers are provided
- Be cordial to our neighbors
- Keep noise level low
- Keep doors and windows locked. While the neighborhood is safe, it is better not to take any chances.
- NO parties/NO smoking/NO illicit drugs/NO fire arms/NO illicit activities
-Keep common areas tidy at all times.
Non-confirmed guests are not allowed in the premises.
-No food allowed in the living room.
-Do not use, remove, or displace any of our personal items without our written approval.
- If you need refills of shampoo/body wash/toilet paper...etc., please let us know.

access:
You have access to your bedroom and private bathroom (1 floor above your bedroom).

You room is equipped with a kitchenette, hair dryer, iron, and ironing board. We also provide clean linens and towels. 

All three rooms in this house are available at any time through Airbnb. This means that you may see other guests entering or exiting premises; however, each guest area is on a separate floor. 

NOTE: The house is near the L, and while that offers unmatched convenience, you will be able to hear the train noise.

The bedroom is located at garden level and the bathroom is located on the main level. This bathroom is for your exclusive use.
description:
Unbeatable location in historic Lincoln Park

Private large bedroom at garden level with window facing private patio
1 Queen bed, 1 Double bed and 1 sofa bed
Private bathroom on main level (1 level up)

Carpeted floors
Next to the Fullerton Train Station

Fully equipped kitchenette.
Hair dryer, iron and ironing board in room.

Free Street Permit Parking available
WiFi access throughout the unit
Walking score: 95

Walk to lakefront, magnificent mile, zoo, restaurants & shops

1 Queen bed, 1 Double bed and 1 sofa bed
Comfortably fits 6 people
Carpeted floors
Room has a fully equipped kitchenette with microwave, refrigerator, toaster and coffee maker. There is regular ground coffee and creamers. 
Hair dryer, iron and ironing board in room.

You have access to your bedroom and private bathroom (1 floor above your bedroom).

You room is equipped with a kitchenette, hair dryer, iron, and ironing board. We also provide clean linens and towels. 

All three rooms in this house are available at any time through Airbnb. This means that you may see other guests entering or exiting premises; however, each guest area is on a separate floor. 

NOTE: The house is near the L, and while that offers unmatched convenience, you will be able to hear the train noise.

The bedroom is located at garden level and the bathroom is located on the main level. This bathroom is for your exclusive use.

We will be available for you as much or as little as you need us. It is up to you how much interaction you'd like.

Located in historic Lincoln Park. Walking score: 95
Lincoln Park Zoo and lake front within a short 10-15 minute walk.
Restaurants and shops within steps of the house. 
Get to the Magnificent Mile in less than 15 minute train ride or walk there in less than one hour. 
Whole Foods is around the corner, and Trader Joe's and Aldi are a short 15 minute walk.

Next to the Fullerton Train Station. 

Red, Brown and Purple lines stop at the station. Red line runs 24 hours. During peak hours, the red line runs approximately every 6 minutes. 

Street permit-only parking. You must let me know you will need permits prior to your arrival. Please read the permit instructions in the back of the permits to ensure you place them in your car properly and avoid a ticket.

The train is nearby. So if you're a light sleeper, this is not the place for you. The sound is muted and does not bother the vast majority of people. Here are some reviews from previous guests mentioning the train noise:

From Bobbie: "Although next to the train station, I barely heard them go by."
From Paula: "...the train noise that they talk about in the description really wasn't a big issue."

For more, read our over 200 reviews!

We have a hypoallergenic dog. He is never in the space you’re renting. You may run into him in the entryway on our way to/from walks.

additional_house_rules:
Our House Rules that you hereby agree to when you book a reservation.  
Please read carefully and do not book with us if you do not agree to them. 
We enforce them!    

- Friday & Saturday require minimum 2 night say    
- Maximum Occupancy is 4 registered guests    
- Please add all guests to the reservation so we can communicate via the app.    
- No entertaining, no parties, no visitors, and no additional guests for any reason.    
- Any person over 2 years old is counted as a guest    
- No animals of any kind please unless you have a certified service animal (prior notice required).    
- Light cooking only, no pungent/powerful smells are not permitted.    
- No smoking, vaping, or candle burning of any kind.    
- We have no special accommodations for infants.  

Contact us with questions  about the rules if you have an unusual circumstance and we can usually accommodate you in advance.

access: Self check in with lockbox located in the entry door.
description:
Sunny and spacious 2-bedrooms apartment.  Located in one of Chicago's most exciting neighborhood.  Walking distance to great boutiques,  restaurants, and coffee shops.  Steps to public transportation. 🚞 and 🚌

Sunny apartment with a lot spaces to enjoy.  Suitable for families, couples or group of friends.  Thoughtful decorated, with all the amenities you need in your stay. 

For summer we have a great outdoor space with BBQ area.

Self check in with lockbox located in the entry door.

I’m always available for questions by texts or phone.  Happy to meet our guests but also given them privacy.

Andersonville is a great, safe and walkable neighborhood.  The vibre on Clark street is amazing.  Have plenty of restaurants and coffee shops just walking 🚶‍♀️ distance.

There is a buss station  close to the property.  And the train is couples blocks away.  (Red Line)
house_rules:
Our House Rules that you hereby agree to when you book a reservation.  
Please read carefully and do not book with us if you do not agree to them. 
We enforce them!    

- Friday & Saturday require minimum 2 night say    
- Maximum Occupancy is 4 registered guests    
- Please add all guests to the reservation so we can communicate via the app.    
- No entertaining, no parties, no visitors, and no additional guests for any reason.    
- Any person over 2 years old is counted as a guest    
- No animals of any kind please unless you have a certified service animal (prior notice required).    
- Light cooking only, no pungent/powerful smells are not permitted.    
- No smoking, vaping, or candle burning of any kind.    
- We have no special accommodations for infants.  

Contact us with questions  about the rules if you have an unusual circumstance and we can usually accommodate you in advance.
interaction: I’m always available for questions by texts or phone.  Happy to meet our guests but also given them privacy.

access:
Once your booking is confirmed you will receive check in instructions before arrival in your itinerary.

Nearby lockboxes with keys allow convenient check-in.
In & out driveway access for guests who purchase parking.
description:
A perfect sized guest bedroom in a beautiful home in the best neighborhood in Chicago. 

Be close to all of the action in Chicago’s Lakeview neighborhood! You will be walking distance to Lake Michigan, Wrigleyville, Boystown, Belmont Theater District, Addison Station, Belmont Station, and much more.  Nightlife, retail shopping, coffee shops, and liquor stores all walking distance.

Great for people eager to visit one of the most diverse, cultured, and popular late-night neighborhoods in Chicago.

You will love my home because of the A+ location, amenities, and accessibility with a bus Stop right outside of the front door, Divvy Bike station directly across the street, and Belmont or Addison Red Line stops within 10 minutes walking distance. 

Great for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and groups (I have other rooms available per request)

This 2nd floor property is beautifully located in the heart of Boystown’s historic nightlife. This property is perfect for entertaining because of its open layout. You will also have access to the bar (provide your own booze), board games, and beer pong. (During summer months) guests will also have access to the back porch.

If you have a little one there is a pack & play available if needed.

During your visit you will have access to Internet, in-unit Washer/Dryer, and reserved easy in & out driveway parking available for purchase so you don’t have to worry about checking on your car throughout your visit.

You will love this beautiful private space that is designed to make guests feel at home with an emphasis on community and occupation of common spaces. 

Central Air Conditioning and Heat
In-unit Washer/Dryer
Dining space for at the table and at the bar stool. 

2 Bathrooms, WiFi, TV (bring your own programming), 1 Bluetooth speaker in the common area, Towels and Linens, Coffee, Equipped Kitchen, Blow dryers, Let me know if there is anything specific you may need before or during your trip and I will do my best to accommodate! 

Wrigley Field = 9 minute walk
Addison Station = 9 minute walk
Boystown Bars = Seconds away
Belmont Station = 10 minute walk
Belmont Harbor = 16 minute walk

Magnificent Mile = 11+ minute car ride (depending on traffic)
Soldier Field = 15+ minute car ride (depending on traffic)
DePaul University Lincoln Park = 10 minute car ride (35 minute walk)
Aragon Ballroom = 10 minute car ride
Lincoln Park Zoo = 10 minute car ride (35 minute walk)
Millennium Park = 14+ minute car ride (depending on traffic)
United Center = 23+ minute car ride (depending on traffic)
Field Museum & Shedd Aquarium = 19+ minute car ride (depending on traffic)

Once your booking is confirmed you will receive check in instructions before arrival in your itinerary.

Nearby lockboxes with keys allow convenient check-in.
In & out driveway access for guests who purchase parking.

Close to Boystown, Wrigleyville, Lakeview, Belmont Harbor, Wrigley Field, Belmont and Addison L stations, Lakefront, Lake Michigan, Lincoln Park, SouthPort, and Andersonville. 

Located In a lively entertainment district that is surrounded by restaurants and bars. Bars close at 2:00am and 3:00 am Saturdays. 

Spacious apartment with great views and a great location.

Great place for Cub’s games, Pride, Market Days, Lollapalooza, St. Patrick's, and Chicago Marathon. You will literally be able to watch the pride parade, pride festival, and Market Days festival from the living room.

CTA Bus stop is outside of the front door.
Addison Station = 9 minute walk
Belmont Station = 10 minute walk
Divvy Bike station directly across the street.
Belmont Harbor = 16 minute walk

Parking can be purchased (onsite and offsite)

Please inquire about any questions regarding minimum and maximum length bookings, I am open to working on durations!

access: The entire home is accessible for guests. There’s several decks and outdoor areas as well as a top of the line natural gas grill (no canisters).
description:
Read the reviews. Amazing, 4-floor art filled modern home in RiverWest neighborhood. 
3000 square feet, minutes to downtown, 1-minute walk to blue line at Chicago Ave, buses to everywhere. 
Located in RiverWest. Walking distance to Michigan Ave, blue line, great restaurants. Fulton Market/West Randolph 10 minute walk.
The amenities expected in million dollar property. 5-floors of luxury, tranquility, privacy &  security. Gourmet kitchen, 4-bedrooms & 3.5- bathrooms. Read the reviews.

Modern, bright & full of light. All the amenities of a 4-star hotel, plus a chef's kitchen and 75" flat panel for video entertainment. Each bedroom has flat panels for entertainment. The house is wired for high speed wireless internet throughout. Beautiful bathrooms, Jacuzzi tub, walk-in showers. There's also a natural gas grill on one of the decks. Three different decks and views of the city skyline.

The entire home is accessible for guests. There’s several decks and outdoor areas as well as a top of the line natural gas grill (no canisters).

We're available 24-7 for any issues or guests needs.

We’re a two minute walk to the blue-line metro station. There’s great restaurants and bars 10-minuets walk / short Uber away. RiverWest is considered one of Chicagos great neighborhoods, it's safe, fun, & perfectly located to visit all of Chicago's sites. 2-stops to downtown on the blue line metro & 40-minutes to O'hare airport on the same blueline train.

We have a dedicated parking spot for one vehicle, there's ample FREE parking in the neighborhood. There’s a Divvy bike rental station next door and bus and metro station is a 2-minute walk. There’s taxi's and Uber’s readily available 24/7.

Most guest rooms have fridges & coffee makers, and there's an expresso machine in the kitchen. All rooms have wireless internet & flat panels
house_rules: Guests may host parties and events, but only with our prior explicit consent. Guests must be respectful of the neighbors, their property, noise levels, & the landscaping in front of the property as well as in the rear garden areas.
interaction: We're available 24-7 for any issues or guests needs.
neighborhood_overview: We’re a two minute walk to the blue-line metro station. There’s great restaurants and bars 10-minuets walk / short Uber away. RiverWest is considered one of Chicagos great neighborhoods, it's safe, fun, & perfectly located to visit all of Chicago's sites. 2-stops to downtown on the blue line metro & 40-minutes to O'hare airport on the same blueline train.
notes: Most guest rooms have fridges & coffee makers, and there's an expresso machine in the kitchen. All rooms have wireless internet & flat panels
space: Modern, bright & full of light. All the amenities of a 4-star hotel, plus a chef's kitchen and 75" flat panel for video entertainment. Each bedroom has flat panels for entertainment. The house is wired for high speed wireless internet throughout. Beautiful bathrooms, Jacuzzi tub, walk-in showers. There's also a natural gas grill on one of the decks. Three different decks and views of the city skyline.
summary:
Read the reviews. Amazing, 4-floor art filled modern home in RiverWest neighborhood. 
3000 square feet, minutes to downtown, 1-minute walk to blue line at Chicago Ave, buses to everywhere. 
Located in RiverWest. Walking distance to Michigan Ave, blue line, great restaurants. Fulton Market/West Randolph 10 minute walk.
The amenities expected in million dollar property. 5-floors of luxury, tranquility, privacy &  security. Gourmet kitchen, 4-bedrooms & 3.5- bathrooms. Read the reviews.

access: The Apartment has its own separate Private Entrance.
description:
Large 1 Bedroom Apt w/ LVG RM near Lake Michigan in beautiful, residential & diverse neighborhood. Has Private Entrance, FREE PARKING, Sleeps up to 6!  *Kitchenette, Full Bath, WiFi, Cable TV, in unit W/D.    Close to METRA TRAIN (1 block away & 16 min to loop/city center), Bus 1 block away, & the CTA "L" (elevated) Red Line to City is 7 blocks away. 
We are very glad about our proximity to Public Transit, Beaches, Loyola & Northwestern Universities. Great for families, friends & kids.

The White Owl Apartment  
(honoring the white owl who is mounted at the peak of the home)
It's a Very Cozy, Private One Bedroom apartment on the top floor of a vintage home on a beautiful tree-lined street in East Ridge / Rogers Park.  The *Kitchenette includes a refrigerator, microwave/convection oven, toaster oven, electric skillet, coffee maker, all cooking utensils, plates, silverware etc. but no stove.
The open living room has TV, WiFi, Books, Movies & Games are available upon request. There is a washer + dryer in the unit.
It has a wonderful outdoor deck that most guests enjoy and to sit among the tree tops for their morning coffee and to plan the day.
Plenty of space, comfortable resting spots and lots of natural light. Lots of artwork as well!

The apartment is fully equipped with linens, blankets, towels and toiletries. 

The Bedroom has One Full Bed and One Single Bed. The Living room has a sleeper sofa for Two and a single day bed.

Parking -
Free Street Parking is Available (which is normally very limited in Chicago).
We can also save you a spot in our driveway!
Neighborhood -
It's a ten minute walk to the beautiful beaches and run/walk/bike trail.
You can walk to a large park with a Golf Course, grocery stores, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, theaters, a yoga studio, and to live music.

We live in a diverse neighborhood so you can eat any style food, food from around the world or just get good pizza or other food delivered!

Transit -
We live a One block from the Metra Train which is 16 minutes to Downtown Chicago, 10 minutes North to Evanston/Northwestern University and 30 minutes North to Ravinia. 

It's a 15 minute walk to Loyola Campus.

6 blocks to the Red Line "L" Morse or Howard Stops on the RED LINE which is a 20 minute ride to Wrigleyville or 30 minutes to downtown.
There are three bus lines within a few blocks.

These ALL provide easy access to downtown Chicago, Wrigleyville (for a Cubs game) or up to Evanston/Northwestern University, Loyola or the North Shore. Easy drive to anywhere from here too. We have lots of information if you need it. 

Specifics -
We don't allow for pets due to our guests with allergies.
No smoking inside please.

The Apartment has its own separate Private Entrance.

Happy to Interact with guests upon request. 
We are glad to offer any assistance!
There are maps of the city and transit and brochures about Chicago's happenings available in the unit. 
It takes only 1-2 minutes to get an Uber or Lyft driver from our location.

2018 Chicago Summer Festival Schedule https://chicagotonight.wttw.com/2018/05/28/2018-chicago-summer-festival-guide 

Quaint residential neighborhood with tree lined streets, nearby parks, beach, biking trails, tennis and golf. Several casual restaurants nearby. 

On street parking readily available or a spot in our driveway if you prefer.

Easy access to ALL Public Transportation!
One block to the Metra Train to the City (16 min) or Evanston to the North.
The Bus Line is two blocks away.
There are two CTA "L" (elevated) train stations nearby (8-10 min walk).
interaction:
Happy to Interact with guests upon request. 
We are glad to offer any assistance!
There are maps of the city and transit and brochures about Chicago's happenings available in the unit. 
It takes only 1-2 minutes to get an Uber or Lyft driver from our location.

description:
Vintage 2 Flat in Brookfield, eclectic and fun, extra comfort for two adults and your pets!  This home is pet friendly with dog doors, pet crates and a fenced in yard.  Excellent short term residence or landing pad for an extended stay in Chicagoland.

Centrally located, walk to the Burlington Metra train or local night life and restaurants.  Garage parking and much more to keep you happy !!!

The home is 110 years old but has been updated with many new fixtures and features.  It has been freshly painted and is very clean and organized.

This was my personal home, I moved closer to work but only 30  minutes away.  I am a Real Estate Broker Licensed in the State of Illinois.

Auto, Bike, Train, Walk or Bus....we have it all!

additional_house_rules:
-No Smoking.

-No Drugs (including Marijuana).

-Do not engage in any criminal/ILLEGAL activities near or on the property. 

-No Parties.

-Any approved additional overnight guests must pay the extra person fee outlined on the  AirBnB profile.

-No pets.

-All food items should be stored in designated food areas and not left out, to avoid city of chicago rats and pests ordinances.

-Use kitchen freely but clean up any mess that is created, including dishes, counters, stove, microwave; no dirty dishes should be left in the sink overnight.

-If you break or damage something, please let us know and arrange for its replacement.

-Some cleaning is required before you check out. Please ensure dishes are washed, furniture that is moved is put back, and trash is thrown out. 

-The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however if you leave the place excessively dirty, with dirty dishes and garbage everywhere, that requires more cleaning, we may charge up to $150 additionally.

-Quiet hours must be observed between 12am-8am.

access: Entire apartment is yours. Laundry (washer/dryer) located in adjacent room.
description:
A friendly welcome to all  Business travelers & Tourists!


Great studio in serene jefferson park location....... 10 min from O'hare via blue line to jefferson park station.  Easy access to downtown chicago via blue line.  Ample Free street parking!

Central to everything.  Restaurants and bar close by.  
Private laundry, wifi, smart tv, netflix, direct tv.

Garden unit..newly remodeled!  Everything brand new and clean!!

There are 4 steps down leading to the unit.  
The unit itself has a locked bedroom/bathroom, a seperate locked room for kitchen, and a large closet that can also be locked.  The hallway in between leads to a washer/dryer area which can be used by the other guests in the building.  It is a common washer/dryer.  However, the apartment space/kitchen/closet is only for your private use.  No one has keys to it.

Please be aware that the ceiling height going down is a bit shorter and for those above 6 feet tall may have to be careful.  Once in the garden level, you are still able to move around freely being above 6 feet tall.

Entire apartment is yours. Laundry (washer/dryer) located in adjacent room.

Jefferson Park is close proximity to the blue line that goes straight into O'hare aiport and to the heart of downtown Chicago. All of the Chicago area Sports (Wrigley, United Center, Soldier Field) & restaurants are easily accessible.   It is also minutes from Rivers Casino, Fashion Outlets of Chicago, Donald E. Stephens Convention Center, and all of the Rosemont area restaurants/lounges.

The most convenient transportation is 4 to 5 blocks east where you will find the Jefferson Park transit center...this gives you access to the blue line train to go downtown and to go to O'hare airport.  

A few steps west at the corner of Mango & Higgins, there is a Blue line Bus stop that will take you to various places.  Please plug your destination into google maps and you will see the route.
house_rules:
-No Smoking.

-No Drugs (including Marijuana).

-Do not engage in any criminal/ILLEGAL activities near or on the property. 

-No Parties.

-Any approved additional overnight guests must pay the extra person fee outlined on the  AirBnB profile.

-No pets.

-All food items should be stored in designated food areas and not left out, to avoid city of chicago rats and pests ordinances.

-Use kitchen freely but clean up any mess that is created, including dishes, counters, stove, microwave; no dirty dishes should be left in the sink overnight.

-If you break or damage something, please let us know and arrange for its replacement.

-Some cleaning is required before you check out. Please ensure dishes are washed, furniture that is moved is put back, and trash is thrown out. 

-The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however if you leave the place excessively dirty, with dirty dishes and garbage everywhere, that requires more cleaning, we may charge up to $150 additionally.

-Quiet hours must be observed between 12am-8am.

Stephens Convention Center, and all of the Rosemont area restaurants/lounges.

description:
Studio apartment. As a new addition to the Logan Square neighborhood in Chicago, Noca Blu is one of the most luxurious apartment experiences in the area. Blending style, culture, and convenience with an unbeatable location only minutes away from the Blue Line and downtown, our apartments for rent in Chicago are here to put all the shopping, dining, and entertainment of Logan Square on your doorstep. Plus, we’re confident our pet-friendly community will easily make your dream home in Chicago.

Noca Blu brings forth all the creature comforts of home and welcomes you with an abundance of amenities, impeccable services, and inspired floor plans. From the rooftop terrace, resident lounge, and fitness center to the indoor and outdoor parking, bike storage, and in-home washers and dryers, we’ve left nothing to chance. Inside your new studio, one or two-bedroom home, more lavish features and comfort await. You’ll love the open floor plans of our apartments, full bathrooms, and soaking tubs. Not to mention the well-equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, and large walk-in closets. To make it even more convenient, our residents also enjoy an exclusive discount for furniture rentals via CORT, efficient VRF heating & cooling systems, and, in select units, high ceilings, IOTAS smart home tech or private terraces.

Find out more about our luxury apartments in Chicago’s Logan Square and make sure to set time aside and swing by for a personal tour. We’d love to show you everything Noca Blu has to offer and help you pick out the perfect home for you!

access: You will have access to the entire apartment. The shared laundry room is coin operated and located in the basement of the building.
description:
Welcome to our beautifully rehabbed 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment located in the heart of Wrigleyville. This apartment puts in you in the middle of it all! Within minutes you can walk to Wrigley Field, the Addison red line train stop, and the best restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. This apartment is perfect for family and friends looking to enjoy everything Wrigleyville and Chicago has to offer!

This 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment is a third floor walk up. located in the heart of Wrigleyville! The apartment has been recently remodeled and tastefully finished. Both of the bedrooms have queen size beds. The bathroom is located in a hallway next to the bedrooms and has a large, walk-in shower. 

The kitchen is fully stocked with everything a chef needs to prepare a meal and there is a breakfast bar with two countertop seats. The living room has comfortable furniture, a decorative fireplace, and a smart TV that provides you access to streaming services like Netflix and Hulu. The sofa in the living room is a sleeper sofa.

You will have access to the entire apartment. The shared laundry room is coin operated and located in the basement of the building.

We are off-site but nearby and available when needed!

Wrigleyville is the lively pocket in the Lakeview neighborhood that sits in the shadows of historic Wrigley Field, the home of the beloved Chicago Cubs. Wrigleyville has become a magnet for sports fans and young professionals, particularly those looking to soak up the atmosphere found in the restaurants and bars lining Clark Street, Addison Street and Sheffield Avenue.

The energy in the neighborhood changes on days and nights when there is a Cubs game. When the Cubs have a game everything bursts with energy as the neighborhood's souvenir shops, eateries and bars are often busy before, during, and after the games.

The closest L stop is Addison on the red line and it is a two minute walk from the apartment. You can access the best Chicago has to offer on the L transit system. 

There are plenty of Uber/Lyfts and taxis throughout the neighborhood as well.

If you are traveling with a car we recommend using SpotHero to help you find a parking space. Parking in the neighborhood is very difficult. Please remember that this apartment is in a large building. You will have a private 2 bedroom apartment, but you do have neighbors so please be respectful. This apartment is a third floor walk up so you will need to be able to walk up and down three flights of stairs. Lastly, there are train tracks nearby that can be loud. We provide a white noise sound machine and earplugs to mitigate the noise.

additional_house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.

description:
This vintage large 1 bedroom condo is the perfect couples Chicago getaway spot to explore Logan Square.  The family room has doors so it can easily be used as a second bedroom.  In unit washer & dryer, pack n play, highchair, and bath tub make it easier for parents traveling with little ones!  Noise machines, charging stations, black out curtains and a premium mattress mean you will sleep like a baby.  Free street parking too!

I want to ensure everyone who stays at my place feels like they are at home and can settle right in, so I provide the following amenities free of charge to all my guests!  
- High speed wireless internet is always available
- 2 - 49" TVs with Roku devices & digital antenna
- Fresh towels and linens which are professionally laundered in between guests.
- Kitchen appliances including a microwave, coffee pot with a reusable filter, tea kettle, and toaster  
- I provide artisanal coffee from a local roaster and a variety of gourmet teas.
- My place is FULLY STOCKED with all the amenities of home like eco friendly shampoo, conditioner, and body wash, paper towels, toilet paper, tissue, sponges & Method brand hand soap and dish soap.  You name it, we provide it to make you feel at home!
-The full sized kitchen is stocked with cookware, utensils, glasses, cutlery, sharp knives, cutting boards, baking sheets and all the basic tools like wine openers, cheese graters, vegetable peelers, pizza cutters, etc.  
- Hair dryer
- Ironing board and Iron
- Luggage racks and hangers
- Black out curtains
- White noise machines
- Charging Stations
- Uber and Lyft will take you just about anywhere in the city for ~ $10-$15.
- FREE to use Pack N Play and High Chair to make it easier for parents with little ones

You will have complete and private access to my condo. 24HR self check in is available via a lock box code with the keys to your unit. .

Boasting gorgeous boulevards and a constantly expanding selection of restaurants and bars, Logan Square is one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods, balancing family-friendly amenities with a thriving nightlife. Walk along Milwaukee Avenue and you'll find cocktail bars and gastropubs as well as dive bars and late night eateries, all packed with young crowds watching local bands or playing vintage arcade games. The variety of diversions present in Logan Square attracts record lovers, musicians, pinball wizards and dining aficionados to this scenic section of Chicago.

There are plenty of easy and convenient ways to get around the city from my place.  I am an 15 minute walk (8 city blocks) to the Blue Line train that runs between O'Hare International Airport (25 minute train ride) and downtown Chicago (20 minute train ride). Midway Airport is a train ride away (45 minutes). I am also near the Armitage or Fullerton bus lines. Uber and Lyft (or taxi) are easy to call and you can get most places for $10-$12. There is a Divvy bike rental station 2 blocks away. If you have a car, there is free parking on our street.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
interaction: You will have complete and private access to my condo. 24HR self check in is available via a lock box code with the keys to your unit. .
neighborhood_overview: Boasting gorgeous boulevards and a constantly expanding selection of restaurants and bars, Logan Square is one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods, balancing family-friendly amenities with a thriving nightlife. Walk along Milwaukee Avenue and you'll find cocktail bars and gastropubs as well as dive bars and late night eateries, all packed with young crowds watching local bands or playing vintage arcade games. The variety of diversions present in Logan Square attracts record lovers, musicians, pinball wizards and dining aficionados to this scenic section of Chicago.
