Our home is environmentally safe as we do not use any pesticides, heavy cleaners, or other toxic products - of course, no smoking here ...

I go jogging in our quiet neighborhood (good 1.2m loop) and take our dog River to the local playground down the street
Internet in-house and Netflix
Washer / dryer and kitchen use
Breakfast and dinner when I am available
6 Flags Park 1.5 hr drive
BBQ in back and swing for kids
Good Italian, Thai, Mexican, and Sushi nearby
Italian Expresso in the morning
metro train 5 min drive away
historical Wheaton and Glen Ellyn 5 min away
Wheaton College 12 minutes away
Gym (as my guest - usually early morning)
Ohare Airport is 30 min drive w/o traffic
description:
Enjoy this corner room with a large executive desk for working on projects while on the road.  A big comfortable bed, ample closet space, and full breakfast and dinner available for a small fee, make a great option when you come to do business in Chicago ... or when just need to get some work done in a quiet place accessible to the city.

We have three rooms for guests on Air B&B.  You can find the other ones listed as:
Quiet Room for Student or Traveler
Warm Serene Setting near the Big City

Our home in NE Chicago suburbs is a restful retreat close to the adventures in the city. 

Nearby parks are great for walks, the train is nearby to go to the city, and historic Glen Ellyn and Wheaton are great for dining and evening walks.

Our home is environmentally safe as we do not use any pesticides, heavy cleaners, or other toxic products - of course, no smoking here ...

I go jogging in our quiet neighborhood (good 1.2m loop) and take our dog River to the local playground down the street
Internet in-house and Netflix
Washer / dryer and kitchen use
Breakfast and dinner when I am available
6 Flags Park 1.5 hr drive
BBQ in back and swing for kids
Good Italian, Thai, Mexican, and Sushi nearby
Italian Expresso in the morning
metro train 5 min drive away
historical Wheaton and Glen Ellyn 5 min away
Wheaton College 12 minutes away
Gym (as my guest - usually early morning)
Ohare Airport is 30 min drive w/o traffic

Depending whose home, as much quiet or interaction as you want.
River will spend all day with you, if you want.
Hawaii 5-0 or NCIS at 9 pm weekday evenings

Older neighborhood of young families and retirees.  We have a park / school nearby for kids to enjoy.

Glen Ellyn is one of the safest neighborhoods in the area.  We are not near South Chicago and its crime challenges.  And we have three local policemen for neighbors.

You will need a car to visit local attractions and go to the metro/train station.

Uber has a real good local team here - many guests go to work each day on Uber.

If you need a early or late check-out time, please check with me. Weekends will not be a problem; weekdays we will try to work out...

We like quiet after 10 pm / before 6 am.

Note I have two other rooms listed on B&B.

If you are not comfortable with dogs, you might not appreciate River - she is a well-trained golden retriever, and loves to interact with all our guests.

We are a Christian family, I (Mike)  am a military veteran, and while my girls are traveling the world this summer, I decided to try Air B&B at our home. 

I am fine with late arrivals and early departures, as long as we don't wake up the other guests.

Nice cozy place, away from tourist trap in one of Chicago's most unique neighborhoods.

Guests have access to the entire house. Also have laundry facilities in basement area with commercial washer and dryers for nominal fee.

Free parking on the street.

I am reachable via text or phone call at anytime during your visit.

Very nice cozy neighborhood feel. Best way to experience Chicago and get away from bustle and bustle of downtown, but still VERY close by. 

Easy access directly from the airport.

Bike, bus and train access. Always availability with ride share (Uber or Lyft) as well.

access:
The living room and outside deck on first floor.
Please make sure the Front Gate is locked at all times. Simply reach through the grate to open or close the lock from the outside.
description:
This is a small cozy bedroom on the 2nd floor. No food or drinks are provided ever. This is not a bed and breakfast.

We are RIGHT NEXT TO THE TRAIN!

We are designated as Super Hosts by airbnb and have had over 1000, guests.

We guarantee enclosed, safe parking on the premises for one car if there is no parking on the street. There is no charge.

* High speed cable internet: Wifi
* Key pad entry, No keys needed.
* Hundreds of pieces of free literature, maps etc. about the city. 
* Central Heat/AC
* Towels, Sheets, Soap provided
* Ironing board
* Washer and Dryer
* Hair Dryer

A small but cozy room, One of 4 to 6 bedrooms available in a beautiful single family home. The room is small for two people but you are welcome to use the out door deck and living room.

Queen size bed with large closet, shared bathroom. 

Husband and Wife occupy the home in Uptown Entertainment District. 

Always room for at least one car in private driveway if there is a problem with parking o the street,  though safe parking on the street is usually not a problem except temporarily for a few hours when there are major concerts.

Steps from the Red Line train going downtown and to Evanston. Steps from, Aragon, Riviera music venues, 1 block from the famous Green Mill Jazz lounge, minutes from Wrigley Field baseball stadium, Boystown, Andersonville and Lincoln Square.

Next to the famous Green Mill Music and Poetry venue, across the street from the Aragon theater and Riviera which hosts major musical touring groups. Several theatrical stages in the area including the Annoyance Theater home to many current Film and TV "stars".  You might want to take in a play. Children must be 8 years of age or older.
Excellent Sushi, Indian, Persian, Ethiopian and all manner of Asian restaurants within walking distance. All this in the most diverse neighborhood in Chicago. People from all over the world can be found in Uptown. Owners of the home are graphic artist and musician with music studio in basement.

Fluent English, Spanish and Polish are spoken in the house.

The living room and outside deck on first floor.
Please make sure the Front Gate is locked at all times. Simply reach through the grate to open or close the lock from the outside.

As much or as little as the guest requires.

The neighborhood is incredibly diverse and is known as the most diverse in Chicago with all races, income levels, lifestyles and nationalities. You may see a stretch limo with President Barak Obama coming out to celebrate his birthday in  2013 at the Aragon across the street from our home, or a flesh eating zombie, coming out of a limo to celebrate their 40th birthday at the Uptown Underground.

The train that takes you everywhere in the city is 1/2 block away and runs 24/7 every 5 minutes.
house_rules:
PLEASE DO
- be respectful of personal belongings,
- make yourself at home
- go out and enjoy the neighborhood
- call or text us if you have any questions
-We do not allow guests from the outside to come into the house without prior consultation.

ALWAYS MAKE SURE THE FRONT GATE IS CLOSED AND LOCKED.

Do not clean stainless steel appliances a special cleaner is needed, otherwise scratches will appear. 





Common sense required.

Empty the garbage bag if it is full in the black garbage bin.  Let us know your arrival and departure time so we can plan accordingly.  Thanks

access: The apartment has two entrances separate from our living space.  Note:  it is below our living space, and you may hear us walking above.
description:
1 bedroom basement apartment close to Goose Island, United Center, Pitchfork, bus stops, Divvy bike share station, Green & Blue Line trains. Street parking available.

Enjoy local hospitality.  Disfruten de hospitalidad local.  The in-law apartment is equipped with coffee maker.   Enjoy the equipped kitchen or take in the local restaurants.  The bedroom has very comfortable king bed.  Our sofa converts into a full size bed.

The apartment has two entrances separate from our living space.  Note:  it is below our living space, and you may hear us walking above.

We will be glad to help orient guests to city amenities.   As a former Chicago Greeter program volunteer, I can help you decide what city attractions you shouldn't miss.  Having grown up in Puerto Rico, I speak Spanish fluently.  Hablo, escribo y leo en español.

Close to Grand Avenue Design District.  Plenty of restaurants nearby.  Ukrainian Institute of Modern Art less than two miles away.  Rush, University of Illinois, and Veterans Administration hospitals are less than 10 minute drive.  The Lurie Children's, Rehabilitation Institute, and Northwestern Memorial Hospital are a less than 30 minutes away.    Several Michelin rated restaurants nearby.

Divvy bike sharing station and bus routes a couple of blocks away.  Close to hip Bucktown and Wicker Park.  Green and Blue Line train stations are a short bus ride away.  Close to two major expressways.

Generally, off street parking is available.  Please note parking restrictions due to winter weather, street cleaning, and new home construction.  No smoking and inside the house.

Empty the garbage bag if it is full in the black garbage bin.  Let us know your arrival and departure time so we can plan accordingly.  Thanks

.

additional_house_rules:
***This is a SHARED ROOM and roommates are to be expected. The room is not Gender Exclusive, you roommate(s) could be Male or Female. We kindly ask you to pack as lightly as possible as space will be limited***

***Surveillance cameras are present at each entrance to the home, in the kitchen, living room, and stairwell. All cameras are on at all times.*** 

Check-In Rules:
Unfortunately, I will not always be able to personally meet all guests at their desired check in time.

If I'm unable to meet you, I'll provide the Digital Door Lock Code with very detailed instructions for entry which will be messaged through Airbnb messenger at your Check-In time. You'll be given instant access to the building whenever you arrive! Please TAKE YOUR SHOES OFF upon entering the home. 

Food and Beverages:
There is absolutely NO consumption of food or beverages (excluding water) outside of the kitchen, kitchen bar, and dining room.

All food and beverages in the fridge and kitchen cabinets belong to other guests and your host. Refrain from taking food/beverages that were not brought in or purchased by you. Coffee, creamer, and sugar on the coffee bar in the kitchen are complimentary and you may have as much of it as you'd like. 

Guest Policy:
"Guest" constitutes any person entering the property, whether spending the night or only visiting. Unverified, unauthorized guests are not allowed on the premises. If you'd like to have a guest during your stay, your guest MUST be verified and announced through the AirBnb messenger and approval of this guest must be explicitly given by us, the hosts. Violation of this rule will result in immediate cancellation of your reservation and termination of your stay. 

Mail:
Please notify the host if you want to have Mail/Parcels shipped to you during your stay.

Quiet Hours:
Quiet Hours at the residence are between the hours of 10pm and 7am Sunday-Thursday and 12am and 7am on Friday-Saturday.

This is a Shared Space with many Travelers all visiting Chicago for a different purpose.  Having common courtesy is more than enough to fulfill this rule.  If you're a Late Night personality, please respect those waking up early for work.  If you're up at the crack of dawn, please get ready as quietly as possible as to not disturb those still asleep.

Smoking:
There is absolutely no smoking inside of the building.  This includes Electronic Cigarettes and all other forms of Tobacco.

Travelers are more than welcome to Smoke outside of the building.  


Weapons:
Absolutely NO WEAPONS of any sort are allowed inside of the building.  This includes Firearms, Knives, and anything else that can be used in a malicious manner.  Host(s) will have Final Say in what constitutes as a weapon.

Violence:
There will be no violence of any sort tolerated inside of the building.  This includes Physical Violence, Verbal (Arguing, Threats, Intimidation, etc.), and any sort of behavior that causes another person in the house to feel upset. 

‘Common Sense’ Rule:
As this is a Shared Building, guests are expected to act in a way which is both Respectful and Inviting to everyone else sharing the space.   Actions which are deemed to have a Negative Impact on the overall experience of the other travelers will not be tolerated.  A few examples of this would be:  Leaving Dishes unwashed in the sink, being excessively messy or loud, or just having a negative, unwelcoming attitude.  If Behavior is causing other Travelers to feel uncomfortable, we will ask you to make necessary corrections, if these corrections are not made, we will terminate your stay.

Illegal Activity:
Any action which is in violation of any law within the city of Chicago and the state of Illinois is grounds for instant Termination


Check-Out Rules:
Check out is at 10AM, which is when the cleaning crew arrives. 
All guests that FAIL to vacate the premises prior to the 10AM check out will be charged $50 - No Exceptions!

access:
You and your guests will have access to the following areas:
	
- Bedroom 
- Bathrooms - Shared with all Travelers
- Kitchen / Dining Room Area - Shared with all Travelers
- Living Room Area (Couches & TV) - Shared with all Travelers
description:
*** SHARED ROOM *** 

Located near I-290 and the Blue Line this shared room is perfect for any Tourist or Business Traveler looking to explore Chicago.
		
Queen Bed (2 Guests)
65" Smart TV in Common Area
Fireplace 
Wi-Fi / Cable TV / Netflix 
Complimentary Coffee Bar
New, stainless steel appliances: Stove, Fridge, Microwave
2 Bathrooms stocked with Essentials
Minutes away from Popular Tourist Areas, CTA Public Transit, and various local attractions

Located near I-290 and the Blue Line this shared room is perfect for any Tourist or Business Traveler looking to explore Chicago.
	
Queen Bed (2 Guests)
65" Smart TV in Common Area
Fireplace 
Wi-Fi / Cable TV / Netflix 
Complimentary Coffee Bar
New, stainless steel appliances: Stove, Fridge, Microwave
2 Bathrooms stocked with Essentials
Minutes away from Popular Tourist Areas, CTA Public Transit, and various local attractions
Room Specifications:
- Comfortable Queen Mattress (Hampton & Rhodes HR 200)
- Closet Space to hang your Wardrobe
- Lighting Fast Wi-Fi Internet 
	
Bathroom:
- 2 Shared Washrooms for all Travelers 
- Essentials Provided:
   - Toilet Paper 
   - Shampoo / Conditioner 
   - Soap / Body Wash 
   - Towels 
   - Hair Dryer 
   - Iron 
   - Ironing Board

Office:
This House contains a few shared “Study Areas” perfect for any Business Traveler, Student, or Tourist on the go!  
Comfortable living room and dining room areas and lightning fast Wi-Fi provide the perfect oasis to stay on top of your busy life!

Living/Dining Area:
The ‘Family Room’ contains a comfortable sofa and love-seat, a 65” Flat Screen Television, and a fireplace to share a few laughs with your fellow travelers!   

Kitchen:
New, stainless steel appliances (Stove, Microwave, Refrigerator) and cooking utensils will enable you to enjoy the luxuries of home while you're on the road!
A Coffee / Tea Kiosk will enable you to have your morning beverage of choice hot and ready to go for you each and every morning!
Dining Room Table with modern decor overlooking the fireplace and TV so you can always stay connected!

Laundry:
***Only available for reservations longer than one week***
Fully-Functional Washer & Dryer are located in the Basement. Laundry facilities are available only upon request and while a staff member and/or host are present.   
Laundry Detergent & Fabric Softener are not provided. 

Parking:
Parking on the street, directly in front of the house, is unfortunately not permitted. If you are bringing a vehicle, please ensure you are legally parked. 

Locks:
The Listing has a Digital Door Lock. The Door Code will be provided at 3PM on your Check-In date.

You and your guests will have access to the following areas:
	
- Bedroom 
- Bathrooms - Shared with all Travelers
- Kitchen / Dining Room Area - Shared with all Travelers
- Living Room Area (Couches & TV) - Shared with all Travelers

I love to meet new people, but due to the nature of my schedule, our interactions could be minimal.

I will, however, be on location in the event that you need anything during your stay, and I am always a Text, Phone Call, or AirBnb Message away to ensure that all of my Guests have an Amazing, 5-Star Experience!

Chicago Blue Line:
	
Located right on I-290 & only a mile away from Chicago's 'Blue Line', this location is perfect for anyone looking to take in the Sights of Chicago!  

Whether you're going Downtown to check out Navy Pier & Millennium Park, enjoy a Concert or Game at the United Center, or head to O'Hare International Airport to continue your journey; you'll always be just a few minutes away!

If you choose to spend an Evening around the House, you'll enjoy a diverse neighborhood with various options in terms of Shops & Dining.

Distance To Nearest Public Transit:

Bus: 0.3 mi (3 Blocks)
Train: 1 mi (Blue Line: Forest Park)

Want to know how far your Destination is from my Place?  Enter Harrison St. & 17th Ave. into Goo.gle Maps, then type in your Destination.  You'll see pretty accurate Travel Times whether you're driving, taking the bus, using the CTA system, or walking.  This will also take into account real-time traffic to give you an even more accurate estimate!

Travel Distance to Chicago Landmarks:
- MDW International Airport = 12 mi.
- ORD International Airport = 10 mi. 
- Union Station = 12 mi.  
- United Center = 10 mi.
- U.S. Cellular Field = 14 mi.
- Wrigley Field = 19 mi.
- Soldier Field = 15 mi.

In the event you need to access and use the Laundry Facility, please contact the host.
house_rules:
***This is a SHARED ROOM and roommates are to be expected. The room is not Gender Exclusive, you roommate(s) could be Male or Female. We kindly ask you to pack as lightly as possible as space will be limited***

***Surveillance cameras are present at each entrance to the home, in the kitchen, living room, and stairwell. All cameras are on at all times.*** 

Check-In Rules:
Unfortunately, I will not always be able to personally meet all guests at their desired check in time.

If I'm unable to meet you, I'll provide the Digital Door Lock Code with very detailed instructions for entry which will be messaged through Airbnb messenger at your Check-In time. You'll be given instant access to the building whenever you arrive! Please TAKE YOUR SHOES OFF upon entering the home. 

Food and Beverages:
There is absolutely NO consumption of food or beverages (excluding water) outside of the kitchen, kitchen bar, and dining room.

All food and beverages in the fridge and kitchen cabinets belong to other guests and your host. Refrain from taking food/beverages that were not brought in or purchased by you. Coffee, creamer, and sugar on the coffee bar in the kitchen are complimentary and you may have as much of it as you'd like. 

Guest Policy:
"Guest" constitutes any person entering the property, whether spending the night or only visiting. Unverified, unauthorized guests are not allowed on the premises. If you'd like to have a guest during your stay, your guest MUST be verified and announced through the AirBnb messenger and approval of this guest must be explicitly given by us, the hosts. Violation of this rule will result in immediate cancellation of your reservation and termination of your stay. 

Mail:
Please notify the host if you want to have Mail/Parcels shipped to you during your stay.

Quiet Hours:
Quiet Hours at the residence are between the hours of 10pm and 7am Sunday-Thursday and 12am and 7am on Friday-Saturday.

This is a Shared Space with many Travelers all visiting Chicago for a different purpose.  Having common courtesy is more than enough to fulfill this rule.  If you're a Late Night personality, please respect those waking up early for work.  If you're up at the crack of dawn, please get ready as quietly as possible as to not disturb those still asleep.

Smoking:
There is absolutely no smoking inside of the building.  This includes Electronic Cigarettes and all other forms of Tobacco.

Travelers are more than welcome to Smoke outside of the building.  


Weapons:
Absolutely NO WEAPONS of any sort are allowed inside of the building.  This includes Firearms, Knives, and anything else that can be used in a malicious manner.  Host(s) will have Final Say in what constitutes as a weapon.

Violence:
There will be no violence of any sort tolerated inside of the building.  This includes Physical Violence, Verbal (Arguing, Threats, Intimidation, etc.), and any sort of behavior that causes another person in the house to feel upset. 

‘Common Sense’ Rule:
As this is a Shared Building, guests are expected to act in a way which is both Respectful and Inviting to everyone else sharing the space.   Actions which are deemed to have a Negative Impact on the overall experience of the other travelers will not be tolerated.  A few examples of this would be:  Leaving Dishes unwashed in the sink, being excessively messy or loud, or just having a negative, unwelcoming attitude.  If Behavior is causing other Travelers to feel uncomfortable, we will ask you to make necessary corrections, if these corrections are not made, we will terminate your stay.

Illegal Activity:
Any action which is in violation of any law within the city of Chicago and the state of Illinois is grounds for instant Termination


Check-Out Rules:
Check out is at 10AM, which is when the cleaning crew arrives. 
All guests that FAIL to vacate the premises prior to the 10AM check out will be charged $50 - No Exceptions!

access: The Basement and it’s common area
description:
We are located walking distance from the lake. The metro rail and bus is close by, we are like 15+ minutes away from downtown Chicago. 

Great for joggers, Chicago's Lake front biking trail is a breathtaking scene to enjoy while working out.

The basement has its own entrance and bathroom, which is shared with other guests. There is no kitchen, there is a microwave, hot plate and mini fridge, for guests use.

The tv area is shared with other guests.

The Basement and it’s common area

I am available if guests need me on request

Quiet one way street

The parking is street parking no permits required and it’s free

Please keep noise to a minimum after 10 pm to be considerate of the household and other guests. 

Please leave shoes at the door.

description:
Cozy studio suite in a quiet part of town. This space is located in the lower level of a Bungalow house.  I reside just above the unit. Space includes a kitchenette, private bathroom and plenty of parking in the area.  Quick access to trendy neighborhood Logan Square and direct bus to Blue Line Trains within walking distance.  Bed is queen size and you will need to use stairs to access the space.  Please send a request to stay!

I live above space and can be contacted via text message for any needs/requests.  You will have access to unit though back entrance and I will meet you to hand off keys.

Located just west of Logan Square  and Avondale where you will find many restaurants, bars and retail.  Within walking distance is a great breakfast diner, Cozy Corner Cafe.

located minutes to buses that will take you directly to CTA Blue Line train.

description:
Vintage 3 bedroom 1 bath apartment in heart of Ukrainian Village historical district. Unique layout, roomy living space with 23 windows, original woodwork throughout, and wood burning fireplace. Walk to restaurants, shops, cafes, and public transportation.

1st floor apartment and small courtyard in back.

I am just a phone call away.

Walkable neighborhood. Just around the corner is a small Amish grocery and Bite Cafe for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Many historical churches, galleries, museums, all nearby.

Busses and Blue line get you anywhere in Chicago. Divvy Bike Rental and Scooter rentals nearby and another way to tour the neighborhoods near by, lakefront, and downtown.
house_rules:
No pets/no animals for health and safety
10pm quiet hours
All guests must be registered on reservation, adults, children, infants
No shoes in apartment, please bring slippers

access: The guests have their own entrance, for a maximum feeling of privacy.  Guest bedrooms are downstairs, and our bedrooms are upstairs, making a very comfortable, enjoyable experience. 1 bedroom has a private bathroom, 2 bedrooms share a spacious bathroom.  (Everything is very clean!)  The kitchenette is available for storing groceries and using electrical appliances (no stove).  We also have a dining space and living space on the downstairs level for comfortable experiences.
description:
Our modern home is clean, spacious, private, and friendly.  We are 1 block from the Red Line, and steps from exciting shopping, bars, and restaurants.  Location is key! And parking is free! Included in the room is wifi, kitchen use, cable TV, etc.

Our home is cleaned daily!

We have 3 bedrooms we rent to students and travelers. Our guests are all amazing and get along great while having as much privacy as they need. Bedroom 1 and Bedroom 3 share a bathroom. Bedroom 2 has its own.

Our home is in the BEST location of Chicago: Edgewater is trendy, safe, and sightly.  Our home is very modern; Ligia is an interior decorator and Brazilian chef.  We own a duplex apartment.  We live on the first floor and host students and guests in the garden level unit.  We have 3 bedrooms in our garden level unit for rent.  Our bedrooms are furnished and kept very clean. One bathroom is private (Room 2) and one bathroom is shared (Room 1 & Room 3).  The bathroom is newly renovated and absolutely beautiful with a Stand Up shower and all modern features. Kept Sparkling Clean with daily Cleaning provided. Although we usually keep our upstairs kitchen private, we do maintain a shared kitchenette for the guests in the garden level unit.  The kitchenette is modern and newly renovated. We provide a guest friendly experience with electric cooktop stoves, large refrigerator,  plenty of counter space and a beautiful, clean eat-in kitchen. There is cupboard space for food storage.  Included in the room is cable TV, free internet access, free laundry, and a/c.  We live upstairs and provide our guests with privacy as well as a hospitable environment that is very friendly and informative.  Our guests are very friendly, respectful, clean, and courteous.  All our guests share the guest living space together, though mostly they are either in their room or not home.

Our amenities are great, our rooms and space is exceptional for all, as you will experience a safe, clean, private stay worthy of the highest ratings. Freshly cleaned sheets, daily cleaning, fresh fruit, coffees and teas, purified waters, coca cola, stand up shower, modern bathroom and kitchenette, new appliances, free laundry use, big bedroom with closet, TV with high speed wifi private view,  total privacy, separate entry, comfortable new mattress. This is one of the highest validated Airbnbs on the market.

The guests have their own entrance, for a maximum feeling of privacy.  Guest bedrooms are downstairs, and our bedrooms are upstairs, making a very comfortable, enjoyable experience. 1 bedroom has a private bathroom, 2 bedrooms share a spacious bathroom.  (Everything is very clean!)  The kitchenette is available for storing groceries and using electrical appliances (no stove).  We also have a dining space and living space on the downstairs level for comfortable experiences.

We are a loving family who enjoy hosting guests from all over the world.  We welcome guests with hospitality and friendliness, share city touring advice, and maintain a fun and warm household.  We have been renting our rooms for 7 years now, to both long-term and short-term students and guests.  Our home is clean, BEAUTIFUL, and the private kitchenette, baths, and living area really add to our unique atmosphere.  We are a family that creates privacy and relaxation for our guests.  We live on the upstairs level, and are frequently home to provide support when needed.

Our location is everything!   We are 3 blocks from a great beach! And 1 block from the train!   Edgewater has been booming over the past few years!  There are many great restaurants, pubs, and shops in the area.

The train is 1 block away and runs 24 hours, making our home a great location for staying while touring the city.  Bus routes are spread all throughout the neighborhood, and it feels that our home is located in the middle of everything!  That being said, our home is quiet and private; once inside you forget that you are steps away from bustling activity.

Free neighborhood street parking!

Guests share the space.  To ensure peace and relaxation, our guests are calm, courteous, and respectful to the environment.

In order to maintain a safe environment for our guests, we do not allow visitors.  

Smoking is not allowed inside. We prefer non-smoker guests.

Pets are not allowed.

description:
Charming apartment in awesome neighborhood! The apartment building used to be a hotel in the 1900s, now converted to apartment units. The major perks of this unit is the surrounding area for shopping, restaurants, bars, proximity to the lake, and Diversey Harbor. I have board games and a piano if you are interested. There is a washer/dryer unit in the building.  I’m happy to answer any questions and give you recommendations on where to go.

Space is small, but charming and perfect. There is an AC unit which is highly effective.  The kitchen is COMICALLY small, but it has everything you could possibly need. I have clean towels, bedsheets, and shampoo/conditioner/body wash available for you.

You will have the space to yourselves.  There is a key box installed on location so check-in is quite flexible.  Both the host and cohost live about an hour away, so we ask for a little flexibility in return in turning the space over but we’ve been highly successful with in meeting guests’ needs.  If we are in the area, we’re glad to meet you at the door and introduce you to the space personally!

This neighborhood is buzzing with activity and very hip. Every shop you can think of. Starbucks and Stans Donuts is right around the corner. Chipotle even closer! The lake and Diversey Harbor is just a 10 minute walk away. You will also be close to the Red and Brown train lines if you are interested in taking public transportation.

You are in walking distance of a lot! I would also recommend the Divvy bikes (Chicago bike rental). The red and brown train lines are a 12 minute walk away.  There are several bus lines immediately in the proximity.  I would also recommend the ride share services Lyft and Uber.  Using google maps in particular, will point you in the right direction for public transit.

There is a pitcher in the refrigerator that provides filtered water that is regularly cleaned.  Please do not drink unfiltered Chicago tap water.  

If at all possible, please avoid the large closet in the bedroom area which contains personal items.  BUT...if you really have needs to hang clothing items please feel free.

The towel under the AC unit is there to absorb any condensation.  All is well there.

Continue to note that the kitchen is COMICALLY small.  Such is the Chicago way.  ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

access:
Parking: We have 2 free parking behind the building, which is partially gated, and you can access to the apartment from parking. Parking area also has security cameras.
Entertainment: The apartment comes with free Wi-Fi and Netflix service with 55”smart 4k TV.
Accommodation: The Apartment has 2 bedrooms, which can accommodate 4 adults, and we also have additional sofa bed plus one roll over bed that can accommodate two additional guests.
Heating & Cooling: The apartment has central heating/cooling system with nest thermostat.
Towels & Supplies: Towels and toiletries are provided in the bathroom. A hair dryer, iron and iron board are also available for your use. Other cleaning supplies are available under the kitchen sink.
Cooking: We have provided you with basic cooking tools, spices, tea and coffee. Please do all washing up and leave the kitchen tidy upon departure.
Smoking: This is a non-smoking apartment inside.
description:
Nice house to live

2 Bedrooms 1 Bathroom with full kitchen
Welcome to Chicago! This luxurious 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom apartment is newly renovated which is located in Chicago's south side, 10 blocks from University of Chicago and Museum of Science. You'll be staying in the upstairs unit of a photography studio own by us. You will be staying right opposite of Starbuck and Bank of America.

We think our apartment is warm and contemporary with open dining and living space. This apartment was newly renovated which includes all new furniture’s and appliances. We use a professional cleaning service to keep the apartment fresh and tidy.

Parking: We have 2 free parking behind the building, which is partially gated, and you can access to the apartment from parking. Parking area also has security cameras.
Entertainment: The apartment comes with free Wi-Fi and Netflix service with 55”smart 4k TV.
Accommodation: The Apartment has 2 bedrooms, which can accommodate 4 adults, and we also have additional sofa bed plus one roll over bed that can accommodate two additional guests.
Heating & Cooling: The apartment has central heating/cooling system with nest thermostat.
Towels & Supplies: Towels and toiletries are provided in the bathroom. A hair dryer, iron and iron board are also available for your use. Other cleaning supplies are available under the kitchen sink.
Cooking: We have provided you with basic cooking tools, spices, tea and coffee. Please do all washing up and leave the kitchen tidy upon departure.
Smoking: This is a non-smoking apartment inside.

access:
Please make yourself at home in this gorgeous apartment; our place is yours and only yours during your stay. We do ask that you respect our neighbors by keeping noise to a reasonable level. 

In addition to the apartment, the community amenities include an outdoor pool, picnic area, fitness center, cyber cafe, game room with foosball and billiards, resident lounge, on-site parking, and more. There’s even a high-tech conference room with PC and Mac computers!
description:
You can’t find luxury and convenience like this in the city! This spacious 2BR/2BA is near Chicago’s biggest corporate headquarters, high-end shopping, and fantastic restaurants of the upscale Oak Brook suburb. This brand-new development boasts luxurious amenities like a gym and resort-style outdoor pool. The community also has 24/7 security and free parking. Get the best of urban living and residential comfort just a short drive from Downtown Chicago and O’Hare.

After a busy day of meetings or retail therapy, retreat to your own swanky residence in the new Lakeside Village of Oak Brook community. Enjoy being one of the development’s first tenants and among the lucky few Chicago visitors to enjoy perks like a refreshing outdoor pool and state-of-the-art fitness center. You also get to park for free - you won’t find that Downtown!

This 2-bedroom apartment can comfortably sleep 6, with two private bedrooms and plenty of space. One bedroom features a queen-size bed, and the other bedroom has 2 queen-size beds. If you did some shopping at the upscale Oakbrook Center (7-minute drive away), home to stores like Neiman Marcus and Nordstrom, you’ll find plenty of closet space to store your finds.

Two bathrooms ensure everybody has privacy with modern fixtures worthy of a five-star hotel. For your comfort and convenience, we provide all towels, linens, toiletries, a hair dryer, and an iron. 

If you’re traveling on business, maybe to visit the nearby corporate headquarters of Microsoft, Ace Hardware, or Kellogg’s, you’ll be happy to know the apartment includes homey amenities like a full kitchen and a spacious living room. Cook up some breakfast in the kitchen, which features modern appliances and all the dishes, serveware, and utensils you’d need. And when the day is done, kick back and relax on the couch.

Or if your Windy City trip is a family vacation or getaway with friends, the apartment is the perfect place to spend time with loved ones. Hang out around the dining table with some Chicago craft beers and deep dish pizza, or just chat for hours in the living room.

Families love our residential location for the quiet, safe atmosphere - the community has on-site security 24/7 and you won’t hear any of the typical city noises. And if you’re in town for a social event, you’ll be in close proximity to the numerous wedding venues, banquet halls, golf courses, country clubs, and restaurants of Oak Brook.

Besides the apartment itself, you’ll have access to the spectacular amenities of the Lakeside Village development. In the summer, take advantage of the sparkling outdoor pool and the picnic area, and in the winter, cozy up to the fireplace in the resident lounge or get some exercise in the fitness center.

Please make yourself at home in this gorgeous apartment; our place is yours and only yours during your stay. We do ask that you respect our neighbors by keeping noise to a reasonable level. 

In addition to the apartment, the community amenities include an outdoor pool, picnic area, fitness center, cyber cafe, game room with foosball and billiards, resident lounge, on-site parking, and more. There’s even a high-tech conference room with PC and Mac computers!

We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.

Just east of Downtown Chicago, the upscale suburb of Oak Brook is known for its rolling golf courses, high-end shopping, and concentration of corporate headquarters that draw visitors from around the world.

Within a short drive of the apartment, golfers can go for holes-in-one at Butterfield Country Club, Butler National Golf Club, Chicago Highlands Club, Fresh Meadow Golf Club, and more. These country clubs are also known for their banquet and social event facilities.

Golf courses aren’t the only places to relax around here; don’t miss the beautiful Morton Arboretum, known for hiking and biking trails and summertime picnic spots. The Danada Forest Preserve is home to lush parkland and the Danada House, a popular wedding venue. Craving a delicious meal? Don’t miss Oak Brook’s impressive dining scene, which features high-end steakhouses like Michael Jordan’s Restaurant and The Capital Grille.

When the Windy City weather takes a turn, head inside to the plethora of leisure attractions in the Oak Brook area. Shopaholics from around the Chicago metro head to the Oakbrook Center for stores like Restoration Hardware, Apple, and Louis Vuitton. It’s anchored by Neiman Marcus, Nordstrom, Macy’s, and Sears. In addition to the AMC Theatre at this mall, movie buffs can also catch the latest blockbusters at the AMC Dine-In at Yorktown Center, about 5 minutes from the apartment by car.

Oak Brook also means business; a plethora of national and global corporations have headquarters here. The head offices of Kellogg’s, RedBox, Ace Hardware, Microsoft, and more are within a few minutes’ drive.

Of course, no Chicago trip is complete without a selfie in front of the Bean or a slice of deep dish pizza. If you’re heading into Downtown Chi-Town, our apartment has easy freeway access, which makes accessing the city center a breeze.

While taking the L train is the best way to get around Downtown, we recommend driving to get to the highlights of Oak Brook. The apartment has free, secure parking - as does nearly every business, restaurant, and venue in Oak Brook.

If you’re flying into Chi-Town, we recommend renting a car and driving to the apartment. We’re a short drive from both O’Hare International Airport (about 20 minutes) and Midway (about 25 minutes).

Downtown Chicago is about a 30-minute drive from the apartment, depending on traffic. Keep in mind that traffic may increase during rush hour. If you’re heading into town for drinks, Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro.

This apartment is in a building full of other units. Though none of the living spaces are shared, you may see your friendly neighbors coming and going. 

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.

Within a short drive of the apartment, golfers can go for holes-in-one at Butterfield Country Club, Butler National Golf Club, Chicago Highlands Club, Fresh Meadow Golf Club, and more. These country clubs are also known for their banquet and social event facilities.

Golf courses aren’t the only places to relax around here; don’t miss the beautiful Morton Arboretum, known for hiking and biking trails and summertime picnic spots. The Danada Forest Preserve is home to lush parkland and the Danada House, a popular wedding venue. Craving a delicious meal? Don’t miss Oak Brook’s impressive dining scene, which features high-end steakhouses like Michael Jordan’s Restaurant and The Capital Grille.

When the Windy City weather takes a turn, head inside to the plethora of leisure attractions in the Oak Brook area. Shopaholics from around the Chicago metro head to the Oakbrook Center for stores like Restoration Hardware, Apple, and Louis Vuitton. It’s anchored by Neiman Marcus, Nordstrom, Macy’s, and Sears. In addition to the AMC Theatre at this mall, movie buffs can also catch the latest blockbusters at the AMC Dine-In at Yorktown Center, about 5 minutes from the apartment by car.

Oak Brook also means business; a plethora of national and global corporations have headquarters here. The head offices of Kellogg’s, RedBox, Ace Hardware, Microsoft, and more are within a few minutes’ drive.

Of course, no Chicago trip is complete without a selfie in front of the Bean or a slice of deep dish pizza. If you’re heading into Downtown Chi-Town, our apartment has easy freeway access, which makes accessing the city center a breeze.
notes:
This apartment is in a building full of other units. Though none of the living spaces are shared, you may see your friendly neighbors coming and going. 

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.
space:
After a busy day of meetings or retail therapy, retreat to your own swanky residence in the new Lakeside Village of Oak Brook community. Enjoy being one of the development’s first tenants and among the lucky few Chicago visitors to enjoy perks like a refreshing outdoor pool and state-of-the-art fitness center. You also get to park for free - you won’t find that Downtown!

This 2-bedroom apartment can comfortably sleep 6, with two private bedrooms and plenty of space. One bedroom features a queen-size bed, and the other bedroom has 2 queen-size beds. If you did some shopping at the upscale Oakbrook Center (7-minute drive away), home to stores like Neiman Marcus and Nordstrom, you’ll find plenty of closet space to store your finds.

Two bathrooms ensure everybody has privacy with modern fixtures worthy of a five-star hotel. For your comfort and convenience, we provide all towels, linens, toiletries, a hair dryer, and an iron. 

If you’re traveling on business, maybe to visit the nearby corporate headquarters of Microsoft, Ace Hardware, or Kellogg’s, you’ll be happy to know the apartment includes homey amenities like a full kitchen and a spacious living room. Cook up some breakfast in the kitchen, which features modern appliances and all the dishes, serveware, and utensils you’d need. And when the day is done, kick back and relax on the couch.

Or if your Windy City trip is a family vacation or getaway with friends, the apartment is the perfect place to spend time with loved ones. Hang out around the dining table with some Chicago craft beers and deep dish pizza, or just chat for hours in the living room.

Families love our residential location for the quiet, safe atmosphere - the community has on-site security 24/7 and you won’t hear any of the typical city noises. And if you’re in town for a social event, you’ll be in close proximity to the numerous wedding venues, banquet halls, golf courses, country clubs, and restaurants of Oak Brook.

Besides the apartment itself, you’ll have access to the spectacular amenities of the Lakeside Village development. In the summer, take advantage of the sparkling outdoor pool and the picnic area, and in the winter, cozy up to the fireplace in the resident lounge or get some exercise in the fitness center.
summary: You can’t find luxury and convenience like this in the city! This spacious 2BR/2BA is near Chicago’s biggest corporate headquarters, high-end shopping, and fantastic restaurants of the upscale Oak Brook suburb. This brand-new development boasts luxurious amenities like a gym and resort-style outdoor pool. The community also has 24/7 security and free parking. Get the best of urban living and residential comfort just a short drive from Downtown Chicago and O’Hare.
transit:
While taking the L train is the best way to get around Downtown, we recommend driving to get to the highlights of Oak Brook. The apartment has free, secure parking - as does nearly every business, restaurant, and venue in Oak Brook.

If you’re flying into Chi-Town, we recommend renting a car and driving to the apartment. We’re a short drive from both O’Hare International Airport (about 20 minutes) and Midway (about 25 minutes).

Downtown Chicago is about a 30-minute drive from the apartment, depending on traffic. Keep in mind that traffic may increase during rush hour. If you’re heading into town for drinks, Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro.

access: Your bedroom, bathroom, living room, dining room and kitchen are available for your stay.
description:
Spacious and bright with soaring seven-foot windows that actually have an amazing view of downtown, particularly the John Hancock Building. This apartment is vintage Chicago architectural charm. The place is comfortable, tidy, and efficiently located on Ashland Avenue in the heart of ultra-hip Wicker Park; Steps away from a thriving area full of popular restaurants, cafes, boutiques, concert venues, nightlife, etc.. There are convenient public transportation and Uber options from here also.

It is an expansive, high ceiling, three bedroom apartment. Everything you need for a comfortable stay is provided - full size beds, pillows, blankets, towels, toiletries, hair dryer, kitchen, and tv & wifi are all accessible to enhance your stay.

Your bedroom, bathroom, living room, dining room and kitchen are available for your stay.

I, or my co-host, Nat, am/is available throughout your stay to answer questions that you may have; or recommend local attractions, dining, or nightlife.

Wicker Park is famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.

The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour.

Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up shop to satisfy the on-trend crowds.”

The apartment is located just 0.4 mile from the Blue Line Damen Station (connecting to O’Hare airport) which travels through much of the city. The “9” Ashland Street Bus Stop is one block away - running north and south. Additionally, six blocks away is the Kennedy Expressway Division Street Exit. It is only three miles to downtown Chicago (10 minute Uber ride).

Unfortunately, the apartment is not handicap accessible.

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- In-suite laundry
- Fully-equipped kitchen
- Private desk

South Loop highlights
- Walkability score: 96
- 4 minute walk to Yolk (best breakfast spot)
- 1 minute walk to SX Sky Bar (upscale cocktail bar)

Getting around
- 7 minute walk to Harrison Red Line Station 
- 5 minute walk to downtown
- 31 minute drive to MDW Airport
- 60 minute drive to ORD Airport

The South Loop is a vibrant blend of notable attractions, beautiful parks, and stunning Lake Michigan views. Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.

Access to the amenities is not available at this time.

The number of overnight guests cannot exceed the maximum occupancy. Up to three visitors are allowed during the day.

License: HL 2671122

This is a central location and prone to noise.

access: Entire 2nd floor apartment.
description:
Quintessential Chicago Greystone with tons of historic charm and character, in Logan Square! Comfortable 1,300 sq ft flat accommodates up to five people. Master bedroom w/ on suite master bath sleeps two in queen bed. Second bedroom sleeps one in twin bed. Large den can be set up to host extra two in queen air mattress. 2nd guest bathroom, full kitchen, cable TV, wifi, washer/dryer.  Short walk to Logan Square blue line stop and all Chicago has to offer!

Comfortable 1,300 sq ft flat accommodates up to five people. Master bedroom w/ on suite master bath sleeps two in queen bed. Second bedroom sleeps one in twin bed. Large den can be set up to host extra two in queen air mattress. 2nd guest bathroom, full kitchen, cable TV, wifi, washer/dryer.  Short walk to Logan Square blue line stop and all Chicago has to offer!

Entire 2nd floor apartment.

3 flat building is owner occupied, your host will be on site on the floor below and is happy to assist you with your stay!

Close to all of Logan Square's hip staples and upstarts- Lula Cafe, Lost Lake, Fat Rice, The Harding Tavern, Revolution, Longman & Eagle, the Burlington, the Owl, Cafe Mustache, Billy Sunday, Scofflaw, all those pinball places, indie coffee joints... etc.

20 minute uber ride to Wrigley Field, 30 on public transit! Steps from the Kimball bus stop; short walk to Fullerton, Kedzie and Milwaukee bus lines and Logan Square blue line stop.

description:
Show up and start living from day one in Chicago with this cozy one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped River North home with stunning  views over the city. (#CHI90)

Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Chicago, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- Dog Park/Run
- Gym
- Roof Deck

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

access: Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.
description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- Fully-equipped kitchen 

Building amenities
- Laundry facilities

South Loop highlights
- Walkability score: 95
- 4 minute walk to Yolk (our favorite brunch spot)
- 4 minute walk to Flo & Santos (delicious pizzeria and pub)

Getting around
- 1 minute walk to Roosevelt Station 
- 5 minute drive to downtown
- 30 minute drive to MDW Airport
- 54 minute drive to ORD Airport

Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.

The South Loop is a vibrant blend of notable attractions, beautiful parks, and stunning Lake Michigan views. Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.

This is a central location and prone to noise.

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.
neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is a vibrant blend of notable attractions, beautiful parks, and stunning Lake Michigan views. Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.
notes: This is a central location and prone to noise.

access:
You will have exclusive access to the entire apartment.
The door is keypad activated with a code you will enter. You will not need to fuss with picking up or dropping off keys....or losing keys and getting locked out! 
Come and go as you please let yourself in and enjoy....its your Chicago apartment!
description:
Great two bed one bath apartment available for your stay in Chicago! Located in Pilsen. The neighborhood is filled with restaurants, bars, cafes, vintage shops, art galleries music venues and more within walking distance. It is right outside of the downtown area, close to the "L" trains that can get you anywhere you would like to go in the city. Newly renovated. Hardwood floors throughout. Brand new furnishings including beds, linen. 4K TV with Nintendo gaming systems and plenty of board games!

The idea was to design the space to be a home away from home, to be your personal private apartment whenever you choose to visit Chicago. 

The apartment is set up exclusively to be used as an airbnb rental for the traveler. When you book with me you will find a clean modern stylish fully furnished apartment to make your own. Nobody lives in the apartment on a regular basis, its for the airbnb community, for travelers, FOR YOU!! 

Its a space for anyone in need of a place to stay, for as long as they like  and if its not booked it sits empty waiting just for you! So you will not have to try to arrange your stay around a strangers belongings, there are no resident pets, the fridge is brand new ice cold clean and empty as is everything else in the house. 

The are two bedrooms one queen bed and one king bed with new high end mattresses. A super comfy giant L shaped sectional with an ottoman to kick up your feet and relax. An inflatable aero bed queen sized mattress if needed to accommodated more guests, with extra linens of course. A nice sized pub table in the kitchen with benches for a quick bite as well as a dining room with traditional table for family dinners or a great place to play a board game! 

I like to travel with family and friends and love having in house entertainment options. I have Monopoly, Chess/Checkers, Connect Four, Battleship and will be adding more. The idea is to have some in home entertainment where you stay to relax and enjoy the company your traveling with. 

You will also have a Nintendo 64 and Original Nintendo (yes from the 80s) with lots of games that can be hooked up to the brand new 55inch 4K HD smart tv to enjoy any downtime you have while not running around the city. You will find a Netflix subscription so you don't miss a beat of the show your catching up on or find something new. There are also plenty of local channels. The tv also has blue tooth dolby digital sound system for theater quality experience that can also be utilized for music from your phone for background music. 

So go ahead pick up a bottle of wine and enjoy coming home to YOUR new Chicago apartment in one of the most diverse, eclectic and unique neighborhoods in Chicago. 

If you're driving in and have a car to park worry not as the house sits on a quoet street with plenty of easy free street parking.

You will have exclusive access to the entire apartment.
The door is keypad activated with a code you will enter. You will not need to fuss with picking up or dropping off keys....or losing keys and getting locked out! 
Come and go as you please let yourself in and enjoy....its your Chicago apartment!

I am available via email or text anytime and will respond ASAP. I am a resident physician training at a nearby hospital and as such I'm usually working long hours. You will have plenty of privacy as such.

With one of the best museums in the city, some fantastic contemporary art galleries and a booming bar and restaurant scene to boot with Michelin quality dining and the best Mexican Food in the city all within a few blocks. 

Pilsen has everything a fun and culture-loving Chicagoan could desire. Pilsen is one of the most recognizable neighborhoods in the city. With a distinct mural or piece of public art adorning a facade in nearly every block, it's not hard to see the artistic culture that's present. Lots of local breweries. Great Mexican bakeries with delicious super cheap eats. Lots of parks close by with many outdoor concerts and festivals throughout the year. There is also a film studio a few blocks away if you feel like trying out for a part. They film Chicago Fire there. And if you feel like buying a beautiful unique motorcycle or planting the seed to buy one in the future I highly recommend you check out  Motoworks a fantastic shop 1 block away.

For supply runs nearby is a Costco, Target, Walmart, movie theaters, outdoor shopping mall. At the end of the block is a great cheap famous 24 hour dinner that'll whip up almost anything you want.

Hospitals are around the corner  including UIC, Rush, Cook County. 15 minute uber ride to Soldier Field, United Center, McCormick convention center, Field Museum, Shed Aquarium, Art Institute,  Navy Peer, China Town and most other Chicago neighborhoods.
The Pink line L train is a quick 2 block walk from the apartment as an alternative....and its a great way to see the City too!

My place.....I mean YOUR NEW APARTMENT is 1 block from the Metra trains, and 2 blocks from the Pink line L train, bike rentals are also next to the pink line. 
I find it incredibly easy and affordable to get around via Uber/Lyft.

Via pink line I am 5 mins away from UIC/RUSH/Cook County hospitals/Universities and 15 mins to downtown. If you are driving there is plenty of free parking off the street.

If you are flying in I am about 40 mins from O'Hare and 20 mins from Midway. You can get to within 2 blocks of YOUR NEW APARTMENT from either airport. 
From O'Hare take the Blue Line and transfer to the Pink Line.  
From Midway take the Orange Line and transfer to the Pink Line.
Should be ~ $5 to arrive by the L train system.

description:
Beautiful and charming downtown winnetka condo. Vintage 1930's unit that was guy rehabbed last year; vintage charm with brand new amenities. The location is directly across the street from the Metra train. It's a 2 min walk and will get you to downtown Chicago in 30 min! Plenty of shopping, dining and very close to Lake Michigan with beach access! If you like comfort and style and also have an affinity for 2 small adorable dogs, you'll love being a guest in my place!

Ample parking in open parking lot. Close to Metra train. Central downtown area with shopping and dining.

Credit card access laundry available on premises. I can provide detergent and dryer sheets!

My pups and I are very friendly and will be available to accommodate any requests or needs you have. I will provide coffee, tea and breakfast selections.

Approx 30 min drive to downtown Chicago and very close to lake michigan

My home is your home! I have premium cable lineup, high speed internet and a Nintendo switch.

description: Fully furnished with either one queen bed or a twin and love-seat sleeper, this Double Studio comes with a kitchen equipped with silverware, dinnerware, cookware and basic appliances. Guests can also make use of a TV set and free, high-speed Wi-Fi in the studio. Enjoy the comforts of home and everything Chicago has to offer in this artsy neighborhood, when you “fly” with the one of a kind aviation-themed Ginosi 747 Apartel. This is a pet-friendly apartment, so if your pet insists on joining you on your trip, for a small fee you’re welcome to bring them along! You'll feel like you're flying first class when you stay at the Ginosi 747 Apartel in Chicago.

access: Guests have access to entire place as well as amenity floor, rooftop pool & deck.
description:
Available for the upcoming holidays and New Year! Modern chic convertible with city views plus amenities in a perfect river north location. Close to everything the city life has to offer! Guest parking in attached garage if needed.

Guests have entire place to themselves, owner will not be there but available by phone for any needs! 24/7 Doorman & Concierge as well.

Guests have access to entire place as well as amenity floor, rooftop pool & deck.

I will not be there as the guests will have the place to themselves. I will always be available by phone!

River North has truly become the heart  of Chicago. River North is prime for major Chicago attractions, architecture, dining and nightlife. From restaurants  to plays, museums and comedy shows, Chicago has it all! With the loop, Michigan Avenue and the lake all close by, it makes it easy to get around and sight see. Hip neighborhoods are just a 10-15 min car/train or bike ride away,  it’s a perfect place to stay for a visit to Chicago. This building is very well known for its location and a great place to live - or stay for an airbnb guest!!

If guests are in need of a spot for a vehicle during there stay, please let me know while booking. Train stops are near by and several bus stops as well. Uber and Lyft are both accessible as well as taxis. The doorman/concierge is there 24/7 to provide any assistance.

Guests will get a key to the apartment from doorman as well as a key fob upon arrival. The key fob is for the amenity floor and to enter the building.

access: The entire apartment is available for your stay.
description:
Spacious and bright with soaring seven-foot windows that actually have an amazing view of downtown, particularly the John Hancock Building. This apartment is vintage Chicago architectural charm. The place is comfortable, tidy, and efficiently located on Ashland Avenue in the heart of ultra-hip Wicker Park; Steps away from a thriving area full of popular restaurants, cafes, boutiques, concert venues, nightlife, etc.. There are convenient public transportation and Uber options from here also.

It is an expansive, high ceiling, three bedroom apartment. Everything you need for a comfortable stay is provided - full size beds, pillows, blankets, towels, toiletries, hair dryer, kitchen, and tv & wifi are all accessible to enhance your stay.

The entire apartment is available for your stay.

I, or my co-host, Nat, am/is available throughout your stay to answer questions that you may have; or recommend local attractions, dining, or nightlife.

Wicker Park is famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.

The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour.

Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up shop to satisfy the on-trend crowds.”

The apartment is located just 0.4 mile from the Blue Line Damen Station (connecting to O’Hare airport) which travels through much of the city. The “9” Ashland Street Bus Stop is one block away - running north and south. Additionally, six blocks away is the Kennedy Expressway Division Street Exit. It is only three miles to downtown Chicago (10 minute Uber ride).

Unfortunately, the apartment is not handicap accessible.

access:
You'll be sharing my living room, kitchen, basement for movies, deck and back yard. Access to deck & garden is through kitchen back door. 
Please wash any used dishes and place in drying rack or on a dish towel.
No guests allowed on second floor, please.
Please ask first if you'd like to bring a guest into my home to visit with you, thanks.
If I have other people visiting my home, I'll let you know where we'll be so you know what space is accessible and okay for you to use in these situations.
description:
Sunny Cape Cod first floor bedroom with view overlooking deck and perennial garden. Next to a private bathroom. Quiet, residential, friendly neighborhood. Public transport (bus & El) is within walking distance. Five minute drive to Lake Michigan. 20-30 minute drive to downtown Chicago. Ideal place to restore between business meetings, visiting Northwestern, or tourist activities.

The decor is eclectic and comfortable, putting guests at ease. Your bathroom has a shower and tub. Make a fire outside or take a nap in the hammock. The deck overlooks a perennial garden. Make yourself at home in several places to sit and relax, talk or read.

You'll be sharing my living room, kitchen, basement for movies, deck and back yard. Access to deck & garden is through kitchen back door. 
Please wash any used dishes and place in drying rack or on a dish towel.
No guests allowed on second floor, please.
Please ask first if you'd like to bring a guest into my home to visit with you, thanks.
If I have other people visiting my home, I'll let you know where we'll be so you know what space is accessible and okay for you to use in these situations.

Breakfast is on your own. You're welcome to store a few items in the refrigerator for  yourself. 
I'll be available to welcome you and help you get settled. If, however, my schedule doesn't allow this, I'll tell you in advance how to let yourself into my home. You'll have a key to come and go as you please. 
Important Note for International Travelers: If you are traveling from outside the U.S., please notify me of this and ensure that you contact me IN ADVANCE with your arrival details while you still have access to internet.

Located in a safe, quiet, residential area in southwest Evanston with several parks nearby. A sculpture park and bike path is 15 minute walk away. The “greenest" synagogue in the U.S. is within walking distance, as well as an ice rink and tennis courts. The lake is a lovely 40 minute walk due East. 

Fabulous restaurants abound in Evanston's several business districts. Local favorite restaurants: Lucky Platter, Prairie Moon, Lou Malnati's, The Union Pizzeria. 
Nearby: Panino's Pizzeria, Curt's Cafe South, Dengeo's. 
Craving Mexican? Try La Principal (amazing) on Main Street; or Wholly Frijoles on Touhy Avenue (its BYOB). 
Bread/pastry lover? Check out artisan amazingness at Hewn on Dempster. 
Dessert, visit family owned business from Chile: Frió Gelato on Dempster Street—made from scratch! 
Need a Massage? I also know of two phenomenal massage therapists to easily book in advance if you're needing extra TLC while you're here.

• Parking: Plenty of close free street parking available. 
• Über and other ride-share services are available in this area.
• El Train: 20 minute walk to South Boulevard station, and a 30 minute ride to downtown Chicago, or for a Cubs game at Wrigley Field. 
• Bus stop: 1 block away, taking you to downtown Evanston and Northwestern's campus in 10 minutes. 
• Other trains take you to Milwaukee for a day trip; visits to small scenic downtowns of Wilmette, Winnetka or Highland Park; or up to the Chicago Botanic Gardens for lunch and stunning garden walking. 

Naturally Speaking: Lake Michigan provides seasonal actives including: swimming, sailing, kayaking, and paddle boarding. Lakefront bike, running and walking paths. The Skokie Lagoons provide fishing, wildlife viewing and opportunities for kayaking or canoeing. Nearby canal offers canoe rentals.

Happy to provide you with any tips or suggestions!

Please leave street shoes at the door.
Tea & coffee available in kitchen as needed. 
Hammock and sky chair for deck.

The “greenest" synagogue in the U.S. is within walking distance, as well as an ice rink and tennis courts. The lake is a lovely 40 minute walk due East. 

Fabulous restaurants abound in Evanston's several business districts. Local favorite restaurants: Lucky Platter, Prairie Moon, Lou Malnati's, The Union Pizzeria. 
Nearby: Panino's Pizzeria, Curt's Cafe South, Dengeo's. 
Craving Mexican? Try La Principal (amazing) on Main Street; or Wholly Frijoles on Touhy Avenue (its BYOB). 
Bread/pastry lover? Check out artisan amazingness at Hewn on Dempster. 
Dessert, visit family owned business from Chile: Frió Gelato on Dempster Street—made from scratch! 
Need a Massage? I also know of two phenomenal massage therapists to easily book in advance if you're needing extra TLC while you're here.
notes:
Please leave street shoes at the door.
Tea & coffee available in kitchen as needed. 
Hammock and sky chair for deck.
space: The decor is eclectic and comfortable, putting guests at ease. Your bathroom has a shower and tub. Make a fire outside or take a nap in the hammock. The deck overlooks a perennial garden. Make yourself at home in several places to sit and relax, talk or read.
summary: Sunny Cape Cod first floor bedroom with view overlooking deck and perennial garden. Next to a private bathroom. Quiet, residential, friendly neighborhood. Public transport (bus & El) is within walking distance. Five minute drive to Lake Michigan. 20-30 minute drive to downtown Chicago. Ideal place to restore between business meetings, visiting Northwestern, or tourist activities.
transit:
• Parking: Plenty of close free street parking available. 
• Über and other ride-share services are available in this area.
• El Train: 20 minute walk to South Boulevard station, and a 30 minute ride to downtown Chicago, or for a Cubs game at Wrigley Field. 
• Bus stop: 1 block away, taking you to downtown Evanston and Northwestern's campus in 10 minutes. 
• Other trains take you to Milwaukee for a day trip; visits to small scenic downtowns of Wilmette, Winnetka or Highland Park; or up to the Chicago Botanic Gardens for lunch and stunning garden walking. 

Naturally Speaking: Lake Michigan provides seasonal actives including: swimming, sailing, kayaking, and paddle boarding. Lakefront bike, running and walking paths. The Skokie Lagoons provide fishing, wildlife viewing and opportunities for kayaking or canoeing. Nearby canal offers canoe rentals.

Happy to provide you with any tips or suggestions!
