description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive

- In-suite laundry
- Fully-equipped kitchen

Near North highlights
- Walkability score: 97
- 8 minute drive to Quartino Ristorante (delicious Italian cuisine)
- 4 minute drive to The Green Door Tavern (comfy, laid-back pub)

Getting around
- 1 mile to Chicago Ave 'L' Station (Brown/Purple Line)
- 10 minute drive to downtown
- 52 minute drive to MDW Airport
- 59 minute drive to ORD Airport

Known as one of Chicago’s most livable and walkable neighborhoods, Near North is the place to be for endless shopping, dining, and entertainment. Fill your day by wandering along the famous Magnificent Mile, admiring the city skyline at the Chicago River, or simply enjoying a drink on one of the many rooftops. From sun up to sun down, the lively streets of this neighborhood are bustling with people.

There’s no cable. We’ve provided an HDMI cord for streaming.

This apartment is available for stays of 30 nights or more. If this Sonder isn't open for your dates, please contact us to see what else we have available.
house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $500 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

From sun up to sun down, the lively streets of this neighborhood are bustling with people.

access: Guests will be able to make use of the kitchen, bathroom and dining space in addition to the bedroom.
description:
An exceptional experience in a wonderful 2nd floor apartment located in Chicago's Chinatown, featuring my art collection curated throughout the years. 
15 minutes away from the loop by train or bus. 
Lots of wonderful places to eat just down the street and a unique community just out the door! 
A wonderful bed awaits you after a long day of sightseeing or working. 
Please be sure to read the entire listing before booking. 
Welcome to contact me regarding any concerns.

You get a private bedroom with a closet, hangers, iron and a full size bed ideal for two but has worked for three small persons. I also have a twin mattress available for a third person. 

There is central heating and air conditioning throughout the apartment to keep you comfortable throughout all the temperature shifts that Chicago can throw at you. You will also get access to the guest Wi-Fi network upon your arrival. 

The kitchen has a stove and a small assortment of pots, pans and cooking utensils for you cook your meals in  and a refrigerator you are welcome to use as well.  


The apartment features a clean open layout with a combined dining room and living room.

Around the apartment you'll see works from some of my favorite artists as well as some of my photographs from my travels.

Guests will be able to make use of the kitchen, bathroom and dining space in addition to the bedroom.

I'll be available to answer any questions you may have about the city while you're around. 
If you need a quiet space to come to after a long day of work, touring around the city, or raging at a festival,  you'll have no problem here. 
I've also had the pleasure of sharing meals, drinks and dances with some of guests, I'll have no problem helping you get the most out of your time in Chicago.

Just two blocks from Wentworth (one of the main strips in Chinatown) you'll have easy access to plenty of delicious dinning options. Duck, Dim Sum, Hot Pot/Steamboat,  Noodles, Bakeries, Tea cafes, Dessert cafes, Korean and Vietnamese are some of the many options. There is also a taco stand and the best sandwich in the world (according to USA Today 2015) right across the highway. 

There are a couple of museums in the neighborhood one dedicated to the History of Chinatown and the other to Asian art. Various gift shops can be found as well as small Chinese grocery stores. There is western pharmacy down the street as well if you need to get western snack or easy foods as well. 

The are some lovely parks to walk around, one to note is Ping Tom park where you can get a great view of the skyline and during the summer months also has a water taxi to downtown. If you're lucky you might also catch a movie or live band.

The Red Line train is the easiest way to get around the city, but there are plenty of buses to take you to McCormick Place, the Loop, Bridgeport or Pilsen. 

The apartment is also close to several highways and there is free neighborhood parking in the streets a half block away.

The Cermak/Chinatown MRT/ Rail station is a 10 minute walk which will take you to the loop in less than 5 minutes.

The neighborhood is also in between McCormick Place convention center and the trendy Pilsen and Bridgeport neighborhoods. Uber can get you to either destination in about 5 minutes. You can walk to McCormick Place in about half an hour.

You are renting the guestroom in my apartment.

The bedroom is ideal for two persons but it is available for three if you are looking for a budget friendly accommodation. I've had several very positive experiences with this option so I keep offering it.

I prefer to greet my guests in person but if I'm at work or head to bed early I leave key for my guests in a key safe outside the building.

access: Three keys will be given: one for the buildings front door, a second for the units front door and a third for the utility room where the washer and dryer are located.
description:
Warm and spacious apartment located in the culture rich neighborhood of Pilsen.

Warm and spacious apartment located in the culture rich neighborhood of Pilsen! Wake up and grab a bite from one of the many coffee shops just a block away on 18th street. Spend the afternoon at the National Museum of Mexican Fine Arts or stroll around the neighborhood and discover the street art and murals that the neighborhood has to offer. Head down to Canton Rejio and experience authentic Mexican cuisine or head to Los Cómales for a more casual vibe. Top off the meal with some Mexican palettes from one of the many ice cream shops or experience some of Pilsen’s night life at at some of the most notorious bars Chicago has to offer.

Three keys will be given: one for the buildings front door, a second for the units front door and a third for the utility room where the washer and dryer are located.

I am available to my guest 24/7 via call or text.

Two minute walk to the Pink Line stop on 18th street which will bring you directly to downtown Chicago in no less than fifteen minutes. There’s also the #18 buss which will take you directly to the downtown neighborhood of South Loop. Pilsen also offers other forms of transportation nearby such as Divvy bikes and electric scooters.

We provide pots and pans, forks, spoons and knives, bowls and plates as well as cups, a toaster and a coffee machine. The unit also contains a dishwasher and microwave. Building is equipped with cameras providing 24/7 outside surveillance.

additional_house_rules:
The first rule is Gratitude to you for choosing The Dickens Place!  :)

There's absolutely No smoking  on premises, but outside is ok. 

No Parties, I live at property and I will NOT allow extra guests or parties be advised.  Don't waste your reservation money as this is strictly monitored. Violation of house rules cancels your reservation at no refund. 

No extra guests brought in after booking amount is set, Only paying guests. allowed in unit, Although a visiting sibling is ok.

Please note, There maybe ID verification at checkin. 


Please ensure you have correct guest count. for example if you note One guest,  there will only be one bed available.  Some guests say 2 guests then 3 show up and no bed available so please be accurate:) I can setup up to 2 queen size beds, one in (private)  bedroom the other in living room common area, but you need to let me know. :) 

Please be punctual on checkout time.  Which is 10am at the latest.  Only because other guests await. :) 
Enjoy Chicago! :)

Please leave place as you found it. Except linens and trash we’ll take care of them but if you move anything please put back in original location please. As this is a home.

description:
My place is close to Downtown Chicago (via train), Palmer Square, Logan Square, Wicker Park and only a 20 minute train to Millenium Park, Michigan Ave and Museums. 
You’ll love my place because its in the trendiest neighborhood in Chicago, near 24h public transit, the full kitchen, near Hipster nightlife, quick and easy connections to and from Ohare airport (Blue Line CTA). My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids),  it’s easy access lower level

Entire apt in Logan square central location! Close to everything Chicago has to offer! 

Walk to public trans,  either buses or train. 

A 700 soft Appartment upscale modern decor bath new kitchen with new Appliances stocked with goodies for your stay. 

 it sleeps 4 comfortably

Cable provided with hundreds of channels (5000) also includes
A small dinette with free wifi access. :) 

Luggage holding before and after is available.

New kitchen, new bath, free  parking available!
with complimentary wine. Snacks, soft drinks and water.  Clean linen and towels plus toiletries.if you need Luggage holding prior or after holding area available..

At minimum at check-in and check-out. I live in home. You'll have entire garden level to yourself. 
I'm available.

One of the safest Chicago neighborhood with a great deal to do, restaurants, bars, biking, sightseeing, close to all attractions

Chicago transit 20ft away. Train 1/2 mike away ( blue line)  the new 606 just blocks away ( biking) 
Or if you drive all downtown attractions just 15 mins away. ( I90-94)  5 mins away!  To all Chicago has to offer. All Museums, Navy Pier, magnificent Mile shopping, Lake Front, Zoo and great nightlife.

Where the MOVIE!  " The Perfect Christmas Present " was filmed in location filmed Feb - 17'  was released Nov. 4th 2017 by Hallmark movies Also Private gated home. Clean family owned and maintained.Spa type Bath. If you travel  for your use with free wifi & cable channels 5000, luggage hold both before or after. Parking is free! Sorry not ada accessible as unit is lower garden unit with a couple of steps.
house_rules:
The first rule is Gratitude to you for choosing The Dickens Place!  :)

There's absolutely No smoking  on premises, but outside is ok. 

No Parties, I live at property and I will NOT allow extra guests or parties be advised.  Don't waste your reservation money as this is strictly monitored. Violation of house rules cancels your reservation at no refund. 

No extra guests brought in after booking amount is set, Only paying guests. allowed in unit, Although a visiting sibling is ok.

Please note, There maybe ID verification at checkin. 


Please ensure you have correct guest count. for example if you note One guest,  there will only be one bed available.  Some guests say 2 guests then 3 show up and no bed available so please be accurate:) I can setup up to 2 queen size beds, one in (private)  bedroom the other in living room common area, but you need to let me know. :) 

Please be punctual on checkout time.  Which is 10am at the latest.  Only because other guests await. :) 
Enjoy Chicago! :)

Please leave place as you found it. Except linens and trash we’ll take care of them but if you move anything please put back in original location please. As this is a home.

description:
Nice spacious studio in an incredible location right on Lake Shore Drive. Everything you need.

This is a nice bright modern open space with lots of windows.

I live in Chicago in the neighborhood, so I will be around to help with anything you need at any time.

The Gold Coast is probably the most prestigious neighborhood in all of Chicago. The building is surrounded by old Chicago Mansions and historically preserved buildings.

Public transportation including buses, taxis, and the underground train station is very close to the building.

access: Guests also have access to the building's fitness center.
description:
Please note that pictures are of a similar Domio unit in Chicago.

Complete your Chicago experience by staying in this elegant home! Centrally located in the heart of Chicago, this stunning space was thoughtfully designed to capture local flair and make you feel at home. Whether traveling solo, with friends, or with family, see the best of art, architecture, and cuisine that Chicago has to offer and have an unforgettable experience staying at this Domio.

All Domios are designed with style and comfort in mind and this space is no different. This 2 bedroom and 2 bath home boasts a brand new living room, luxury furniture, and customized finishes. In addition to a fully-stocked kitchen with state-of-the-art appliances, guests will be pleased to find hand-picked decor and artwork throughout the home. 

Bedroom 1:
Queen bed

Bedroom 2:
Queen bed

Common Area:
Sofa bed
Air mattress

Guests also have access to the building's fitness center.

We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

Chicago Registration: Pending

Please note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago.

additional_house_rules:
The unit accommodates 4.   There will be an extra charge for guests and guests are expected to let the host know if there will be additional guests. 

For the comfort of future guests, absolutely no smoking or pets.
Be good neighbors! Our 2nd-floor neighbors (Zack and Sarah) are very courteous; please try not to make much noise. Let me know if you need anything or if you have any questions.
Check in is after 3:00 
Check out is before 11:00 a.m.
Rules:    No smoking, loud music or parties. Outside gatherings have made arrangements with neighbors to must turn down the sound, extinguish all fires by midnight and continue party inside with music and played soft enough to not disturb neighbor.  From midnight till 7:00 there will be not disturbing to neighbors sleep. 
The block and building is quiet as well as for the  building and neighboring buildings.  Music is played could be at a level that it does not disturb people.    ]

There are optional bars that are open until at 2 AM  and within the vicinity of the neighborhood.  There is also one that closes  at 4:00am.   

This is a family building with working  adults needing to sleep  and ask that your respect of these policies are agreed upon with the neighbors be upheld to maintain community neighborhood policies made with the neighborhood community when working with the Steering committee. Please extinguish all fire and empty the trash.

description:
This spacious light garden (lower level )unit is 2 BR & is great for singles & families traveling. It's child friendly with a pack & play & high chair.  There are 2 BR & a 20" high airbed for extra  guests. Near a park, shops restaurants,CTA &trains.

Beautiful spacious unit near Foster and Damen on the North Side of Chicago. 
•2 bedrooms
•Full modern kitchen 
•Wireless internet
•Premium cable
•Parking Included
•Laundry Access

The garden level unit is a large open space approximately 1000 square feet on the garden ( basement)  level of a classic Chicago brick condominium building.  The garden level floor was recently dug down to allow for extra space and has a new floor with cherrywood flooring.  The space is totally green and energy efficient with new heating and air conditioning system for the building.  I live on the 1st floor of this condominium building.  The garden level has a spacious, sun lit eat-in kitchen, granite counter tops, Cherry wood floors, recessed lighting, walk in closets, etc.  Bedroom #1 has a queen size bed the bedroom #2 has a full size bed.  The unit has premium cable, wireless internet and easy access to separate spacious laundry room. There is a lovely patio and yard. One private parking space in the car port in back off the street is included and part of the garden unit.  Garden units in Chicago are slightly below street level as you can see in the photos but this is all recent permasealed, dry open, light, dry with access to your own thermostat and great internet and cable connection. 
There is access to a bus 1 block away and the times are available on our bus tracker. I am 5 blocks away from the Brown line which goes to Wrigley Field, Lincoln Park and downtown.  I have a detailed bus & rail map with literature on Chicago sights and current events..  The Chicago CTA map is available on transitchicago.com and just under one mile a mile to the Metra (Lawrence stop).  Divy bikes have come to Chicago in June 2013 and there are 750 bikes and 750 stations.  These bikes are available 24/7 every day of the year.  The Chicago Garden level units can be found throughout the city. Our garden( basement ) apartments refers to an unit which has its square footage at or below ground level is referred to by Chicagoans as a “garden unit.”  From the back garden down it is 4 steps and allows for easy unloading of luggage into the garden unit from the back entrance. The photos show indicate where ground level is.    
The neighborhood is classic Chicago- fun and very convenient. We are located on a beautiful tree lined street with little traffic.  It could be considered West Andersonville/ Bowmanville or North Lincoln Square. Either way, we are walking distance from some of the best parks, unique shopping and most amazing dining options Chicago has to offer. Winnemac Park is less than 2 blocks away and has a lovely jogging/walking path, a great playground and (limited) swimming pool access. There is a Thai restaurant, coffee internet sandwich and dessert cafe about 1 block away that has a calendar of events called Let them eat Chocolate.  

 The main shopping streets of Lincoln Square and Andersonville neighborhoods are about 15 minutes away on foot, 5 minutes on bike. It is a 5 block walk to the Brown line,. The Damen bus stop is 1.5 blocks away and the Western bus is 3 blocks away.  These buses can be tracked with great accuracy with the bus tracker system on the computer and available on Chicago's site called transitchicago.com.   

A recent review on this neighborhood stated " Lived by Winnemac park for several years & really enjoyed it. Quiet at night, yet really convenient to a lot: Andersonville, Lincoln Square, Galter Life Center, Damen & Lawrence shopping, Metra north & south, Brown Line. Easy to hop bus to Jeff Park to get Blue Line to airport or east to get over to the lake (also by bike)

We have a pack and play for an infant and a 20 inch high twin size Coleman inflatable bed for a toddler or extra guest.  

Guests are responsible are daily up-keeping of the unit, there is free laundry and the detergent is free,  the unit is equipped with a vacuum cleaner, sweeper for the floors and all cleaning supplies are in the unit. If a guest stays beyond two weeks they can the option of paying for the cleaning women to do a freshen up at some point if they choose and pay her directly.  
The longer rate is a discounted rate and the standard $65.00 is applied but the laundry is free and in the next room and the unit is fully equipped with cleaning supplies.

There is a garden open spot directly behind the back privacy fence gate that pulls you right up to the back garden and entrance to the yard and back building door for easing loading of luggage or shopping groceries..

I like to personally meet each of my guests if possible otherwise one of my adult children will meet you and lastly the the keys could be left for you.  I will check in to meet you if possible or else see how I can be of assistance to you in your trip to Chicago and I am available to call or text if anything is needed.  I let the guests determine how much interaction they want as they are often visiting family members and already know the city or sometimes it is a first visit and would like suggestions.  For those who are open to the best restaurants, activities and things to do I am a great resource being a native Chicagoan and know the city well.
I fill up quite quickly and  if you have gone through my reviews you will see that they are quite consistent.   It is usually closed when I vacation or need and plan painting and keeping it updated.  So book it now as most likely it will be gone when you come back.

The Neighborhood

Lincoln Square is a, vibrant neighborhood with many shops, eateries, bars and cafes. The Historic "El" Train Line has 2 conveniently located stops (on the Brown Line) in Lincoln Sq. if you wish to explore the shops of downtown Chicago or take in a Cubs game at Wrigley Field. There is easy access to the lakefront just 2 miles east for an impressive ride along Lake Michigan. Check out Lincoln Square's antique shops, many different ethnic restaurants, theater groups, or the concert schedule at the famous "Old Town School of Folk Music" for upcoming performances. I leave a current copy of the Reader which has the week’s events listed.  

Bowmansville is a neighborhood within Lincoln Square community and is also close to Andersonville which is a Swedish neighborhood top rated Chicago stop filled with restaurants, shops, the Swedish Museum, Women and Children's Bookstore and much more.   The unit's major cross streets closet too are Admen and Foster.  That is where the unit is (see map).  There is a Free Summer Concert Series begins on Thursday, June 5! Performances occur every Thursday evening from 6:30pm - 9:00pm in the Square through August 28.

During your stay, you will have convenient access to different types of public transportation making getting around other areas of the city very easy. One block south. of the apt. on Damen is the bus stop and in 6 blocks is the Damen Brown line stop.  Just four blocks east is Clark st  and all of the shops and stores of Andersonville.  The trains typically run every 15 minutes apart during daytime hours and less so in the evening hours. The Metra train can be found six blocks south east and will terminate at the Ogilvie Station in western portion of downtown Chicago close to the Willis Tower (Sears Tower) for a visit to the Skydeck! Buses also run on larger streets throughout the city and UBER and taxi cabs are readily available on most main streets and to come directly to the unit.. The City's bike sharing system, DIVY bikes, are conveniently located 1 blocks away if you prefer to ride around.  In your apt I have provided maps and schedules of the mass transit system for your convenience. There is convenient public transportation and a car port located in the back of the  house for exclusive use of the garden unit.  There is a bus one block away and the CTA tracker for traveling East on bus #92 or South on Damen, bus #50  gives the number of minutes before it arrives.  There is the "L" train stop about 6 blocks away that takes you to Cubs Park, Lincoln Park, Gold Coast and downtown.
house_rules:
The unit accommodates 4.   There will be an extra charge for guests and guests are expected to let the host know if there will be additional guests. 

For the comfort of future guests, absolutely no smoking or pets.
Be good neighbors! Our 2nd-floor neighbors (Zack and Sarah) are very courteous; please try not to make much noise. Let me know if you need anything or if you have any questions.
Check in is after 3:00 
Check out is before 11:00 a.m.
Rules:    No smoking, loud music or parties. Outside gatherings have made arrangements with neighbors to must turn down the sound, extinguish all fires by midnight and continue party inside with music and played soft enough to not disturb neighbor.  From midnight till 7:00 there will be not disturbing to neighbors sleep. 
The block and building is quiet as well as for the  building and neighboring buildings.  Music is played could be at a level that it does not disturb people.    ]

There are optional bars that are open until at 2 AM  and within the vicinity of the neighborhood.  There is also one that closes  at 4:00am.   

This is a family building with working  adults needing to sleep  and ask that your respect of these policies are agreed upon with the neighbors be upheld to maintain community neighborhood policies made with the neighborhood community when working with the Steering committee. Please extinguish all fire and empty the trash.

additional_house_rules: I get up each day around 7 and work from home in the mornings. I get home from work on most nights around 7pm and go to bed around 11.  I would appreciate it if guests were in and quiet by midnight. There is no smoking in the house, but you are welcome to smoke on the back deck as long as you use an ashtray. You are free to store food in the fridge and warm things up in the microwave. There are disposable plates, cups, napkins and silverware in your room for your use. Please dispose of all food related trash in the trashcan by the kitchen to keep bugs out of your room. I would appreciate open communication about your schedule during your stay so I know when to expect you.

access: There is one bathroom for us to share. There is also a very large kitchen where you can store things in the fridge and use the microwave. There is a nice back deck and backyard that you are welcome to utilize. There is no washer and dryer for use in the building, but there is a laundromat just 2 blocks away.
description:
A private room is available in the upstairs of a small frame bungalow on Chicago's northwest side. This is a 30 minute drive or a 45 minute bus ride from downtown. The room is large and has a futon bunk bed, table with chairs and clothes rack. One person and several cats and dogs live in the house. The host is home at all times when guests are there, so communicating about schedules is important. The host is generally gone during the midday for work while guests are out in the city.

The guest bedroom is upstairs. There are only two rooms upstairs, the guest room and the cat room which has a couch and TV. The whole upstairs would be yours to use.

There is one bathroom for us to share. There is also a very large kitchen where you can store things in the fridge and use the microwave. There is a nice back deck and backyard that you are welcome to utilize. There is no washer and dryer for use in the building, but there is a laundromat just 2 blocks away.

Since we will be sharing space, I will be home at all times when guests are in my house. I do not give out a house key. We need to coordinate when you would expect to be at the house, so that I can make sure to be there for you. I am gone during the midday at work. Most guests are out of the house by around 10 or 11 am and return in the evening after 8pm. I am happy to hang out with you when possible to share ideas for your visit, but I'm also fine to leave you be if you prefer. Open communication about your schedule, before and during your visit, would be greatly appreciated.

The house is in the Belmont Cragin neighborhood of Chicago. It is a very residential street with lots of families and caring neighbors. I enjoy interacting with my neighbors so we can improve our community. It is a quiet street away from the hustle and bustle of the central part of the city, but close enough to get to all the fun city sites by car or public transit.

The house is two blocks away from the main bus lines of Cicero, Fullerton, Grand and Armitage. The house is a short walk from the Metra line, and one bus ride away from the blue, red or brown CTA lines. It takes about 30 minutes to get downtown by car and about 45 minutes by bus. Uber and Lyft are very popular and easy to utilize in Chicago.

You are free to store food in the fridge and warm things up in the microwave. There are disposable plates, cups, napkins and silverware in your room for your use. Please dispose of all food related trash in the trashcan by the kitchen to keep bugs out of your room. I would appreciate open communication about your schedule during your stay so I know when to expect you.

We need to coordinate when you would expect to be at the house, so that I can make sure to be there for you. I am gone during the midday at work. Most guests are out of the house by around 10 or 11 am and return in the evening after 8pm. I am happy to hang out with you when possible to share ideas for your visit, but I'm also fine to leave you be if you prefer. Open communication about your schedule, before and during your visit, would be greatly appreciated.
neighborhood_overview: The house is in the Belmont Cragin neighborhood of Chicago. It is a very residential street with lots of families and caring neighbors. I enjoy interacting with my neighbors so we can improve our community. It is a quiet street away from the hustle and bustle of the central part of the city, but close enough to get to all the fun city sites by car or public transit.
space: The guest bedroom is upstairs. There are only two rooms upstairs, the guest room and the cat room which has a couch and TV. The whole upstairs would be yours to use.
summary: A private room is available in the upstairs of a small frame bungalow on Chicago's northwest side. This is a 30 minute drive or a 45 minute bus ride from downtown. The room is large and has a futon bunk bed, table with chairs and clothes rack. One person and several cats and dogs live in the house. The host is home at all times when guests are there, so communicating about schedules is important. The host is generally gone during the midday for work while guests are out in the city.
transit: The house is two blocks away from the main bus lines of Cicero, Fullerton, Grand and Armitage. The house is a short walk from the Metra line, and one bus ride away from the blue, red or brown CTA lines. It takes about 30 minutes to get downtown by car and about 45 minutes by bus. Uber and Lyft are very popular and easy to utilize in Chicago.

additional_house_rules:
****bookings without reviews will have to provide an ID via the Airbnb messaging system or at check in. LOCAL, one night stays must provide IDS of all guests via messaging system PRIOR to check in. NO UNAUTHORIZED GUESTS ALLOWED****

NO SMOKING IN THE UNIT. $200 fine + cleaning fees.

NO SHOES in the apartment (its a Japanese thing). We have provided slippers for you. It keeps the place cleaner. If you have a pet we can consider it based on a case to case basis but please contact me first. 

Please no one under 21 yrs old without a parent or guardian. Thank you.

Please clean any dishes you use. If you leave a few glasses it's no biggie however if you leave a sink full of dishes there will be an additional $25 fee. My cleaning lady is on a strict schedule and charges extra for the time it takes her. So PLEASE don't leave a sink full of dishes! Thanks!

Please be HONEST about how many guests are staying. There is a SURCHARGE for deception...JUST BE HONEST. The building has cameras! Additional guests  without prior notification will be charged DOUBLE the nightly guest rate. 

ABSOLUTELY NO parties! You will immediately forfeit you stay without a refund. *IF YOU ARE TRYING TO BE SLICK AND BOOK TO THROW A PARTY AND/OR THEN TRY TO CANCEL: I WILL KEEP WHATEVER MONEY YOU PAY PER THE CANCELLATION POLICY. 

I want to preface the following by saying 95% of our guests leave our places in amazing condition. We are very understanding about small messes that may have been overlooked as I know I am by no means perfect. That being said the following is to address the 5% who may not understand quite how airbnb works yet. 
1. We are not a hotel. 
2. We are not your personal maids. 

While there is a cleaning fee, the fee is to cover changing of linens, washing of towels and "normal" cleaning of the kitchen, bathroom and living areas. What is not covered and WILL incur an extra fee are the following: 

1. A pile of dishes left in the sink (violates house rules)
2. Excessive kitchen messes such as cooking grease all over the stove.
3. Excessive food on the floors (I dont mean a few crumbs-I mean it looked like someone was feeding pigeons).
4. Chewing gum ground into the furniture (yes, that has actually happened).
5. OBVIOUS wearing of shoes in the unit (we are a no-shoes house- see house rules) ie shoes foot prints, tracked in dirt and mud.
5. Anything else above and beyond what is considered "normal" cleaning. 
6. smoking in the unit will AUTOMATICALLY  incur a $200 fee. 

Again- this ISNT the majority of our guests and we understand things can be overlooked. Upon an "excessive cleaning" situation, I will not leave any review, I will simply send a request for an extra cleaning fee (usually around $25-50) depending on how much extra time it took to clean. Thank you for your understanding.

access: The entire apartment is accessible.
description:
2 bdrm/1ba that sleeps 6 (ideal for 4 or less) in fantastic location in River West/ Noble Square close to downtown. Tons of restaurants within walking distance. Plenty of street parking and right off the expressway. Premium channels and wifi. 2 queen size high quality memory foam mattresses w/ 1000 thread count sheets. FREE street parking and IN UNIT laundry. If this unit is booked please check my other listing located UPSTAIRS. I will match any price differences also.

***NOT CORPORATE OWNED***

Sunny, bright, well furnished apartment in River West/ Noble square neighborhood. Tons of great restaurants within walking distance. Starbucks around the corner. Laundry is available IN the unit along with a large flat screen tv with netflix, hulu, hbogo and local channels. There is also a Bluetooth speaker to sync up your music. Wifi included as well.  "Alexa" is also available. Ask her to play your favorite music or find out what the weather will be like for the day. Seperate room with dining room table if you need to sit down to eat or use it as a work table. Both bedrooms have queen size luxury memory foam mattresses and 1000tc sheets and duvets (ALL of which-including the mattress pads are cleaned between EACH guest). The sofa will fold down so a 5th person can sleep there but the aerobed is more comfortable and will also sleep 2. While it is listed to sleep up to 6, I did that in case people have children they need accomodations for. The apartment itself is perfectly suited for 4 adults. If you decide to go with 6 just be aware it will be a little cramped. Bedding is included. Toiletries, soap, and towels are also included. There is a kruig coffee maker (coffee pods included), microwave, toaster oven, full size stove and fridge. PLENTY OF FREE STREET PARKING ALSO! For security reasons we have a camera on the EXTERIOR of the building. With that being said please be honest with how many guests are staying over also. If this unit is booked please check out my other places!

The entire apartment is accessible.

I can be as available as needed. I am always more than happy to help put together an itinerary. 

.....Also PLEASE, PLEASE let me address any issues that would warrant ANYTHING LESS THAN A 5 STAR RATING. Loud neighbor, broken appliance etc. (Anything less than 5 stars - even 4 stars is considered "bad" on airbnb and takes multiple 5 star ratings to make up). If a host's average falls below 80% "5 star rating" we may lose certain distinctions on the website or be pulled off entirely. Thank you.)

River West is the closest "real neighborhood" next to downtown Chicago. Its minutes away from almost everything you want to see and do. The blue line is down the street and there is plenty of FREE street parking if you rent a car.

Blue line is walking distance along with many bus lines. It is also very affordable to take an Uber to many sites. There is also a divvy bike station right next to the Starbucks two blocks away. 

•Magnificent Mile 3 miles
•Water Tower 2 miles
•United Center 3.4 miles
•Willis (Sears) Tower 3.6 miles
•Soldier Field 6.5miles
•Wicker Park Neighborhood <1 mile
•Logan Sq. Neighborhood 3 miles
•McCormick Place 5.6 miles

You really are in a strategically well placed neighborhood if you stay here... And parking is FREE.

PARKING: there is free parking on the opposite side of the street from the building. There is also parking on the same side of the street however it is restricted in the evenings so be aware of those times. There is also free parking one block down the street as well. The neighborhood is very safe to walk around in.

EARLY CHECK-IN/LATE CHECK OUT: IF it is available, anything prior to NOON will incur an additional $25 fee. 9am being the earliest check in allowed. Any checkOUT from 3pm-6pm (IF available) will also be allowed with an additional $25. Anything earlier or later can be discussed (IF available).

Please NO SMOKING in the unit. There is a $100 smoking fee if we find that the house rules were not followed. Thank you

description:
This townhouse is the one you've been waiting for! A hidden gem with 4 levels of living space PLUS a back deck for summer grilling and entertaining.  Open concept main floor with a large granite island, shaker cabinets, stainless steel appliances.  The master suite spans the entire 3rd floor and features a walk-in closet, huge master bathroom with jetted soaker tub, double vanity and separate shower.  The 2nd floor is laid out with two large bedrooms and a full-sized stackable washer and dryer .

The Frank Lloyd Wright Home a Studio has served as a magnet for architects and fans of Prairie Style architecture for years.  The home, at 951 Chicago Avenue in Oak Park, was completed in 1889 and was Wrights first project where he had complete artistic control.   Over the 20 years he lived there, it served as his site for experimentation as he made two major additions to the home.  The National Parks Service declared the home and studio a National Historic Landmark in 1976 and it draws an international crowd of visitors every year.  Visitors come not only to tour the home but also to participate in the many programs hosted by the Frank Lloyd Trust each year.

Frank Lloyd Wright Home and Studio guided tours are daily from 9am to 4:15pm

Access to public transportation is within close walking distance.
